Reviews.Title: “Nice modern rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: Ms_Moggy
Reviews.Content: This is a really great location near to all the shopping and the Marina Bay. It's convenient for public transport (important in Singapore) and we travelled by the underground railway / Metro, which is superb. The rooms are modern, ours had a super double sized shower, and everything we wanted. The beds were hard, but we asked for extra duvets to soften them, and they were given to us, no problem. Breakfast busy and chaotic and not a brilliant choice, but acceptable. Wi-Fi very expensive and had to be purchased from the business centre, which was quite a performance. The two sets of lifts are confusing at first, but you can work it out after a while. Quite hard to co-ordinate meeting up with friends, though. Sky Bar beautiful and under-used. Fabulous views from here. Don't waste money on the Singapore Flyer; come here for a drink and step out onto the balconies with your camera. FAB.

Reviews.Title: “MOULD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen D
Reviews.Content: The first room we were given was awful! The level of mould in the bathroom was disgusting! After complaining we were put into another room where the mould was slightly less but just as disgusting. The third room was better but that mould was still present and became worse after using the shower a few times.Seeing as we were only there for 4 nights we decided to put up with it but I would never stay there again. The housekeeping was poor, the room was not vacuumed the whole time we were there and there was wallpaper peeling off the wall.Seeing as there are so many hotels in Singapore to compete against, I am amazed this hotel is still in business.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but this hotel is pretty ordinary besides”
Reviews.Author: BromleyJules
Reviews.Content: We had an issue when checking in, there wasnt a room available with a double bed and we never really got back a good vibe in the 3 days after that this was a well run hotel. This was made all the worse by the fact the staff member who checked us in kept referring to the fact that we could have paid extra and got a better room and been assured of a double bed. It would appear the hotel and its staff rests on the laurels of its location the majority of staff seem pretty smug without being friendly or caring. Every dealing with staff was never particularly pleasant and you got the feeling they were just doing what was necessary to get rid of you. We have been checked out for 4 days and as it happens we are still waiting for the hotel to refund back to us our $150 SGD room charge deposit. its a real pity that this hotel seems to lack a strong customer commitment because its in a great location and the MRT station across the road makes anywhere in Singapore city an easy subway trip away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Manojith P
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Singapore. But I prefer this most because I like the location,the Coleman street. It is not as busy as orchard. And I used to stay in Premier club. The staff and the service also really nice. Especially I love the sky lounge. I think it is worth for the money we spend.

Reviews.Title: “My stay”
Reviews.Author: Bvesh
Reviews.Content: My stay in this hotel was pleasent.THere where a few goo things about it and a few things that they could improve.location is kin of good very lively all day but quiet at night.there is a mall that is walking distance it would take 5min(raffles city) and an it mall just behin the hotel 2min walk.the hotel has the nice cozy feeling with a big lobby and with a relaxing atmosphere and its a good hotel for families as they can help with tours. My complain is that the room can be very dusty and some rooms are really small but other than that the hotel is quite good and the breakfast is really delicious with allot of variety i have stayed here a few times and over all its a good hotel especialy if your coming with your family

Reviews.Title: “dangerous levels of mould”
Reviews.Author: dawn p
Reviews.Content: I have travelled around the world and stayed in many 3,4,and 5 star rated hotels.This is my 1st ever review of a hotel, I felt so strongly about it I thought that I would share my thoughts. After being told that we couldn't check in for at least 4 hours we sat back and watched others getting their keys. We explained that we had just come from a 14 hour flight from england and were given a room with a supposed upgrade. The room was 1335. The excelsior should be highly embarrased by the quality of this room. The bathroom had dangerous levels of mould in it and the rest of the room was very tired and poorly maintained. Spoke to several other hotel guests and they said that their rooms were much the same. Great location but would benefit from a visit from a health inspector.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Chander_62
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and within easy access to most places. The room was clean and tidy with good views. It is a short walk from the Town Hall MRT. Can take a MRT from the airport and it takes about half of an hour to the Town Hall station. Cost $2 single.

Reviews.Title: “Not that good”
Reviews.Author: kitya_11
Reviews.Content: One night if you have to…We stayed 3 nights…The staff were ok …One lady at reception was outstanding…our room was dirty and the shower you could eat as many mushrooms as you like of the back of the toilet door…mildew everywhere in the bathroom.. I asked for this to be addressed and the cleaning lady pulled me up and said she had too much to do!!!!! I demanded a room change….Breakfast was inadequate…I would say that this hotel is overpriced for what you get. I would not recommend staying here…what you see on the web is not what you get for sure. Location was great for getting about…maybe I am a little spoilt in traveling…but I do expect if its advertised you should get it…you can’t swing a cat in the guest room

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if possible”
Reviews.Author: johnedward54
Reviews.Content: Arrived at midnight after a long flight to find checkin staff accused the travel agent of making an incorrect booking when we queried additional charges for a superior room for which we had booked ourselves. We had also requested a non smoking room, but the staff member could not guarantee that either. Found that our room was located immediately above 2 airconditioning towers that operated 22 hours perday. Surely at that time of night the hotel would not have been full.Water in our shower that evening was cold as was it was cold the morning of our departure. As our earlier dealings with the desk staff had been so hostile we did not think our complaints would have been resolved. It was interesting that when we been hassled over extra chrge another arrival was being subject to the same treatment. Speaking to other people on the airport bus on the way out they had been hassled about extra unwanted room charges, but unike our cold shower they had only hot water. Seems strange that a hotel that markets itself to toursits could be so untourist friendly. Pros: room was in excellent condition, almost new, but located next to a jet engine.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: zenith1234
Reviews.Content: Had a great time staying in the hotel.The view from the sky lounge is to die for.The hotel is ideally located with clarke quay and boat quay, raffles city, a stone throw away. However the rooms are high priced. Overall a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staying in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie60PethWA
Reviews.Content: The front stafff were unbeiveablly helpful when our booking were mixed up, not their fault. The merals were very expensive for not much in the way of quality or size. We ate at the cafe next door for most brakfasts and out in Singapore for the others. Well situated for all activities and we could walk to most places including Raffles. Rooms very clean and the hotel staff always came back if we were not ready when they called. Nothing was too much trouble. I choose the hotel because it had disabled rooms and was close to Raffles where we were aternding a family wedding. Would I stay there again yes for it's access to activities we wanted. We were allocated a large room (by some standards) with three beds. We took rhis option as it was next door to my 91 year old aunt in the disabled room . The hotel badly needs an overhaul. Probably better value but good when I need to be central to visit with a person in a wheelchair

Reviews.Title: “Needs another renovation”
Reviews.Author: JEmmanuelLasPinas
Reviews.Content: I used to frequent the Peninsula when the Peninsula and Excelsior were separate hotels. The Excelsior then was the bigger older hotel bit the Peninsula was nicer. The two hotels were joined together and now share a single reception. I have been back to the Excelsior side and to the Peninsula Side and i still prefer the rooms on the Peninsula side. Breakfast is basic and things can get crowded at times. Reception is perfunctory but quick. Good location close to Raffles City. City Hall Interchange and right next to IT Mall. The lobby is bright and spacious but there are other choices in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and beds could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: Mjgriffo
Reviews.Content: Booked by my wife months in advance through qantas holidays for my 40th birthday, but on arrival didn't have a room with a double bed available. We had to argue with reception staff to be moved out of twin room on second night of four. Initial offer was on a smoking floor (we don't), eventually got a corner room on level 10 in excelsior tower. Beds were terribly hard, ended up with sore hips and shoulders from side sleeping. Location is fantastic, central to city hall mrt and clarke quay. Immediately nexrd door to Funan centre. If you're considering this hotel it may be worth paying more for the rooms in peninsula tower, which have good views of marina bay, hopefully the beds are better too!

Reviews.Title: “Average But good for an expensive city!”
Reviews.Author: Siavashpolo
Reviews.Content: Main high-lights from my side are as following: 1- Good location, close distance to major attarction and we were able to walk to bars and restaurants by the river, walking to Singapore Flyer and Marina Sand Bay. 2- The room given to us was not renewed for example you could see loose wall papers, Bathroom drain hole smells, and bathroom tiles was not clean and there was germ (uncleaned dirt) at the wall-floor corners. 3- Acceptable breakfast but not excellent and comfortable beds. Nice and clean swimming pools. As a general conclusion: for people which their stay in sinagapore is short, since you are not going to be too much in the hotel and there will be lots of attractions in the city this hotel could be a good choise.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Qadeer-H
Reviews.Content: I didn't spend much time in Singapour as I drop at the Peninsula Hotel for only two nights but I must say that its was a nice place. From the outside it was difficult to say that is was such a big extablishment but the room I was given was convenient. The breakfast being intercontinental was of good quality. The staff was very helpful specially those at the reception and the bellman which not only help us with our ckeckin and checkout but also how to go round the city. will certainly drop there again as the slepp quality was goo and also the location. not far from the shopping malls and Marina Bay but also there was a metro station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concierge”
Reviews.Author: foot_adventurer
Reviews.Content: Peninsula excelsior.  Receptionists pleasant.  Checking in was a breeze.  Checking out, too.  Concierge was very helpful.  Singapore was warm and humid so we looked forward to cooling down in our room after a whole day of traveling and shopping. But the air conditioning couldn't get the room cold enough to our liking even after leaving the A/C on the whole day by leaving our spare card key in the wall switch.  We reported it but the hotel explained that this is because they were using a chilled water system.  Another reason is that our corner room had too many large windows.   Hmmm, reasons left and right.  Well, let's look at the bright side now.  We got outstanding views from our room. We can see the Esplanade, the Marina Bay Sands, the Swissotel Stamford, the morning sun too! I guess that was the culprit. Street noise was minimal. The beds were comfy,  pillows low (2pillows/single bed).  Linens clean smelling, towels not worn out, got bathrobes and slippers, too. Carpets don't stink.  The bathtub was a bit small for me but good enough to soak my feet into after half filling it with warm water.  Good thing the shower head was movable and  I could wash my hair standing up .  Water was hot just the way I like it and the sink was the right height for me.  The lavatory is a new model and flushed quietly.  One peculiar thing about the bathroom was that it has a very loud and noisy drain.  Now onto the morning breakfast.  The elevators were fast.  Breakfast buffet was simple but satisfying. Got monotonous on the 3rd day though so I just had fruits.   The hotel is walking distance to almost everything. It had its own mall downstairs.  You can walk to the Esplanade, the Raffles Mall, the MRT. If you don't like to walk, it's easy to get a cab from the lobby, too.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Jilly B
Reviews.Content: We were a bit disappointed with the Peninsula Excelsior. We had requested a non smoking room, but were 'upgraded?' to a large smoking room. The whole corridor smelt smokey, as did the room. The room itself was large, but the bathroom was small. It wasn't that it was bad, but we felt it needed a good deep clean and freshen up generally. The silicon seal behind the taps on the bath needed replacing as it was mouldy - it was this sort of attention to detail that was missing. The hotel is very large (over 500 rooms) and consists of two towers with a vast connecting lobby. We spent a lot of time going from one set of lifts to the other, and getting lost! We sussed it by the time we had to leave! We only used one of the pools - I say we, but actually it was only my husband as I didn't think it looked very clean at the bottom of the pool. Breakfast was included in our deal and there was plenty of choice. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not much character about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brett G
Reviews.Content: Bland hotel with not much going for it in the way of decor or service. More like a hotel you'd find in China than in Singapore and with the extremely hard beds to match. We stayed for one night, put up by Singapore Airlines due to a flight delay. The airline has really picked a cheap one here. It's not a place where I will stay in the future as there are much better options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “From fanstastic staff to absolutely slovenly and everywhere in between.. this place is an enigma”
Reviews.Author: OldTar
Reviews.Content: From the moment that we arrived at this hotel for a 3 night stay, things started going backwards. Firstly, we booked and paid in advance through Agoda for a 'Premier' room...which looked lovely in the promotional material. When we booked in we were shown to a standard room with views to the building immediately behind the hotel...terrible. Anyway, we thought we would not even bother to unpack as we would go through the motions of attempting to get into something reasonable, so off we went to the reception desk where we waited and waited in the 'race' until one of the clerks was free. After some time and nearly one hour later with our baggage being delivered to the first room, we finally got into a better room - which we believe was a 'Premier' room on the corner of the hotel overlooking the hotel pool and the huge commercial fan array, that made an incredible noise the whole time we were there. Right outside the door of our room 1510.. was the entry to the lifts and the maid's working space. The noise that came from this area at all times of the day was annoying to say the least. No sleep ins here... we were usually awakened at about 7:15am with the noise of the cleaners starting to do their thing. We were also singularly unimpressed by the cleaning material and other things in the passage immediately outside our door and the fact that the doors to the cleaners lifts and workroom were left open for us to view when we were coming and going. I will attempt to get some photographs of all this posted as soon as I get time ... Now for the room... the towel rack in the bathroom fell to pieces leaving our towels in the bath. To their credit a repairman came the next day and fixed it. The room itself looked out over the river and as I said the hotel pool and fan array... if you ignored the noise and did not look down the skyline view was good. We then thought that we would try a meal in the restaurant advertised on the hotel brochures on the 7th floor. This was another trial. We got into the lift and pressed the 7th floor button and as quick as a flash ... nothing happened. We could not figure it out so thought we would go to the Coleman Restaurant on the 5th floor. It had a buffet advertised together with a meal that you could choose. We selected a nasi goreng and beforehand thought that we would have a Pina Colada each. Not cheap, Four sips and they were gone. There was nothing worth eating in the buffet, so we had the nasi goreng and left. While we were out we found another restaurant and had something to eat outside of the hotel later... If you think that is good... we thought breakfast was even worse. From the moment of embarrassment by the person checking us in - "What room are you in ?" "1510" "Which room?" "One Five One Zero" "You are not on the list" "Which room are you in" Fifteen Ten", etc etc... this went on for about 3 minutes while the line up grew behind us. Eventually, after being severely embarrassed we were waved into the restaurant in a very dismissive and casual casual manner. Then we saw the supervisor, and witnessed here principal activity...it was to ensure that the toaster and the food service line was shut down precisely at 10:30am... she did not seem to do much more except talk to the wait staff (up to 5 at a time in a back corner). The handles on the trays containing the scrambled eggs, bacon, etc were filthy. They had grease and other mess all over them. When we got there - there was little left in them and I needed to scrounge around to get sufficient baked beans to put some on my plate...I am not going to describe the rest of it, because it just got worse. The bread used for toasting was very ordinary and difficult for guests to use. Now wait for it... on the THIRD morning of our stay we discovered a little area at the back of the restaurant where a chef was preparing eggs to order...we did not this facility until the third morning because it was in the dark and out of sight. Anyway, I ended up speaking with the manager and relayed my displeasure to him. He was actually a very nice Chinese gentleman and I really felt sorry for him because it was obvious to a casual observer that the supervisor was not properly supporting him. Amazingly, the next morning the place was better prepared although it did not seem to make much difference to the attitude of the female supervisor (responsible for shutting the toaster down!). All in all it was a very poor experience for us and a disappointing one. By the time we were ready to leave we simply wanted to get out of the place. I have said enough.. although I might relate this little bit of information as well. On our first day we went to catch a taxi at the front of the hotel. We were directed to the taxi stand - two clearly marked spots about 30 metres away from the hotel entrance by a staff member. On the second day we were at this taxi stand waiting for a taxi when we noticed that all the taxis bringing people to the hotel and dropping them at the hotel entry seemed to have guests / people getting into them and then driving directly past us as we stood patiently waiting... On the last morning (and for the first time), one of the fellows in the front foyer said would you like a taxi? ... As this was our last trip and we were going to the airport, we said we thought we would continue to do what we had been doing since our arrival and go to the taxi stand where two taxis were waiting. Before leaving I thought I would get my boarding passes printed at the Business centre... how about $2 for each sheet of paper! There was one very noticeable and bright aspect to our stay...two of the trainees were very friendly in the lift.. they were also noticeably not broken into the routine of the regular staff. The were bright and cheerful and obviously going about their business promoting a friendly attitude. I don't know what could have gone right in this place. We wished we had booked elsewhere. I have said enough.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard hotel”
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good 3star standard hotel. Bedrooms of good standard,beds on small side.Bathrooms good. Did not eat in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “bryabi1”
Reviews.Author: dbryabi
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. We were upgraded to a room on the 16th floor overlooking the Marina. The view at night was great. The room was a bit tired looking but comfortable with a good window seat. We only had breakfast one morning. It was good but rather expensive as in most hotels in Singapore. The staff were very welcoming and the house-keeping very good. The hotel is in a good position and walking to most things was easy. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room and bad staff attitude”
Reviews.Author: Bali9
Reviews.Content: I stay for a night during my bussines trip before heading back to my country. Surprised about the room, this is not 4 star or 5 star hotel room, this is a budget hotel room, the bath room very small, the room layout very strange, very packed. During my checkout i have problem with the staff,dont know if they are part of belboy staff or services staff because they use green uniform, in stead of black uniform that the young bellboy wear, they talk too much and when i asked help they ignore us, very strange, they push us to put our group bagage at 1st floor inthe left wing althougt our guide ask us to send to right wing under the restaurant, so easy for us to catch the bus. Because of him we must bring our lugage again and make us delay to go o the airport. Hope the hotel management to fix the situation soon. For hotel recomendation, i will not recomendation this hotel to anybody, and dont want stay here any more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, and quality.”
Reviews.Author: Outlandabout
Reviews.Content: Great experience from the moment we arrived. Our luggage was whisked away; the reception staff was polite, friendly, and efficient. We were upgraded to a studio suite on the 17th floor. The bed was very comfortable, the room size was adequate, and it was very clean, with a nice view of the city being an added "bonus". We experienced no negatives while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Small room but good location”
Reviews.Author: lovesweets2
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package. I was surprised how small our room was. I felt like we were in one of the budget hotels. Perhaps it is commensurate to the discounted price we paid for the rooms? I also saw some ants on the bench although there were no food around. The location is good though. It was walking distance to the MRT - Clarke Quay and City Hall. It was also close to the Raffles Hotel and 30 mins walk to the Singapore Flyer. The hotel is OK but we won't be coming back in the future. Might try other similar hotels or stay at Traders, Pan Pacific or Stamford.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable short trip, not suited for business”
Reviews.Author: nomadicmatt
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 12 nights on business. I was assigned a room in the older tower with a good view over toward city hall MRT. PROS: - close to the action of the city, less than 5 minutes to City Hall MRT (tube station), which has great connections - free internet (although slow). You get free wired connection, but wireless is at a charge. You can get a signal from the pool to a free wifi connection in the conference centre though. - free use of safe in the room - friendly, helpful staff CONS - Crowded breakfast room - TV channel choice very limited and bad reception - Limited room service choice menu - my room had an adjoining partition to another room, which although locked, didn't stop the snoring and sneezing in the next room keeping me up some times. There are tired looking rooms in excelsior tower, ironically though this is the tower with the best views.

Reviews.Title: “So small”
Reviews.Author: mar_loaded
Reviews.Content: The room is so small, I think they just renovated the toilet, thus, the dust was still there on the shower floor, the breakfast, not much choice. No 'smoking section; for smokers (had to go across the street to have coffee and smoke at the opposite hotel instead).

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money business property”
Reviews.Author: adatar
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in January 2012 on a business trip. It was a short stay of only 2 days. The hotel is excellent, the location is good and a not so long walk from the main business center of the city. There is the Funan mall for shopping as well as some good Indian restaurants very close by. The staff is very friendly however the breakfast options for Vegetarians were limited to cereals, fruits, potatoes. Given that this is Singapore with lot of Indian people visiting, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a view!”
Reviews.Author: Abi2005
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 6 nights during a recent holiday in Singapore. We HIGHLY recommend this place for the excellent service from staff, great room and lovely swimming pools. It is also very centrally located for seeing all the sights of Singapore. Make sure you book a Premier room for a larger room and big bathroom with bathtub. We had room 1616 and it had the most amazing view across Marina Bay, the new Marina Sands hotel and the Singapore flyer. This is the third time we have stayed here and always enjoy it. The staff and friendly and will do anything to make sure you have a good stay. There are 2 swimming pools perfect for relaxing in between trips out. The hotel is very close to City Hall MRT station if you want to get around by train and also two tourist hop on hop off buses also stop nearby. It is a 15 minute walk to China Town and Clarke Quay. We booked thru Singapore airlines stop over holidays and so got a great deal - $120 Australian a night. this is not a 5 star hotel but for the money it is excellent value. highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good average Value for money accomodation”
Reviews.Author: William029
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Our room was comfortable but small and musty ( not sure if it had not been used for a while). Location and facilities were fine and everything in Singapore is generally accessible. The two pools were nice. We were happy with our choice but it was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Yien
Reviews.Content: Stay in this hotel for three nights, busy hotel consists of 2 towers. Like the location, not too busy and good stroll to city hall MRT. Fairly standard room, not huge, thin wall, can hear noises or phone ring clearly from next door. Shower area and toilet very small, no place to put amenities or hang towels. Only get 2 bottles of water on check in, never replenish after that. Disappointed with the breakfast, nothing that I really like. Staff service is good.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: EilidhCKK
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 nights at this hotel and way too long. Breakfasts were terrible, most of the supposedly hot food was cold. The rooms were small and had a very unpleasant smell especially from the drains in the bathroom and there was no extractor fan. The carpets were grotty. No free wifi. The only thing going for this hotel is the location.

Reviews.Title: “averange hotel”
Reviews.Author: CVCHONG
Reviews.Content: I find the hotel quite old and it has a weird smell in the room. Yes, it is an "old" hotel, a lot need to be done to improve the hotel environment. Personally, a "no-no " rate, i will rather stay in the hotel just opposite, across the street.

Reviews.Title: “it need more improvement on internet service”
Reviews.Author: mmlho
Reviews.Content: I stay for three night at the hotel on 02/2012, location is great, 10 min to MRT station & big shopping mall. Room is clean and comfortable, staff are friendly and helpful, However, charge for wifi at hotel lobby and cable connection for internet service at room, this is not acceptable for modern hotel facility, last time I stay at Ibis hotel, there are free wifi service both at room and lobby, even two computer station free for use provided for hotel guests at lobby .

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Singapore with value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nils S
Reviews.Content: Ended up at the Peninsula after error in booking at other place. Was very pleasantly surpriced! Newly renovated, nice rooms, with Club room you get free acccess (incl evening coctails) at the Skylounge, with fantastic views of the bay. Good spot for F1 etc. Pools, free internet and a very very good service! Highly recommend the Club class rooms, it's excellent value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: Sagar S
Reviews.Content: There are two wings – Peninsula Tower and Peninsula Excelsior. I visited rooms in both the wings and the ones in the Tower are old and run down and basic (to put it mildly). So basic that the hotel will not even send you a weighing scale to weigh your luggage. The room is bare and cold and there is no sign of any warmth or color in the form of a painting or any kind or something. The staff are matching – they are stone cold too. What is it with this hotel I wonder. Also I have never before seen house keeping of such horrible standards. The hotel messed up my booking. I went in a large group and after I checked in I went out for dinner and when I returned I found that my key card did not work. Suddenly a stranger opened my room from the inside. The issue was sorted out after 45 minutes. There is nothing here that might take me back to this horrible hotel. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great views”
Reviews.Author: gjchan
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits at a good location near the City Hall MRT stop which means it's very convenient to go around Singapore. The room is also a good size and the bed is comfy. The only criticism I can make is that the restroom is too small- hardly a good space to do your bathroom stuff. Also the shower needs some updating. The water temp can be erratic. But all in all it's a good value hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Expected more....(this is a 2010 review)”
Reviews.Author: Diedre_11
Reviews.Content: This is a late review - I completely forgot about this hotel, such was it's impression on me! It's big, located down at the Clarke Quay end of town, and fairy close to hop-on bus etc. Big electrics mall next door, and handy 7/11 for bits and pieces around the corner. Reception was messy, with directions wrongly given to the room. A long walk to rectify things - no-one in the Japanese style bar which is expensive for a drink. Stay in the lobby for a cocktail. There was also a mixup in arrangements for the payment which had been made before we left Australia. All in all, inefficient. Concierge did not understand English well and had no maps. They insist (as many hotels do these days) on a deposit when you arrive, but were happy to take cash and return it in an envelope when we checked out. The room was smallish and the dinner buffet disappointing in content and was cold. We had a day before and a couple of days after a cruise booked - if I had been able to I would have cancelled the return stay. There are insufficient places to sit round the pool which is right next to reception behind a glass wall. We left a fairly comprehensive Feedback form with reception after our first stay and on arrival for the post-cruise stay were given an upgraded room with a bowl of fruit and a great view of the harbour. Who says it doesn't pay to give feedback? It's in a safe area but I think there are other better places to stay in Singapore these days. (I go back to the 60s when there were only a handful of western hotels there...)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: mad k
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a Singapore stopover for one night on our way to and also returning from our Asian holiday. The hotel itself is quite nice, however we found some dead skin on the couch in out room and the staff were all quite impolite. My partner and I, being young and unmarried, felt strangely judged and discriminated by a few staff members. On our first stay the woman at reception was hesitant to give us a double bed and the room given to us was located next to the cleaners area-meaning we were awoken by slamming doors etc. very early. On our second visit the man at reception assumed we wanted single beds and when we asked for a double he replied quickly that none were available. This room was also located next to the cleaners area, so again we woke at 6am. The staff were in general not willing to help, which made us feel uncomfortable and our stay unpleasant. They also have no wifi- only Internet by cable that is very overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location- old hotel with comfortable room, small bathroom, polite staff.”
Reviews.Author: Humouresque
Reviews.Content: Located next door to Funan Computer Mall & (5-minutes) walking distance to Raffles City, Boat Quay, & Clarke Quay. Polite, helpful staff, old hotel, compact but comfortable room, small bathroom. The Sidewalk food court next door serves decent local fare, especially wanton noodles & soup (long queues at peak times). Good central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good area”
Reviews.Author: SoJakarta
Reviews.Content: I found a deal for 190 SGD for this hotel, which made it an excellent value for money (it is definitely worth shopping around online as they seem to have different deals with different websites). This is a big hotel, centrally located. Even though the lobby was quite busy when I arrived, an employee came to me right away when she saw I was alone with a baby and promptly took care of us. The room was far larger than I expected for Singapore: with a king size bed and a baby cot it didn't feel cramped. I didn't have breakfast, although I wouldn't expect much considering that the food at room service was not good. But for the price I paid, I was extremely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, slow and unfriendly.”
Reviews.Author: journalistOslo
Reviews.Content: I came to Singapore late one night after a long flight from Papua New Guinea, where I had stayed seven nights in the rainforest. When i got my room, it was a smoking room. I cant live in a room with this kind of smell, so I phoned the reception and asked for a non smoking rooms. It took three telephones to the reception - and 35 minutes of waiting before they got me the room. When a bellboy came to my room with the key card to a new room, he just disappeared without helping me with a lot of luggage. So there I was ...having to carry four pieces of luggage myself from one room to the next. Do not bother to ask any questions to the people working in the reception. They do not look at you, do not smile and was very unfriendly. Never again will I stay here. The two stars are for a clean room and a decent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: kjm7077
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my daughter in a renovated room. The room was nice but, the bathroom could do with a good scrub. The view to Marina Bay Sands was gorgeous, albeit a little fuzzy, due to the grubby windows. No iron in the room. A little cramped with limited storage but, still pleasant. I had an issue with being woken late in the evening by management and complained. It took them days but, they did eventually redeem themselves by offering a late check out. I would definitely stay again, due to the cheap tariffs and great location. Was going to stay at my other favourite hotel - Holiday Inn Orchard but, they seem to have increased their tariffs :(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean room, polite service”
Reviews.Author: ahurvitz2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night on our way back from KL to LA. While the hotel is a bit "dated", it is very clean, very well run, and very centrally located. I had chosen it, purely on price, and was surprised to find that the location was excellent as well. It was within walking distance of Raffles, and about a 10 minute walk from the Singapore River and 15 min walk from Maxwell Rd and the sights in Chinatown. In addition, we found it was also a few blocks from many gorgeous and historical old buildings and a beautiful hilltop park, Fort Canning. For photography enthusiasts, the Peninsula adjoins an enormous photography mall with many vintage and new cameras and accessories on sale. I would recommend this hotel for people who want quiet and value and who care about the sights more than flat-screen TVs and slick bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, good experience except the breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: TropiKey
Reviews.Content: We used PE as stopover hotel during our trip to Thailand. After arrival to Singapore from Europe I stayed there with my wife and 11 years old daughter for 3 nights and after return from Thailand, for one more night. We decided to stay there mainly because of price, which was lower than in other hotels in Singapore (although, it was still high, as accommodation in this city is expensive) and good "value for money" factor. In general, we were satisfied with our choice. Location of PE is just perfect, all members of staff very kind and helpful. In particular, I was pleasantly surprised with receptionists who were able to satisfy all our requests. Couple of months before our arrival I asked for corner room in Excelsior tower and got it. When we checked out after first 3 nights, I asked for the same room for our next visit and it was waiting for us us, even though the hotel was completely booked. There was also no problem with free of charge deposit of some our luggage for the time between both visits. The only but considerable downside of PE is the breakfast. At first glance it seems that the choice is wide and quality good but this first impression disappears very quickly. We were sorry to find out that everything except fruits and vegetables was of poor or even bad quality. Almost everything available within breakfast buffet was tasteless. It's not acceptable that 3,5* hotel in the center of city which is famous of variety of food serves such bad breakfasts. Even resorts on small Thai islands like Koh Ngai and Koh Kradan, where supply possibilities are limited, offered better choice and quality of breakfast food. To sum up, if the breakfast is not important for you, don't hestitate and book a room there. However, if you need a good breakfast to start your day in Singapore, you should have in mind that you will not be satisfied with the on in Peninsula Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “City trip”
Reviews.Author: FrankvdP
Reviews.Content: Perfect Hotel, nearby Metro, Marina Bay en Quay's. Friendly personel en great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Tomas J
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with beautiful views in the city center. A very good choice in the Singapore stopover holiday program. The Peninsula part is older than the part of Excelsior, but has a much better view of the center and the Singapore Flyer...

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mollybronte
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight on a stopover in a twin room. Room was adequate and clean. Staff were polite and helpful. Close to shops and rail. Great views from the 22nd floor bar. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: purpleillusion
Reviews.Content: I visited the Peninsula Excelsior in January 2012 and came away very impressed. Even though I was only there for a night, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone. The rooms were clean and well done. The beds were soft and very comfortable and the shower temperature and pressure was just right too. My only gripe, if any, would be that the temperature control button did not appear to work no matter what I did with it. The breakfast the next morning was very impressive as well with a variety of foods available. Most of the staff I encountered was during the breakfast as we checked out immediately after breakfast and they were extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location (inside the town) at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: pwl17
Reviews.Content: Lived here for ~ 6 months when I was on business trip. Experienced living there pre and post renovations. The renovations were just what it needed (the building is quite old) and now the place is NICE (though you have to compromise on services). Strategically located within 3 min walk from MRT and it is really within 15 min train ride to almost the must-see locations in Singapore e.g. Orchard, Bugis, Chinatown etc. You are also located very close to the famous shopping mall (Raffles City), located next to Swisshotel and Chijmes. Swisshotel has good rooftop bar where Chijmes is a world heritage building being turned into a dinning, bar area. Good place to hang out and chill! It is also right next to the Funan Digital Mall. As a foreigner, people will tell you to go Sim Lim Square for IT/electronic products (but I would say DON'T GO unless you want to be cheated - not always but often). Funan is probably a little more expensive but it gives you more reliability. Oh by the way - some of the rooms do give you fantastic views (at the same price)

Reviews.Title: “good location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: coolmodjo
Reviews.Content: must say this hotel is really strategic. its just 5 mns walk to cityhall, lots of bus stops. surrounded by lots of cheap food stalls and restaurants, and just next to funan, the electronic center. its right in the heart of the shopping districts, bugis, orchard and chinatown, and marina. easy to get to those places, by bus or MRT. the room are nice and clean, the bed is very comfy. the hotel and room interior are a bit old, need to get renovated. got two swimming pool, which are nice. slightly pricey. the room service was very very poor, when we wanted to borrow a bottle opener, they said the didn't have it, cause one of the guest borrowed it and hadn't returned it. that shouldn't have happened, a class hotel like peninsula only has one bottle opener? the check in/out took along time, there was a long queue. the breakfast was not tasty. the staffs have attitude problem. and in the end, we found out we must pay extra SGD200 more than the agreement we have paid from agoda. the staff told us that was for administration (wee booked from agoda). never happened to me before anywhere! (note: the rooms were upgraded, but i had asked the receptionist do we have to pay extra cash? and he said, no extra cash! clearly) i'd prefer to spend extra cash and stay in grand park city hall or carlton hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “You're paying for the location & swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: ariellek_bj
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the hotel is in an excellent location, walking distance to Boat Quay and various sights at the heart of the city. Even if you don't want to walk very far, the nearby Armenian Church -- perfect for some quiet meditation and a piece of oft-undervalued heritage of Singapore -- was worth a relaxing late afternoon visit. The hotel features an outdoor swimming pool that is perfect for a splash and some sunbathing. However, the pool is relatively small (an estimated length of <20m) and is fully viewable from the hotel's lobby area. On a less positive note, the building itself is rather old and everything inside the room points to the hotel's positioning as a budget hotel rather than an upscale establishment that is worth the "Peninsula" and "Excelsior" brand names. The amenities are basic -- eg. there is a hair dryer but no ironing board or iron. Also, it is worth mentioning that we were held relatively strictly to the 2pm check-in time. We arrived at the hotel at 8am after an overnight red-eye flight, but were told to come back after 12 noon to check in. Of course, the check-in policy was made clear to us upon reservation. But we did make a request for early check-in and indicated our flight arrival time. While we did not expect any special treatment, neither did the hotel respond to us saying that an early check-in wouldn't be possible. Because of the spaciousness of the rooms, and the availability of swimming pool, as well as the relatively strong service level, I would imagine this hotel to be a good choice for families who seeking affordable accommodation in this expensive city. In fact, we did observe many families with small children, incl. toddlers and babies in prams, staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Chigga13
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights as part of a layover with Singapore Airlines. The hotel is in a great location and easily walking distance to most attractions. The service was good as was the facilities. The room did have an older feel to it but it was quite nice, had all the facilities needed and a safe was also provided free of charge. The only downside was that the bathroom wasn't cleaned properly but this could have been due to us arriving early in the morning and rooms are rushed to get clean for early checkin's. Also the people next door to us we're smoking in there room and the smell had drifted through to ours, which wasn't pleasant at all. Would definitely stay again but only on a cheap rate with a Singapore Airlines stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: anjudesai3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located for great shopping and night life. Walking distance to Clark Quey where the food and night life is ...to the shopping which is located at the basement of the hotel !!! City Hall MRT is diagonally opposite the hotel and one can reach Orchard or Bugis from here. Suntec is another 5 minutes walk from here. Rooms are fairly large ... few recently refurbished. Plenty of Indian food around the hotel. If you want to grab a pizza or just a bite, there are many small take away places around the hotel and at City Hall MRT. Chimes - the place for a great meal and dancing is 5 minutes walk...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsButterNut
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights last week at the Peninsula Excelsior through the Singapore Airlines Stopover programme and I would definately recommend both. My initial emails sent to the hotel regarding internet charges and availability of non-smoking rooms were answered promptly with all the information I required. Check-in was prompt and I was given a non-smoking room in the Excelsior Tower on the 11th floor. Initially when I opened the door there was a loud noise coming from outside, a quick look confirmed that it was the roof air-con units belonging to the Funan Centre next door. I thought I would give it one night before complaining but these were turned off at 8.45pm every evening so in the end were not a problem. Tea/coffee making facilities with fridge inside the room. The room was a lot larger than I expected and decorated in a modern, pleasing way. No complaints with the bathroom. Modern glass basin, walk-in shower, no water coming into the toilet area as reported in some reviews. The view was awesome of the city scape, the colourful old Hill Street Police Station, Fort Canning Park and the space ship design of the new Supreme Court. Morning paper delivered each day. All staff I came across were very friendly, professional and helpful. I witnessed on more than one occassion staff coming out of the front office to check on the reception area and then additonal staff being sent out to help. Public hotel areas were spotless with again staff checking the decor, carpets, cushions etc. For cheap and fantastic meals, try the food court on level 5 or 6 at the Funan Centre. Fantastic meals, spotless and a lot nicer & cheaper than the tourist hotspots of the outdoor hawker centres. Average cost was $4 Singapore Dollars (£2.00) - bargain!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Vikingrrl
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel, newly renovated and an excellent location. We were booked in for one night by travel agent. The room was listed on our booking receipt as a "deluxe" but I wouldn't consider it a deluxe room. It could be that we begged for an early check in so got the first room available. Regular check in is 10 am but we arrived from the airport at 6 am after 27 hours of travel time (2 long flights with layovers). The clerk was friendly and helpful she phoned housekeeping to do up a room as quickly as possible and suggested we go for the breakfast buffet and come back to see if it was ready yet. The breakfast buffet is $32 per person, I would not recommend it, although large variety, it is just not worth it, there are other cafes and restaurants close by. The room was clean and had a good view but was very small, we had a problem with a clogged toilet but a call to the front desk had maintence there immediately who solved the problem. The lobby is nice, and there are two pools, one is a clear sided one that gives people in the lobby a clear full view of the swimmers. Kids and girls in bikinis and guys in brief speedos seemed to like this one. The other is at the end of the lobby and much more private. Would stay again based on location.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: YolandaVosloo
Reviews.Content: I have loved every moment here since my arrival! Very convenient location and awesome staff. Nice view too. Thanks for an amazing experience. I will definitely stay here again!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: nav795
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel four times, mainly due to its helpful staff and convenient location. Many stores and eating places can be found around the hotel. There's even a sex shop adjacent to it! It's an old hotel, but maintenance conditions inside the hotel are adequate. The morning buffet offers a variety of items, which make for a satisfying breakfast. Room quality could be improved if something could be done to reduce air conditioner noise. I discovered too that even though I am a repeat customer there is no information in the hotel's database about it; perhaps loyalty doesn't count. I could not replace my twin bed room with a double bed for my single occupancy. But if I were to pay more I could get that double bed. I did not want to pay more. Anyway, that was not an issue at all. The other thing about the hotel, which I think is an oddity, is the way one side of the the swimming pool, at a height of at least 1.5 m, was made to be transparent at the lobby area. Travellers seeking good value without having to pay too much for their accomodations should consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Private customers get raw deals”
Reviews.Author: Goudrivier
Reviews.Content: Again just one night booking via booking.com. The third hotel during our holiday where we got a bad deal after having booked via internet rather than direct or an tour operator. According to the profile the rooms are renovated, lovely etc. This room, 1602, were old, bathroom small, dirty and old. This can't be rated as 4 star, surely below 3 star. Position , lobby , swimming pool etc were very nice though, maybe I got a dirty room although we paid the extra for ensuring we get the better room but we e got a raw deal!!! Will not stay here again during my business or holiday travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business or Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Chanakya Jayade... J
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I visited Singapore. I loved the hospitality of your hotel. in all aspects it exceeded my expectations. So I would like to recommend it to both business and holiday which i was there for. The hotels specialty is its people's warmth and good service. Chanakya Jayadeva Attorney-at-Law Radio Host - 95.6 fm Radio Sri Lanka Television Anchor - Rupavahini & Channel Eye Independent adviser to Sri Lanka Tourism

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: EchoRomeoIndia
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights, the hotel is quite good, clean and have a great location, near to MRT station, shops and restaurantS

Reviews.Title: “Big, good location, nice cityscapes”
Reviews.Author: Eugene B
Reviews.Content: Wу lived close to the upper floor. There was a nice view out if the window, we nearly toucjed clouds, it was so high. There is a very good lobby. The restaurant where you have breakfast is on the upper floors & admire the view when eating. The room was quite spacious - around 25m2. Good location & breakfasts are not bad. I would recommend it to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Club Rooms to Book”
Reviews.Author: Shimao
Reviews.Content: 2 weeks in this hotel convinced us that is the more clever choice than our previous ones (Stamford, Ritz Club). Of course this is when views of the CBD, Marina etc are something which you value and is of importance to you like for us. We had good internet access,a nice more spacious corner room with already very good views, but then you step to the club lounge and there you have the most fantastic views of this area and beyond from their open air balcony's which you then enjoy with complimentary Australian Wine and Canapees. What more to ask for other than that also business has to come first in Singapore as well as the Club of course is more expensive. Downstairs is all essentiall shopping like in most areas in SG.The only minor for us was the too small and less attractive than other SG hotels swimming pool area, which really is not resort like.

Reviews.Title: “Average but OK”
Reviews.Author: UKDiveGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on the Singapore Airlines stopover. The hotel was OK, staff were friendly and helpful. Good location. No breakfast included so felt quite expensive but may be Singapore prices. Only available double room was a smoking one but it was OK - nice bathroom and TV!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: rajneeshmathur
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about the hotel on my first trip to Singapore with family; having read a lot of negative reviews.However i had a lovely 05 days stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend it to other tourists.The hotel has superb location, great connectivity,excellent in house service.My room no.1116 was neat and clean and offered an excellent view of marina Bay Sands .Room service was pretty good.My check in and check out was smooth and quick and all staff were polite and helpful.My kids enjoyed it here and i'll stay here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Club team made this a great stay”
Reviews.Author: BradKT
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the New Year period in a corner Club studio and could not fault this hotel. While unable to meet some requests, the Club staff were fantastic. They went out of their way to assist us, especially with our New Years eve plans and tips for traveling with our 11 month old on his first trip. Saw the New Year's fireworks from the hotel's Club Lounge overlooking Marina Bay with a champagne in hand. The location is great for exploring Singapore, with only a five minute walk to Clarke and Boat Quays, Fort Canning Park, and Raffles. An MRT station is less than 200 meters away. If traveling with a small child, a corner room offers a little more space.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid view of fireworks from hotel room on the 16th floor.”
Reviews.Author: popeyenolive8
Reviews.Content: We ushered in the new year from our room on the 16th floor, a Premier studio which is a corner room of the Peninsula tower of Peninsula Excelsior Hotel, Singapore. The view was simply magnificient, we had seafood dinner at Clarke Quays, without the normal surcharge for new years eve which we don't believe in paying. We had a bottle of champagne ready ,watching and waiting for the clock to strike 12. Location and view is great if that is what you want. Bathroom is small compared to the size of the room. Breakfast is nothing to shout about with mostly tour groups . Funan Digital Mall is just next door for IT guys. we personally prefer this location compared to Orchard Road which we feel is too crowded unless you enjoy shopping on Orchard Road.We did our shopping in Raffles City which is walking distance by foot for about 15mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & good room”
Reviews.Author: anuwat1303
Reviews.Content: This hotel, although not much to write home about, offers good value for the room in an excellent location. It's within walking distance from the MRT and there are also convenient stores, places to eat nearby. The rooms are clean and spacious. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel because we chose to eat at a noodle shop right next to the hotel. If you're only in Singapore for a few days and looking for a good night sleep, this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location ~ Easy walk to many landmarks”
Reviews.Author: Newo
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in an excellent location. Clean comfortable room. Many rooms have been refurbished. Great views from most higher level rooms. Very good choice hot & cold buffet breakfast. Multiple choices in local shopping plaza food outlets. Central for walking to many landmarks. Short walk to MRT station and many bus routes stop nearby. Nice pool areas and gym. Will stay again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: Millet-Fanger
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the Marina Bay area. 5 min walk one way to Raffles, another way to Clarke Quay and another to Singapore Flyer. A couple of free hop on / off bus companies go past the hotel (for the tourists). 2 min walk to MRT Town Hall Station and bus stop. Buses direct to Chinatown and Arab St, Little India and Orchard Rd. Service within the hotel was good, concierge, front desk, etc. Facilities where quite good though small - rooms, pools, gym etc. (Understandable in the heart of a major world city). In general the hotel was in good condition - not new but not dated or wanting for repair. We did have a problem with our room (3 of them in the end). We booked a king bed with a midnight arrival. When we turned up (2330hrs) our room had 2 singles unable to be joined. Complaining we got to singles that were together in a tiny room. The next morning I again complained and got a double in a tiny room. Complaining, again, that we had paid for a king sized bed we got a room upgrade with a king in it. It was a very nice room, pity it took so long! In the 4 rooms visited bed firmness varied ( including 2 singles joined - very firm and soft) If the price was right I would stay again, but there are lots of options.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Peter M
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay 4 nights in Singapore on return to Australia from Cambodia & Vietnam. This Hotel was recommended by our T/Agent as a good centrally located place for shopping & the sights of Singapore. That is was... Problems started with the check in. Travelling with another couple, we found our room was well below the standard of our friends room. (Same agent, same price paid) A tiny room with a bed mattress ridiculously hard, bathroom with basin outlet stuck closed & a view towards the cooling towers of the neighbouring hotel. (This was our Superior Room). On compliant, we were told that an upgrade to a more suitable room was impossible. We relented and decided it was not worth anymore arguing, it was only 4 nights after all. 4 nights without sleep on that mattress, the air conditioning was noisy and could not be turned down, breakfast was basic & as with previous review, the staff look like they want to be somewhere else and seem to stand around looking busy. WiFi, we were told, was only available in the lobby on payment of $12 dollars per session. Our only good experience was on the last night, we dined in the Sky Lounge Restaurant. The waitresses who attended to us were great, advising on the various dishes & nothing was any trouble. Evening was great. Yes, location is good, but you need a comfortable nights sleep & our experience left us both tied & frustrated with the staff attitude to our complaints for a better room, if only for a decent nights sleep. The Hotel is in need of a renovation before we would consider another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience above all”
Reviews.Author: GAGMauritius
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel. Check-in/out procedures were rapid. In my case everything was prepaid through my travel agent & only a credit card is required as guarantee in case of an extra. The luggage arrived fast in our room. Staff helpful as we had a problem with the safe (previous owner did not reset before leaving) .The safe was replaced within a reasonable time. The greatest asset is the location in the heart of the city, which means you are within walking distance of places like Bugis, Raffles City, Merlion, China Town, Marina Bay, Clarke Quay. There are so many places to eat (even if you don't opt for breakfast at the hotel, you can find something quite easily). The 2 MRT stations are also quite close and give you access to other parts of Singapore. The hotel is also about 2o minutes from the airport. There is an information desk, and the tour representatives can arrange for tours/ticketing (avoiding the queues) + pickup & drop-off at the hotel. There is a swimming pool & a nice view from the 22nd Floor (principally at night with the laser show of Marina Bay Sands). The hotel is clean and the complimentary tea/coffee most welcome after a day out. We travelled with our kid and arranged for an additional bed. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some things are the same and some are worse, won't be back if i can avoid it”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: After more than 12 months since my last stayy, staff are still grumpy and quite unhelpful especially on check in, likewise for housekeeping. Was upgraded to a "club room", but really not up to scratch and would have been dissapointed if i had to pay for that . The bathroom was small and needed a good clean, the toilet was coming aeway from the wall and needed to be bolted back properly or replaced. The airconditioning was also very noisy. Wireless exists as far as i could tell only in the club lounge and you need to request a 15 digit passcode to access it - even with this i tried several times with no success. The porters look like they want to be somewhere else and seem to stand around looking busy. As there is a taxi stand just next to the hotel on checkout to the airport - the porter suggested i take my 4 bags myself and join 10 people in the queue at the taxi stand, this is really bad service! (and by the way i refused to carry all my bags or join the queue) They might have some good rates - but i would rather pay extra and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Average to good”
Reviews.Author: NeroFlash
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel at the beginning of December 2011 for 5 nights. The hotel location is great walking distance from many attractions (National Museum, Chinatown, Little India, Merlion, Marina bay, Clark Kay, Fort Canning Park…) and 2 subway stations (City Hall and Clarke Quay). The front desk people was ok. The door men were also polite and helpful. I got a room near the elevator in the Excelsior tower so it was a bit noisy. The room was good and clean. The bed was too hard for me. The bathroom was quit small. The Wi-Fi was not free that was disappointing. There is 2 pools and a gym with sauna on the L level. There is many food options in the hotel 1st floor and even a mall in the building with a mini mart.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cottonfye
Reviews.Content: I was in SG for holiday with my friend. The hotel is located just right in the city center and only 5 minutes walk from te hotel to the underground station. My room was clean and bigger than I expected but the bathroom was really small compare to the size of bedroom area. The room was included transfer from/to airport and their staffs were really helpful. We were enjoy our stay during our trip to SG

Reviews.Title: “L Dissanayake Sri Lanka - Excellent view "over looking marina bay sands hotel and the flyer"”
Reviews.Author: Lakshman D
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights..It was safe to stay there. the rooms were comfortable and clean. The bathroom was little bit small but it was manageable. We had a good view from our room just as we expected. Thank you for giving us this room. The breakfast buffet had a great variety of food..Service was good. The location of the hotel is very convenient to approach any destination where you like to go. All the transport facilities are right near by specially the bus stops and the MRT station. We enjoyed our staying at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal situated for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: HEP_7
Reviews.Content: The hotel lies close to the interesting things in Singapore, if you, as we did, only stay in the city for a short while. It seems to be two hotels, which at some point have merged, and now share a very big lobby and 2 swimmingpools. We stayed in a double superior room in the Excelsior tower, which seems to be the newest of the two hotel towers (the other is the Peninsula Tower). The room was of standard size. There are the usual amenities as electric kettle, complimentary the/coffe/cocoa/ minbar but no safe. The beds were good, but there is only reasonable readinglight for one bed. Aircon is good and not noisy.The room offers also an internet connection. Bathroom is with a shower. We had breakfast included, and the menu offers almost everything. There's even a chef, who will make you all kind of omelettes.We have travelled a lot, but we must say that the staff here is extremely friendly and helpful. If you have the time, try a visit to the Sky Lounge Bar on top of the PeninsulaTower. It has a breathtaking view over the city-centre.

Reviews.Title: “Really Good & nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nitin1india
Reviews.Content: Really good & nice hotel in center of city Nearby malls & church make it ore exciting Must stay good breakfast quality Room Cleanliness ...............................................................................................

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: ArniMarine
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Its just a 2 min walk from the SMRT station. Even Marina bay is walkable from here.Room and service was also above par,the room had great views of the bay and the esplanade.Sleep was very comfortable and room decor was beautiful.Just outside the hotel, there are many shops to cater to a quick shopper's wishes.The best part was the Sentosa Rider leaves from this hotel, even though it takes you around the city before heading to Sentosa, still we enjoyed it,Would love to come back here again

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price and the hotel delivered better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: ccesther
Reviews.Content: I went to Singapore for a business trip with a very tight budget. At first I thought I had many choices within the budget , but nowadays all hotels price are just too expensive in Singapore. After too many frustrated feedback from few travel agents, I decided to book a hotel myself with hotels directly in Singapore. Most hotels' reservation centre with poor English and they were not eager for a business either . Finally, I found a good one and thank you so much again for the sales and reservation department from Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for being so effective and caring ! I booked the premier club room which included the sky lounge privilege. The sky lounge got a very beautiful view facing the Marina Bay. At night the new hotel, Marina Bay Sands had two light shows and you could enjoy it at the sky lounge. Many hotels in Singapore have no wifi, this hotel have no wifi in the room either, but free wifi for premier club residents in the sky lounge. Therefore sky lounge is the main point for me to book their premier club room. The room was fine with bath tub and separate shower, clean and comfy . My room was facing the Marina Bay too, so it cheered you up every time when u looked out the window. Sky lounge services was brilliant, staff were all friendly and helpful. I was so amazed by their kind offer for me to bring a guest for free breakfast and free drinks at sky lounge everyday . However, I had no guests to bring over to enjoy the offer this time. They also provided free flow of alcohol and drinks including canapes from every night 6pm to 8pm, therefore everynight I would relax myself there after a long day work . Breakfast was served in sky lounge for me, although not many choices, it was acceptable with nice view and nice services . The hotel is very closed to city hall underground station, Raffles and Marina Bay. Paying this price for such a nice location was really worth it. For recreation part, this hotel had two swimming pools, gym and sauna. Although the swimming pools were not big, I enjoyed swimming in the fish tank swimming pool a lot. The last but not least, the club premier room with special check in and check out services at sky lounge too. So it saved me lots of time for waiting in the lobby. I had a wonderful time in this hotel and I would recommend this hotel to my friends too.

Reviews.Title: “Can not Fault”
Reviews.Author: WritingKiwi
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here 3 times now. All from Singapore Airlines Stopovers for a night at a time. I always time it to arrive early morning & depart next night late (NZ to Europe flights) to make the most of it. Always are accommodating with free late checkout at 3pm & will store the luggage, you can use the pools, showers etc while you wait if you want to. On way back this time they found us a triple room to take at 7am - so did not have to wait to 2pm checkin for a double. Clean tidy, very central at being halfway between Chinatown & Little India both walkable. Metro is across the road to get the Sentosa, Zoo, Bird Park etc. Staff usually helpful with free maps etc. Big park over the road good for walking to stretch legs after flights. Great local food mall thing on ground floor, with cheap buffet or order local meals from S$2-5, also fruit fruit & juices there as well. Small supermarket is nearby to for water etc. Will always use this place in Singapore as I find the package with the Stopover reasonable priced & convienant.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Fusiondragon
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Excelsior tower for 1 night. The room was pretty big with a nice view. The best part is the location...close to the subway and the underground walkway/shops. There's plenty to see in the immediate area, and there's a few shopping malls within walking distance. Good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Stay well clear of this dreadful hotel”
Reviews.Author: richard r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on the 31/10/11 and 1/11/11. We had booked a superior room double but I suspect it was just a basic room.There was a major problem with the electrics as several of the sockets did not work resulting in the Tv, Kettle,table light not working at all. The hotel were not helpful when I told them about the faults and only offered a bottle of red wine in compensation. An employee was sent to rectify the faults but was not able to remedy the problem. I suspect the problem was not a recent one and I pity the next guests using the room. On the second day my wife had a bath and this caused the bathroom to flood which I informed the reception about and asked for two free breakfasts as compensation which they refused. I would never stay at this hotel again and would advise any one to stay well clear of easily the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with convenient late check out”
Reviews.Author: abl117
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a stop over package. Great location. Clarke Quay ..(a major tourist area) is only a block away . Rooms were small but clean. Nice view of Singapore skyline . Late complementary checkout made stopover worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean option if on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: BullnBush
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Downtown amongst shopping district and cheap restaurants. Rooms are small but comfortable. Queen bed, large screen tv, adequate bathroom. No ironing board or iron. Not the best but far from the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Not upto the star rating it enjoys”
Reviews.Author: S_Pravasi
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the reception. I would say sluggish and dumb guys who did not have their good sleep. Not at all warm reception. Ok next you need in a room is drinking water. I called for a bottle the price was too high, if I remember correctly, more than a beer can. So I asked why not complimentary water or other option they said you can drink bathroom tap water. I scolded him left and right and told that is not the water I drink. Next comes food, there were restaurants but whenever I needed the lights were off, so for me there was no food, no water, nobody to respond for service, what else do you expect in a hotel? Location? OK its near Raffles square which is slightly up market so if you are a conservative shopper you need to try Little India, Bougis Junction, China Town etc. which nothing is close to this place. For the same price you'll get lot of good options in Singapore. Don't go by the star rating it has, its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Heavily overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Meowmeow777
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and would have been highly annoyed if we paid for it ( we got it with our plane tickets). In unbelievable that this hotel is 5 star. The rooms and bathrooms are small (even by Singapore standards) and old. The pool and fitness centre need care. The entire place has aged badly and the staff are rude. For the price listed for this hotel you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location. Good Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sh33na_C
Reviews.Content: I bought a travel ground package from a tour agency and selected this hotel as its the cheapest I can find on the list provided. And I have no regrets. The receptionist is polite and friendly. The bellboy is helpful and friendly as well, especially when I ask him where's the nearest shopping centers around. The room is just nice for both my mum and I; not too big, not too small. Clean and the air-conditioner is working well. The only bad thing is the lightings, which are a bit dim, it will be great if it's slightly brighter or at least put another 1 more standing lamp, as my mum usually wakes up early to read newspaper. Bathroom is clean and size is just nice. The hotel location is good. About 10 minutes walk is the City Hall MRT. But, if you walked another further 15 minutes, it's the Raffles City Shopping Centre (Robinsons is there). However, if you looking for an easier and quicker way to start shopping, you can go down to the City Hall MRT station, there's a mall called CityLink Mall on an underground passageway that connects the station to the Marina Square and Suntec City Mall. My main intention to go Singapore is because of the Singapore Mega Sale, so staying in this hotel totally fits the bill. Both my mum and I enjoyed our stay and will come here again next time ;)

Reviews.Title: “Start of the Journey!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Anthony B
Reviews.Content: Expensive - Raffless. Peninsula Excelsior Hotel clean, tidy, staff friendly, breakfast awsome omlettes made in seconds yummo! Changi tour most interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: adityav1
Reviews.Content: My family had a recent vacation in Singapore and stayed 3 days at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. It has a superb location, walking distance to a lot of tourist destinations. Corner rooms have excellent view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Banker102511
Reviews.Content: Our family had a recent vacation in Singapore and booked 6 days at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. I can say that we are so pleased w/ our choice of hotel. It has a good location, walking distance to a lot of tourist destinations. I was so happy w/ our room because I requested for a corner room w/ a nice view and they certainly obliged. Our room is kept clean at all times. One downside to this hotel was the bathroom because it's quite small. The buffet breakfast is okay but I've seen better array of food from other hotels w/ the same category. Nevertheless we will come back and stay at this hotel if given the chance to visit SG again.

Reviews.Title: “good location, decent price”
Reviews.Author: shaliniamar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in transit twice while stopping in Singapore to our trip to New Zealand. It is a well located hotel. The excelsior tower is better than the peninsular. We we upgraded to the club room both times which were excellent. Nalan, the south Indian food eatery nearby is excellent. Good exchange rates at the forex vendor downstairs. The MTR is in easy reach and Clark Quay 10 minutes walk away. I would recomend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “your passport is at risk here”
Reviews.Author: objective_feedback
Reviews.Content: We were alarmed to find that the staff are operating a passport scanner like those in airports. They asked to look at our passports, and then grabbed them and immediately put them on the scanner, making a permanent high resolution copy. Unlike airports and immigration offices, the computers at hotels normally have minimal security and direct connection to the internet. It would be trivial for one rogue employee to take the entire cache of passport data on a USB pen drive - and the management would not even know. If wikileaks can distribute the entire cache of US diplomatic cables to the whole world, is it really hard to imagine multiple copies of these passport scans getting into the black market? The fact that this hotel is doing this actually makes their computers a target for thieves and fraudsters. I just hope the hotel management reads this (and deletes the sensitive images) before some hacker stumbles across this information and decides to seize the opportunity. Recommendation: if this hotel (or any other) asks to see your passport, let them see it but never let it out of your hands.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: Poneet
Reviews.Content: This is in the heart of the City. You can access most of the business districts within 5-10 minutes by taxi. Most places are within 30 minutes walking. The famous Boat Quay and Clark Quay are walking distance from the hotel. Has an average to good breakfast buffet spread. Very good for business travelers.
