For the Indian tourists and business there are the two Indian (one pure veg) restaurants just across the street and one right next door. The mall next door is good for small nick-nacks and the famous Funan Center is just round the corner for your fill of electronic goods. Many options for night-life with bars, pubs, restaurants close by makes it ideal for a single traveler too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Short stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottDUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsula Hotel just after the Singapore Grand Prix for 2 nights. The ground floor of the hotel is clean and modern though nothing spectacular as the hotel lobby itself is on a higher floor. The location is great and within easy walking distance of pretty much anything you want to see in the city. The room was comfortable and modern, though a little small which was made up for the fact it was on quite a high floor and offered a really nice view of St Andrews Cathedral in the square below. I arrived on an over night flight from London so arrived quite early in the morning around 9pm. I was told at check in, to my disappointment, even though i had requested it with the booking, that my room would not be available until the normal check in time of 2 pm but miraculously they had rooms available immediately if i was willing to upgrade my room for an extra cost of £20 a night. I agreed as i was tired and warn from my trip and really wanted to settle and shower. Plus the bonus to me was also that if i upgraded, i would be able to have a smoking room. All in all i did not spend much of my time in Singapore in my hotel, it served a purpose of a nice clean comfortable room and bathroom which was functional but small, i enjoyed my stay but i wouldn't write home about how amazing it was. Would i stay again, yes but without the upgrade as there is very little if any difference in the two types of rooms and i think its a hotel con.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: LisaPerthWA-11
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay with this hotel through Booking.com but when we arrived they appeared to not have a record of our booking! We checked in at about 6.30pm, luckily we had booked a Club Room which included complimentary drinks between 6 and 8pm in the Sky Lounge and we could also check in in the Sky Lounge - the slightly longer time to sort out our booking was not too much of a drama for us as we were able to sit in the lounge and have a couple of drinks! Our room was adequate, nothing particularly spectacular but clean and not too tiny. We were on the 19th floor of the Peninsula tower and didnt have much of a view as we were on the side facing the Excelsior tower so we were just looking straight across at the other half of the hotel. Breakfast was included in the price of the Club room, just a small buffet selection but again adequate. The hotel is in a great position, easy walking distance across to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay and easy walk to public transport. Bearing in mind this is only a 3 & half star hotel it was quite expensive - we paid approx AUD1100 for 4 nights - perhaps this is just Singapore hotel prices?

Reviews.Title: “enroute to Vietnam”
Reviews.Author: JSVx
Reviews.Content: Good location and on the hop-on, hop off bus line (the Singapore Airline one) room spacious bathroom a little small. Service good and close to Singapore Flyer and Marina Sands and orchard road.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: Yulia S
Reviews.Content: I was stay in this hotel and nothing special, we pay $300 and room not good and need do some maintenance.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average”
Reviews.Author: Zayneel
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Singapore, and we stayed 4nights at this Hotel! Its was ok, nothing special, service was ok and everything was pretty standard. We booked and inter-connecting room but when we got there, they said it was unavailable - they said it would be available within 7hrs!!!! Overall an ok experience, but i wouldnt stay there again p.s Try the lamb cutlets from room service - it was amazing!! we ordered it 3 times!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: NEProp
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be extremely tired. The lobby bar closes at 10 PM; the gym is a very small room with old equipment; the breakfast is average; and the rooms are very worn out. All of this could be overlooked to a degree if the price of the room was about $100 SGD less per night, but at a rate of $250 SGD per night there are far better options right across the street and across the city. It is in a convenient location, but I will not stay hear again.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: phineyjo
Reviews.Content: check in was slow, it was as if they had no record of our stay. went to sleep for a couple of hours as we had arrived from uk overnight and woke with a rash on my leg. When i got up the next morning i was covered in bites. Thefollowing three nights we used a bed bug sheet and i ws not bitten any more. We had paid in full in advance including breakfast but every morning we were told our room rate did not incude breakfast, by the breakfast staff. this was incredibly annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Near Raffles Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: busymomMD
Reviews.Content: It is just beside Funan mall which sells electronics and walking distance to the Raffles convention Center which was why I was in SG in the first place. Thats about it. The breakfast was basic and not too appetizng compared to many hotels I have stayed in. Service was poor in the coffee shop. Servers/waiters were not helpful at all. They are just there to clean up tables and nothing else. Wifi is non-existent even if you are willing to pay Lobby is very small and not welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClickinJim
Reviews.Content: Having read the mixed reviews it was with a certain trepidation that we booked this hotel. We were going to use the Singapore Airlines stopover package but they wanted to charge full adult price for our 3 yrd old so we went direct with hotel and used the MRT. It was free for a cot (which my 3 yr old used) and the 8 month old slept with us. We explained our requirements to the hotel via email and confirmed a month before arrival. At all times the hotel responded promptly and politely. We had a great room with exceptional views towards the new Marina Sands Hotel and CBD. For the money we paid our expectations we surpassed. All staff were polite and accommodating, the room was clean (window could be a lot cleaner!) and the location is perfect. If you communicate your requirements in writing to the hotel and do not expect a 5 star hotel you should not be disappointed. The MRT was super easy (and cheap) for a family of 4 with luggage to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “such a variety of room standards makes it hard to recommend”
Reviews.Author: lurchsmum
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights at the start of holiday and 2 nights at the end. Our first room, supposedly deluxe, was in the Peninsula Tower, had a tiny, dirty window and smelt very, very musty. We discovered why when using the (small) bathroom caused water to rise through the carpet in the bedroom . Staff were wonderful; immediate response was to give us another room for the next 5 nights. This was in the Excelsior Tower on the 18th floor. It was a much, much better room but the bathroom was so small that it was impossible to have a shower without wetting the floor. Drains smelt a bit, too. So based on that.... less than average. But our last 2 nights were a completely different story. Room 1718 in the Excelsior Tower was a pleasure to stay in. The bathroom was large and airy with no unpleasant drain smell.It was probably 2 or 3 times larger than the other two we experienced as it had a separate shower and lots of floor space and was well lit. Towels were a reasonable size. The only disappointment was that the amazing view from this room with its large picture window was marred by extreme dirtiness on the outside. Apart from the rooms themselves: limited brochures available about Singapore. Better off getting them elsewhere. Delicious coffee at groundlevel in the shop right next door. All staff we met were helpful but the chambermaids on floors 17 and 18 in the Excelsior Tower were the ones we had most to do with as we saw them every day and were very impressed with their helpfulness, friendliness and professionalism. By the way, we booked some months in advance and even that wasn't enough to secure a corner room that was requested at the time, so if you have specific requests I am not sure how you can ensure that you will get what you ask for. This hotel was placed close to many amenities such as MRTetc, but really, the city is pretty compact. Most hotels in this area are close to most things and getting about on the rail system is so, so easy. Would I stay here again? Probably not, unless I could be assured of a decent bathroom and a clean window. The three rooms we saw varied so much in quality that getting a good one seems a bit hit and miss,

Reviews.Title: “Fits the purpose but no luxury”
Reviews.Author: jambu583
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel due to a Singapore Airlines delayed flight and so I missed my stopover. Funny that the airline booked us in here as it was a good 20-30 minutes drive to Changi Airport. The hotel seemed like a business hotel. There was lively entertainment in the lobby and there seemed to be quite a lot of different activities to do. Checkin was very quick but this could be because it was all pre-planned/paid and booked by the airline. When I arrived on my floor, there was a slight, odd smell. However, it wasn't too strong. This was the same in my room. The room itself was adequate. Very basic twin room. The toilets was basic...enough for a quick shower in the morning. As the title says, the hotel fits the purpose of my visit and possibly a quick business stay but it was very far from luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Travellerporirua
Reviews.Content: We were booked by Singapore Stopover Holidays - SIA and it was very disappointing that the wait at Check-in was more than 30mins and then we were given rooms which had no views although it was on non-smoking floor as requested. We were 4 adults and our 4 yrs old grandson.The rooms were adjucent to each other with a connecting door, which was the best facility of all. We arrived there on New Year's Eve and stayed for 3 nights, We wanted to witness the fanfare on their toplevel but was too crowded and did not feel safe with a 4 yrs old. The rooms were never cleaned properly although amenities were replenished - possibly due to the high season. We complained to reception staff about this but nothing was done to satisfy us. Their restaurants were so crowded and over-priced; so we went to nearby restaurants which offered good food for better price. We have experienced twice with Singapore Stopover Holidays that their choice of rooms in such hotels are usually crap and worthless and we will not access to their offers any longer. There are much better hotels in better locations in Singapore for cheaper prices.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: globehopper46
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel with my family but didn't enjoy the experience. We seemed to be put on a non-family friendly level with a lot of businessmen and working girls. Otherwise the hotel was adequate for a 3*. The two towers were confusing, but didn't spend much time in the hotel anyway so not too much a problem at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Totally recommend”
Reviews.Author: Trish255
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent. Location was great and staff were very helpful. Rooms were of a good size, clean and airconditioning was freezing. You are just a 15 minute walk from Bougis Street (great for shopping) and there are shops located beneath the hotel and across the road. We arrived at 7am and the staff gave us a choice of a smoking room (ready now or a non smoking room ready at 2pm) so we took the smoking room and found it to be OK. Would definitely stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: irahgm
Reviews.Content: We were booked at the hotel by singapore airlines since we wanted to try the singapore stopover holiday package. Not one of the classy hotels in singapore, but a very nice one. Staff were very friendly and accomodating. In the room we had a very comfy bed and a big one! the bathroom was very clean and with a big tub which my hubby was very happy with (he likes bathtubs :) the hotel is actually near the historical area of singapore, clarke quay, fort canning and raffles city. my hubby and I had a hard time with the bus, so we opt to walk instead, which is a good excercise! when we got back, we had a goodnight sleep, so good we almost missed our flight. hahhahaha.... totally would come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location, smoky room though”
Reviews.Author: nz_travellerz
Reviews.Content: we were booked in here for a stopover as singapore airlines had to change our flights, the location was great, we had dinner on circular quay, raffles mall is down the road. The hotel was nice enough spacious room the bathroom was a little grubby in the shower - the shower was nice and big though the bathroom was small. We were exhausted after a flight and keen to get to sleep but we were put in a smoking room, we didnt think to ask for a non-smoking room so didn't have a great sleep as it stunk all night and the aircon just kept repeating the air I guess! The bed was super firm too, we were too tired to care much about this though. Probably our fault, but recommend you ask for a non-smoking room if you don't want a scratchy throat the next day. The staff were very helpful with our luggage and sorting tickets for Universal Studios the next day so that was good.

Reviews.Title: “convenient location but poor bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: combugs
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Peninsula Excelsior for one night. We arrived in the morning and left our luggage at concierge and did not check in until midnight. The location of the hotel is extremely convenient, with only a 5-min walk to the City Hall MRT station and a few dollars cab ride away from places like Clarke Quay and Chinatown. The room we had was spacious and had a view to the pool of the hotel. I was only disappointed with the bathroom because there were bugs crawling on the countertop and around the toilet. I felt extremely disgusted and immediately put away my personal amenities back in my suitcase after using the bathroom. There was also a design problem with the bathtub as there was no curtains or doors except for a glass which only covered half of the bathtub. As you shower, water from the side of the bathtub spill to the floor and you have to try hard not to flood the entire bathroom. The hotel does not offer free wifi, not even at the lobby and the fee, as I remember, was not cheap. Overall, the hotel is fine if you are just staying there for overnight stay in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: iamanumenorean
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite large compared to average room sizes in Singapore. Very neat and clean and well lit. Very nice swimming pool. Peninsula plaza opposite the hotel is a great area for bargain shopping for clothes and electronics. There is a decently stocked 7-11 opposite the hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rocky_Mason
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, 11th - 13th September. As i arrived at 7am, checkin wasnt until 2pm. The best they could do was 12....which is understandable. Location wise this is perfect, 5 minute walk to Clarke Quay, MRT, and Raffles etc. I paid roughly £100 per night, which i think is excellent value for money. The rooms are really big, air con, power shower etc. As i am sure you have read it does get the floor a bit wet, but not a huge problem. The only reason this didnt get 5 stars was concierge, i asked a few simple questions for tourism and to say he didnt know what he was doing was an understatement. I was worried leaving my bags with him! I asked about the theatre, in which i was left a blank look. I asked what can i do after the Botanical Gardens, and there was no excitement or ideas to offer. So instead I decided to go to the Zoo on my own. But in general, from the other places i saw and looked at, this would be my recomendation if this is within your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: HabuHabu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a Deluxe Room for 7 nights. The size of the room is considered spacious for an affordable hotel in the heart of the city. The newly refurbished room was clean and comfortable, with windows overlooking the famous Marina Bay Sands. However, while everything in the room looks new and classy, the management seems to forget about the outlook of the air-conditioner, which is still dirty and old looking (see picture). But it did not bother us, because you can only notice it when you purposely tilt up your head:) With a bathtub being squeezed inside, the toilet is a bit small, but all in all enough for an average size Asian to move around cozily. I personally like the powerful hair dryer, that can easily blow dry my thick long hair. So, ladies, you do not need to bring your personal hair dryer if you stay here. The location of the hotel is very strategic. It took you only 3 minutes to walk to the nearest City Hall mrt station. From there, you are literally connected to Raffless City Shopping Centre, Marina Square, City Link Mall and Suntec City. If you have strong legs, Clarke Quay and Bugis Junction is only 15-minute walk away. Also, for IT gadgets lovers, Funan IT Mall is just behind the hotel. Overall, our stay will be perfect if the hotel provides free WiFi. We were very happy with our stay here and will definitely consider to stay here again when we next visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient location. Good 3-4 star accommodation for longer holiday stays.”
Reviews.Author: stinoo1
Reviews.Content: When I am in Singapore I usually stay here. Close to MRT and shopping centers. Very convenient location, you can go shopping (electronics,clothes,jewellery ect) within the same block and basement of building. Clean and comfortable rooms but decor is dated and combination bath shower always gets bathroom floor wet. Price is a little high for this class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Was good”
Reviews.Author: blueplanettraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 3 times in January 2010, May 2010 and January 2011. The first 2 times were great. I got free wifi at the lobby are, but the wifi is no longer free on my last visit. The hotel is nice. Not bath tub, but the shower is good. I would go back again if they give free wifi. Other than that, all is good. Oh the small bar by the receptionist area, the bartender may need to learn more about drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Near MRT-City Hall, esplanade and Raffle City”
Reviews.Author: ANDAMANPhuket_
Reviews.Content: Location wise is great, easy access to anywhere by MRT or Taxi or even walking distance. Building itself look rundown a bit (Heard that its combined two buildings together). Lobby is hugh but not on the ground level, you have to take elevator, its a bit inconvenient. check in/out was fast & efficient. We booked premium rooms, non smoking so the room was quite acceptable & comfy with all amenities we wants, bed sheet, linen, towel were of good quality. Room & bathroom are cleaned daily. What we dislike was the buffet breakfast. It seem to us that they provides food for Indian customer more than other nationality ( during our stay, around 70% are Indian, 5% are Philipines, 5% are Chinese. 1% are Westerner and the rest are Asian ) Its like a mess. Shortage of seats, food & utelsil were not replenished on time, no senior staff to control the situation. Some guest has no etiquette at all. We saw one time a Western lady found a seat and placed a glass of orange juice and a cup of coffee on the table just to make sure that everybody will notice that its occupied then she went for a hot dish. A couple of Indian came, can not find the table so they remove the juice & coffee cup from this lady's table and sit there instead, The western lady came back, got a shock and make a Sihhh..(she behave well) then left to find other place to sit. From that day on, we know what to do by not leaving the table unattend (leave one at the time). Aside from this, the food taste OK. If you do not mind about this Breakfast Chasing ! then, this hotel is recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel at Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: AnandDesai_7
Reviews.Content: Peninsula - right in city center. 5 mins walk from "City Hall" MRT. 2 mins walk to parliament House, 10 mins walk to Singapore Flyer, 10 mins walk to Merlion and Marina Bay. Only Cross the road for "anything you want" Food Court and shopping. Splendid location. Service: Excellent. Very much resonsive and alert. Only let go was check-in. I booked Non-smoking double... and at time of check-in, was informed only twin available for non-smoking. I was asked to wait till 2PM (their proper check-in time) for the non-smoking double room or take twin room. Despite 9 hours long flight, I decided to wait as I was with my wife and it would be insane to take twin room. At 2 PM, I was informed that double rooms are stil loccupied and they cant say how much time it will take to make it available!!!!!!!!! After a debate, I was provided a Premier Double room in Excelsior tower. Which was acceptable as I had booked Delux earlier. I thank the lady who gave it to me. Room: Our room was at 19th Floor. And having Pool View. (A view of the pool 15 floors below you is not worth writing). A worth writting is a view of Parliament House I got from my room and a view of Singapore Flyer from distant. (Still ask for Peninsula tower with Marina Bay view if you have a choice). Room was neat and clean. All included facilities such as dressing table, Sitting area, a wardrobe, security locker, bathtub, LCD TV, refrigerator, Internet service, mini bar, ISD telephone. I loved the room!!! Food: I did not try the Hotel food. Food Court just opposite of hotel is all you need. Still I had been to Breakfast room once and items kept for breakfast were looking and smelling excellent. All in all, a very good hotel and worth spending money as you can just walk down to all attraction.... Imagine taking a night walk on Marina bay everyday(night) after dinner. :) And, to Management: Thank you for Birthday complimentary fruit platter. Thank you guys!!!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and poorly managed. $25/day internet?? Not going back.”
Reviews.Author: mr_jabberjaw
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that has seen better days. The carpet in my room was just about walked though (was on the Excelsior side) and I somehow wound up in a room with twin beds, and they were made for people of no more than average height. This is a cut above a backpackers' hotel, and a cut below someplace you'd actually enjoy staying. Apparently this is not a hotel where the bell staff, for instance, assist you in getting a taxi: I was directed to a public queue outside, and none of this "may I help with your bags" stuff. You're on your own. The management interpreted a legitimate question about whether internet was included entirely in their own favor--no compromise--and internet is TWENTY FIVE DOLLARS A DAY. The lobby, for some bizarre reason, is not at ground level. Ground level is in a low-rent mall. There is a MUCH, MUCH better hotel just across the street: Grand Park City Hall, where I also stayed this trip for about the same price. The pools are pretty good, though--there are two small-to-medium sized ones--and the gym is quite usable, having a rack of dumbbells, some benches, and a cable machine, along with newish-type exercise machines. I hesitate to say anything nice about the place since I wouldn't go back if they paid me. It really is sort of a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: DebuDeb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Peninsula Excelior Hotel is located centrally located and a few minutes from City Hall Station, Parliament House and Supreme Court. Clarke Quay is around 10 – 13 mins away and this hotel is ideal for all those for whom the criteria for choosing a hotel is location. However, in case you are looking for service and warm staff this is NOT the place. Having stayed in this hotel for 5 days (Aug 28th - Sep 1st) , I can tell that the following areas need improvement: • Service of Housekeeping is much below expectations: o Their response time to any thing that you require is on an average 45 mins with a couple of reminders  I had issues with toilet cleanliness and this is responded after 1 hour (person involved: Rosy and Molly)  There was a problem in m shower, this got responded after 4 hours.  I asked for an extra pack on coffee .. this was delivered in 80 mins (person involved: Kimwah) • Service in Coleman Café o The breakfast in the morning is like a fish-market. A large number of guests descend in and there is no effort to organize the crowd, o Breakfast between 7- 9:30 am is a nightmare and hardly one gets a place to sit. o On the top of that the staff at the entrance were very rude. They are more interested in you room number and not ushering you to a table. o I found the following staff members to be very rude:  Lin (Egg Maker) - The person making omlette was very rude and frowned often if you asked for anything other than what he had already made a kept  A trainee server (middle aged lady with spectacles and appeared to be of Indian origin) – I had requested her to clean the dirty table which she refused. • Billing Error o While I was checking out I found that I had been billed for 2 bottles of mineral water which I had never consumed. It took me quite a bit of effort to explain frontoffice executive Mohd Suiyan that this was not my bill. He told me that it could be house-keeping departments stock-taking error of the mini-bar. This hotel needs something inherently wrong with quality training, processes and policies. Especially the housekeeping department needs an overhaul. Overall, not a great experience in Hotel Peninsula Excelsior. If you are looking for service and warm staff, this is not the hotel to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Average and boring”
Reviews.Author: love5star_everything
Reviews.Content: Very close to MRT station and a short taxi ride to Marina Bay Sands. Hotel is very generic looking but they are trying very hard to be more luxurious. Our room was spacious but very "worn" and boring. Small bathroom but clean. The worst part was that our sheets had black marks on them and it looked like they tried to use white out to hide them. View of a wall and no free wifi at all.

Reviews.Title: “Customer focussed”
Reviews.Author: ScubaZorro
Reviews.Content: This was my first return visit to this hotel. In my experience hotels are never as nice the 2nd time, but this hotel is an exception to this rule. I booked the cheapest class of room, requesting a good view while booking. I didn't expect much, but was pleasantly surprised by an upgrade to the 20th floor in a larger room with a glorious view. Everyone that I dealt with was friendly and tried their best to do a good job. I'm still recommending this hotel for budget conscious travelers to Singapore. It's well appointed (not super-luxurious) and situated centrally to public transport and business centers. If you're after a resort-holiday, stay somewhere else. If you're after a good base where you can relax while mostly working or exploring in Singapore, this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: whizkid420
Reviews.Content: Location is the biggest advantage of this hotel. With a close proximity to the City Hall MRT, Clarke Quay, Marina Sands, you can just reach about the major tourist spots by walking (well almost!).. The service is good with english speaking staff. Room service also got nothing to complaint about. Breakfast in the hotel was excellent with a lot of varieties everyday. It must be very popular for tourist as it was always crowded in the 2 weeks that i stayed there. Would recommend this as it's a very good hotel at a decent cost.

Reviews.Title: “good except air con”
Reviews.Author: transom
Reviews.Content: stayed in a club room on 22nd floor - a premium room which had stunning views and access to a private lounge with breakfast and pre dinner cocktails etc. We joined our (adult) children for breakfast on the 5th floor with the hoi polloi one day and were surprised how poor it was in comparison - most stuff had run out and there was no cutlery available. The room was fine and worth it for the views. THe only problem, and it is a considerable problem, is that the air con cannot be controlled in the room - the controls don't work. You can either have it on or off. It was set far too cold for comfort at night and we ended up turning it off and suffering the consequences. We didn't really want a choice of too hot or too cold, but would like to have set it at 'just right' temperature. Another tip - make sure you ask for a non smoking room - the first one we were put in was a smoking room so we asked to move. Like other guests say, the location is good, but then most hotels location is good in SIngapore. It is not that big a place, and the public transport is excellent. Would we stay again ? probably not, but it did the job fine.

Reviews.Title: “Premier View of Marina Bay Sands”
Reviews.Author: Mini_Cheryl
Reviews.Content: I checked-in to a Premier room at 16th floor, where my room had a spectacular night view of Marina Bay Sands. Room is quite standard for a business traveller. The only setback was that the bathroom did not have proper shower blinds to prevent water from flooding the floor. Bed was comfortable for a good rest after a strenous day. The buffet breakfast was rather stale though there was quite a good spread of variety that inclined towards oriental tastes. Location was great as it was just opposite the City Hall MRT station and near Raffles City Mall. The Funan Digital Mall was just around the corner. Good for shoppers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views & Location!”
Reviews.Author: Alybyzrp
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here twice this summer, at the beginning and at the end of our trip. (I booked again for the end of the trip after loving it at the beginning!) Our first experience at the hotel was in the Excelsior tower. The room had been completely redone - everything looked new and clean. The bed was comfortable, and the views over the city were impressive! We really enjoyed reading the morning paper on the window bench seat overlooking the city to the Merlion. Our second experience at the hotel was in the Peninsula tower. The room here had not been updated (yet?) and showed it's age (watermarks and slightly dingy walls and the like - mainly appearance stuff), but the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was clean, and the views over the city were even better than we had experienced before! The hotel is in a great location, very walkable and central. We would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: My husband was booked to stay here for a 5 day training course, directly across the road. I traveled with him for a holiday break, and we arrived separately. After an overnight flight from Brisbane I arrived at the hotel at around 8.20am on a Sunday and was fully expecting to have to wait until 2pm to check in. I was extremely delighted to discover our room was ready and within 15 minutes I was in our room, enjoying the panoramic views of Marina Bay Sands, perfect for watching the fireworks 2 nights later on Singapore National Day. The location is perfect for access to the superb MRT system, and for those like me who enjoy spending a full day exploring on foot, within walking (or a short MRT ride) to all of the major districts, Chinatown, Arab street and Little India as well as Boat Quay and Clarke Quay

Reviews.Title: “There was no wireless in a 4 star hotel??”
Reviews.Author: ScubaChief
Reviews.Content: There was no wireless, all wire internet, which I find totally inconvenient for iphone apps such as whatsapp.

Reviews.Title: “A great start to a good trip”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTravellers201107
Reviews.Content: Had two pools which were large enough to accommodate all guests, towels were provided. Had a small gym which we used and an amazing breakfast, although breakfast as we found throughout our travels was very busy. The staff were friendly and very helpful throughout the Hotel. Literally a hop, skip and a jump around the corner from a food hall, opposite a plaza and part of another plaza. Close to many restaurants. We walked to Raffles, Clarke Quay, St Andrews Church and a number of other places. Taxi's are very cheap so used them heaps, they stop right outside the hotel. The only thing we would do differently in Singapore is book two rooms next time! Apparently all bedding arrangements due to "legal" guidelines is max 3 beds to a room. There was four of us so we ended up pushing two single beds together and 3 of us slept on two beds while one lucky person (the youngest of course) got a bed to himself. Our basin blocked and we rang receiption, not long afterwards a service person turned up and fixed it. The bathroom was small but functional and the linen nice. Not aware of any kids activities provided but we never looked into this either. We loved Singapore and can't wait for our next trip there. We would definately stay at the Peninsula again as well.

Reviews.Title: “Only Average”
Reviews.Author: Harrier19
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel late at night after a twelve hour flight. On arrival at check in we were told there was no room ready for us and we would have to wait over an hour for a twin room, despite the fact we had booked a double room through our travel agent 6 weeks prior to our arrival. When we complained to reception, they offered us a double smoking room until a smoke free room was available next day. When we moved to the smoke free room next day, we discovered it unbelievably noisy due to an air condition unit outside the room. When we told reception they told us there was nothing they could do as we had already changed rooms once. Basically a take it or leave it attitude. We have stayed in Singapore many times in the past, but it seems to be getting a very expensive place for a stopover. R&S New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Maxqld
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 1 day stopover flying Singapore Airlines. The location is really excellent. Near by the St.Andrew Cathedral and less then 800 m to the Bay and Merlion. Subway City Hall station within 300 m from the hotel. The area is also full of shopping and dining precincts. The room was clean but bathroom requires some renovation. View from the room was great especially at night.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, solid value, very personable staff”
Reviews.Author: GringaenMiami
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula Excelsior is a good hotel for the price, located in the center of the city within close reach of public transportation. I stayed in two rooms, the second was appreciably nicer than the first. We held a two day corporate meeting at the hotel and the staff was very helpful and courteous. The meeting rooms were adequate, as was the breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round”
Reviews.Author: DebHnz
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a Singapore Stopover holiday. It was excellent all round. The concierge was always most helpful. The only negative was the internet access. Easier to go to the coffee shop just outside the front door where it is free. 2 swimming pools...we only used one to sit and have an evening drink. The location is fantastic. So easy to get to everywhere including restaurants and anywhere else you wanted to go. We thought the drinks were expensive but there were plenty of other choices nearby. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikko358
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice rooms and beautiful view from the room to center of singapore. Great value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: DayBec
Reviews.Content: Not sure what other hotels are like in Singapore but we found this one to be decent but nothing special. Very confusing as it is over two towers with a connecting lobby on the 5th floor so if you enter on the wrong tower you have to get out of the elevator and cross over the lobby to get into the next set of elevators. Rooms average even though renovated. Staff good at reception. Fantastic view over the city from the top floor bar - well worth the cost of a round of drinks just to hang out and watch the sunset. Good location, you can walk to Clarke Quay but be prepared to spend a vast amount of money on very average food and service in this tourist trap.

Reviews.Title: “Near MRT Station and decent room”
Reviews.Author: neeruam_baby
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at www.hoteltravel.com for a very good price. I guess we're just lucky to get a promo that time. It's a little above our budget but we're glad that we decided to stay there instead of Hotel 81 or Fragance hotel. We came in early and was hoping there would be an available room already. They said that the rooms are still be cleaned by the housekeeping. So we decided to have lunch first and left our bags in the Concierge. However, when we got back, our room is not yet ready! After almost an hour, we got our room keys. I was praying that we will get the renovated rooms because I read a lot of reviews saying that the rooms are not in good condition. Upon entering our room at the 11th floor (I just can't remember if it's in the Peninsula or the Excelsior building), I was happy to see that it's not that bad at all. Our room is big and clean as well as the bathroom. There was way enough space for our 2 big luggages. There's a small fridge and a safe, too. The bed is huge and we didn't have problems sleeping on it. Plus, we had a nice view from our room. When visiting Singapore, the best advice I can give is get a hotel near an MRT station because it's the fastest and cheapest way to go from one attraction to another. That's the main reason we chose Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. Aside from the hassle during check in, we enjoyed our 5 day stay in this hotel and we'll surely consider coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & tidy. Professional & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Wizard_of_odds
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Singapore & the hotel was chosen by the local office. The location is central and easy walking distance to several large shopping malls. It is also a short taxi ride to most of the attractions that Singapore has to offer; of course everywhere in Singapore is a short taxi ride!! The entrance is very welcoming with helpful staff but strangely the 'lobby' is on the 6th floor. Check-in was very swift & painless. Room was immaculate, bed was exceedingly comfortable with two different types of pillows. Bathroom was well equipped (first time I had seen toothbrushes provided!) Shower was powerful with endless hot water & no fluctuations in temp or pressure - fresh towels every day. TV with English speaking news channels, many programs in English with Chinese sub-titles. Mini-bar, robes etc. No iron but sending clothes to be laundered is very cheap so it's not a big point. Comlimentary local newspaper every morning. Free Wi-fi There is a swimming pool & health centre which I did not use on this trip but looked clean & inviting. Bar & restaurant were fine - the lobby area has a grand piano playing automatically - cute! Breakfast was included in my rate and was comprehensive; catering for all tastes from local to continental you could choose form a huge variety of hot & cold dishes. Every one of the staff greeted you with the appropriate time of day and were happy to have a quick chat or help you in any way they could. In summary, very comfortable & clean hotel in a good area with nice staff. I would have no problem staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Wannabe_GlobeTrekker
Reviews.Content: We had one night here on stopover after arriving on a late night flight. Admittedly, we got this room coz it was the cheapest we could find, and we pretty much got what we paid for. Rooms are very basic despite saying that rooms are refurbished. The bed was super hard and pillows were flat as a tack. Don't even try breakfast here, the price is ridiculous and there's nothing worth mentioning. You're better off going across the road to raffles city food court for breakfast. The concierge was mighty helpful and friendly with helping us with our checkout, and the staff overall was great. Probably wouldn't stay here again if I could help it.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: mcmoli
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for two days at the end of our honeymoon. They made a really big deal of checking us in as we were honymooners and then gave us a small room with mould on the ceiling! I went down to complain and a receptionist in training told me the hotel was full and he could do nothing about it, except get housekeeping to 'clean' it. My husband then went down to complain and we were given a different room, but had to move the suitcases ourselves. I also ordered some room service and had to change dish a few items as they did not have it. It was a very disappointing end to our honeymoon. Singapore was only for a few days and not the main bit of our trip but we felt that they fell short of providing a good service. This hotel is suited to people on business trips in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Two half's are better than one... Fairly good...”
Reviews.Author: Sparpook
Reviews.Content: This hotel is actually TWO hotels that were side by side at one time and are now joined by a "tent" kind of lobby and has combined them into the Peninsular Excelsior Hotel. The "Excelsior" side is more modern and a well appointed hotel that stands in stark contrast to the "run down half". Several of my colleagues were in the other half and found it smokey, and more dilapidated. I overheard one man at check in screaming (not very polite Aussie) at the desk clerk that the rooms were noisy and wanted another room (he has been from the OLD hotel. So I would suggest that if you book into this hotel ask Specifically for the Excelsior SIDE. There is "sort of security" in that the plastic credit card key cars are supposed to activate the hotel elevators but that did not seem to work on the Excelsior side but did on the OLD side. The hotel had a HUGE breakfast buffet... seating was somewhat limited. There is an ASIAN side and a WESTERN side to the buffet so there is something for everyone. Few times it looked a bit messy and food was kind of slopped around but I suspect it was that the hostesses could not keep up with the swarms of breakfast people. The internet costs 1 hour for SP$5 4 hours for SP$10 and up... taxi bookings through the concierge cost SP$2.50 surcharge. The hotel is about 25 minutes from the airport (at night) might be longer during rush hour. The ESPLANADE MRT (Subway) station is 3 minutes walk to the hotel and convenient. There are shops around and malls all around the hotel. The desk clerks were for the most part accommodating. I heard otherwise from others but I think being polite and a smile goes a long way rather than being belligerent when requests are met. Beds are like rock on the Excelsior side... the old side was apparently more comfortable. There are two swimming pools one each from the former two separated hotels.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Jackelinemac2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights in June, and find it compact, clean and the safe comes in handy. Check in and out went smoothly and staffs were knowledgeable and helpful. Room were on the 'smallish' size but comfortable. Great location with handy access to MRT and Raffles city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, with very little service”
Reviews.Author: xcrunch
Reviews.Content: We travel alot, so would should know better, but decided to stay here due to the location of the property. We arrived later in the evening, and immediately they asked us for a cash deposit and a credit card imprint. I refused supplying the cash deposit as we didn't feel comfortable. Then seeing the room, it was quite big but is really old in its fixtures and definately needs a remodelling. Then the chambermaid came in and took all the mini bar out due to us not providing the cash deposit I suppose. The breakfasts were adequate but not that great, and catered mostly to the Asian and Indian clientel they have. Several of the hot plates were not working and the food was thus cold. Trying to do as much as we could in Singapore, I had requested a late checkout of a half a hour and they refused saying that the the maids could not turn around the room in an hour and a half for the next traveller. Accomodating the traveller is not one of this hotels attributes, with very little service given. Please also note that Singapore has a 17% tax on all room rates. My suggestion would be to find another hotel in the area even if you have to pay more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Joe Peradach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Singapore during 17-19 June 2011 with an initial Premier Club Room reservation, upon arrival at the check-in, a friendly and service minded receptionist was eager to help us for a room on 19Floor. Once we'd found the first room assigned was a smoking-room, we immediately asked if there might be another one on a non-smoking criteria. The same gentleman quickly looked for a new non-smoking on 20th Floor for us. We finally end up staying in a Club Studio which was superbly located at a corner rightly facing the Singapore River - the Clarke Quay and the Boat Quay. The Studio was really good size, convenient and very comfortable. We also very much enjoyed the Club Floor where meals and drinks were served. Evening cocktail was also worth paying a little extra more for the higher category room. We have to give a big compliment for the Peninsula staff, as they were so impressively helpful throughout our stay. Until the check-out and departure, they didn't forget to find out to make sure that their guests shall be timely picked up by our cab to catch our flight. We would have to say it would be such a big disappointment of us should we have merely relied on other discouraging reviews we previously found in other websites about this hotel without actually having booked and stayed a room as we did. The Peninsula Excelsior Hotel is possibly one of the very fine hotels we have stayed in Singapore these recent years - thoroughly confirmed!

Reviews.Title: “Four Great Days”
Reviews.Author: FloripaGirl
Reviews.Content: A great stop over after 4 weeks in Indonesia. Hotel was in a perfect location, across the street from the bus and Ft Canning. An easy walk to many places. Nice rooms but a fee to use the WiFi. Visit Starbucks for free Wi Fi. Riding the bus around town gave us a great opportunity to see the city and make our own sightseeing plans. So much is possible by walking and so safe. The river ride at night is just beautiful from Clarks' Quay. Canning Park is a must and be sure to visit the Battle Box at the Park. We found the dining at the hotel very expensive but the food court just outside and next to the hotel very good for breakfast and other meals when near the hotel, grocery store downstairs is handy too. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good and central hotel - would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: KarenLN75
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior last week for 3 nights. Room was upgraded to a Premium corner room - massive room, lovely decor, perhaps a little tired on the paintwork. Views were great from each window and the bed and the bedlinen was wonderful. Lovely powerful shower and newly done out bathroom. The two pools are good (although one is right next to reception and is clear glass, so every Tom, Dick and Harry could watch you all day by the pool, were they so inclined). The pool on the side of the building is a good sun trap and has the sun pretty much all day. All the staff are fantastic and very friendly - other than the girl who "greeted" me for breakfast each morning. A more sour faced person I don't think I've ever met; a real shame as she completely lets the side down for all the others. I almost felt like I should apologise for having breakfast (which was, by the way, very good and plenty of choice). Location wise it was perfect for me as I had a couple of meetings in the business district - it's a maximum 10 minute stroll down to Boat Quay and Clarke Quay and the start of the business district. Very handy. I also walked up to Little India in about 25/30 minutes, which was a pleasant stroll. On the downside, the gym is pretty ropey (only one treadmill and only 3 weights machines (though lots of free weights)) and was far too hot. I happily run out an hour or so on the treadmill but couldn't get past 20 minutes due to the heat. I did bring this to someone's attention every day, but nothing changed. By far the worst thing about the hotel is the extortionate charges for the business centre - $10 (£5) for 15 minutes and only open 9am to 5pm - pretty shocking for an international hotel that markets itself to international business people. Go outside the hotel and cross the road into the mall - downstairs is a good internet cafe that is $2 (£1) an hour. All in all, would definitely stay here again (and hope the breakfast girl has been trained how to smile!).

Reviews.Title: “For an affordable stay in a clean 4 star, consider this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TobySimkin
Reviews.Content: I need a last minute hotel that was reasonably priced and clean, and found this online. Having skim read the reviews here, I was nervous and expecting the worse, however, I guess I was lucky, since I had a lovely large corner room, with friendly reception and fast checkin, and fast checkout, and friendly bell man storing my bags. I stayed in the Excelsior Tower,in room 1225 (see photos). Only complaint for me was high cost of internet (SG $25 per day). Great location, and the price makes this hotel a bargain in Singapore. In the shopping mall attached the the hotel is a great array of computer and electronics shops, and some wonderful surprises for fast food

Reviews.Title: “"Loverly"”
Reviews.Author: chits82
Reviews.Content: a very busy hotel! however, the staff there makes sure that you don't feel neglected. clean, comfortable and fairly spacious rooms with easy access to the peninsula plaza shopping centre. since it is situated at the heart of the city, you'll find everything you need around, day or night. being just a few minutes walk from the mass transit (MRT), it's an ideal hotel for business stay and family/shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional Frontdesk Receptionist~~”
Reviews.Author: chilibird
Reviews.Content: I was told by the reservation staff that we can have a special rate for just $12 per day in the hotel car park.Yet while we check in,the "trainee" told us that did not has such car parking rate but promise that will revert us ASAP.However neither of them calling to us. When we check out in the next day,another front desk receptionist which is more experience told us there have the $12 car parking rate but must provide them the car plate number while check in.That was a suck things while I listen this words as the "trainee" told me did not has this rate and cause me has to pay more than actual.I was wondering whether the Trainee is understand english or not.That is pretty much disappointed that a 3-4 star hotel will place an inexperience staff to deal with your hotel residents.Hope the proper training can be provide your staff to be professional.

Reviews.Title: “recommended”
Reviews.Author: Tourist014
Reviews.Content: We were more than pleased with our choose of hotel for an overnight stay in Singapore. It's in a great location and the staff were fantastic. We were invited to leave pur laptop in the hotel safe after we checked out and the rest of our luggage in a locked room. The outdoor pool was very refreshing and large enough to swim laps. You can get a free towel from a desk in the gym. The breakfast was exceptional with a vast range of choices including fresh fruit, natural yoghurt, exquisite muesli, porridge (two types), various Asian dishes and an array of hot food. Our room was not large but certainly big enough for our needs. Note: to access Reception, enter the lift and press L. If this is your first trip to Singapore, I suggest you avoid eating at the outdoor restaurants at Boat Quay - a short walk away. The vendors will harras you as you wander past and the food is over-priced. We were also charged for the paper napkins (!!) and for the small bowl of peanuts that arrived on the table. I can't recommend an eatery as we didn't find a really good one.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: chefsiddmehra
Reviews.Content: we were here for 4 nights. excellent room decor with a huge space neat setting a mini bar coffee maker. the toilets were very small but kept very clean. Lavish Breakfast House keeping very friendly .

Reviews.Title: “We hated it”
Reviews.Author: shrub21
Reviews.Content: The whole experience of staying at Peninsula was bad. There were 2 bluidings & it was very confusing as different services were available at different buildings so you are partically running between the two. The room were the worst that i have ever experienced - bed, bedding, pillows were uncomfortable, there was only 1 lampshade in the whole room. Bathroom was so small that you were always banging into something, there was no amenties in the bathroom. There were ants, spiders, etc in the room

Reviews.Title: “If you can stay elsewhere ...do”
Reviews.Author: thetravellerTasmania
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night only as a short stop-off to the UK. The accommodation was included with the airfare so we did not expect this to be anything special and it wasn't. First impressions in the lobby were not bad, but as soon as the lift doors opened to the floor we were staying on we immediately knew the hotel had not been upgraded for some time. The carpets were very old and dirty and the room was very basic. We survived for one night, but I would not recommend this hotel for a long stay – there has to be better!

Reviews.Title: “A Solid Par”
Reviews.Author: aycs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Peninsular Excelsior Hotel from the 30th of April to the 8th of May and found that the stay met our expectations. When we first checked in, we were about 30 minutes early and were told that if we came back later, our room in the Excelsior wing would be ready, which we were happy to do. But I did have to ask several times how long ‘later’ would be and never got an actual time. This was probably due to a language mix up, but we did disappear for over 90 minutes, only to come back and find that our room still wasn’t ready. We offered to head out again (through our agent we had requested a double bed and non-smoking room and were willing to wait rather than take any available room), but the young gentleman kindly upgraded us to a premier room in the Peninsular wing instead. Our room was spacious enough which had heavy curtains to block out any light. The staff had simply put two single beds together, but after housekeeping came the next morning, they changed the sheets to a queen to get rid of the gap (without prompting) but funnily during our whole stay, they left us with two single doonas. At least I didn’t have to fight with the wife over the blankets… The beds were very firm and although we had no problems sleeping, the middle of the bed (where the two singles joined) caused a bit of discomfort once you woke up after lying on it overnight. On the 15th floor, we had a great view of the Excelsior building, but we could also see some of the lights from Clarke Quay and the entrance to Fort Canning Park. Looking straight down, we had a good view of one of the swimming pools (and also the air-conditioning units of the building below). Our room was the very first room from the elevators and during our stay; we never heard the elevators at all, or a lot of street noise. Because the emergency services were located nearby, we did hear the odd siren and the odd hoon, plus the odd noisy guest walking by, but it was neither here nor there. We also heard plenty of guests letting their doors slam shut (for security purposes I understand, whereas we like to gently close our door and check to see that it’s locked, so not to disturb other guests), plus we also heard some young kids crying in the next room a few times (again you can’t expect rooms to be 100% soundproof). The premier room came with a huge safe, robes and slippers, flat screen TV (plenty of channels) a bar fridge that even at the coldest setting, took about a day to cool (not chill) any drinks. There wasn’t a bottle opener in the room, so I had to head downstairs to a shop to purchase one and on a side note they provide you with pencils to write with, I assume so you can’t steal their pens. We were also given a newspaper every morning to read, which came in handy whilst I was waiting for the wife to make herself beautiful. The bathroom was spacious enough with a few pros and cons. Firstly, the bathroom has a large glass window (with an adjustable blind) which is great if you like to watch TV whilst doing your ‘business’, but the shower doesn’t have a curtain – just a partition that blocks about a third of the shower/bath recess. So after every shower, the bathroom floor was always soaking wet, which meant stepping out over the bath onto wet floor mats took a little bit of concentration. We rarely had to wait for an elevator too long and were pleased that your room key was also required to use the elevators above the reception floor. I spoke to concierge once to ask for directions and found him very helpful and informative. We really didn’t use any other facilities in the hotel as we spent most of our holiday out and about. I did have to approach housekeeping one morning for an extra towel (as the wife wanted to wash her hair) and after asking housekeeping for a towel, I was given the impression that I was asking for too much. Breakfast was included in our package, but after the first 2 mornings we decided to eat out instead. It wasn’t that the food was bad, it was just okay and we felt there were more interesting things to eat in Singapore. Plus it was very busy when we went down for breakfast and couldn’t be bothered fighting for a clean or empty table. We had a bit of a mix up when they wanted to charge us for breakfast, but after checking again, realized that our breakfast was included. About the surrounding area, the nearest taxi stand is not right outside the doors of the hotel/s, but in fact in between the two and is also a communal taxi stand with the general public. The wait for a taxi isn’t more than 5 minutes or so if there is a line (which there always seemed to be at night), but if it is raining and/or windy the wait may get uncomfortable. There are also major bus routes on both ends of Coleman Street and the MRT is only a few minutes stroll away. I should also mention besides the countless eateries nearby, there’s a food court in Funan digital mall (IT), which is a cheap and tasty way to have meals. But be warned that it closes reasonably early for Singapore standards (we went there at 8.30pm and it was closed), so it’s not the place for a late dinner or supper. Check-out was a simple process without any dramas and the staff was friendly enough. We weren’t expecting great service because it is only a 3.5 star hotel, but were pleased one evening when a young staff member walking past stopped and greeted us with a hello and a smile, before walking off. It was the only time we really got that reaction, other than when we approached the reception desk. Also, be careful with your itinerary paperwork though – when we checked in, they kept it and filed it away, but we needed it for the second leg of our holiday. So after a simple photocopy it was all fixed. Would we stay here again? I’m not sure – with the prices and options of hotels in Singapore and the fantastic bus, taxi and MRT system throughout the island, you’re spoilt for choice. But I would happily recommend the hotel to anybody thinking about staying in a clean centrally located hotel. Just remember it’s not a 4 or 5 star establishment and don’t be too fussy and you’ll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Goose1977
Reviews.Content: I wrote this review because i was really upset about reservation from this hotel, at 6th May 2011, i was booking for one night in 1NTPROMO because i need to seek my medication on 7th May 2011. However due to unexpected circumstances, my medical appointment could not make on that day based on my doctor explaination. So, i dont have a choice rather than to cancel this hotel booking. On 12th May 2011, the hotel booking had been cancelled and it had been confirmed by Ms Renjini that the money will be returning back to me. However, after i waited for more than 2 weeks, the money never came through to my credit card. I made phone call but someone in reservation said that the money could not be returned because this was non refundable booking. I explained my situation and the promise at the first time that my money will be returned, but they insisted and not gave me some excemption. This is out of my expectation and they do not care with my situation. I really dissapointed with this, so i can not get even half of my money back. I dont want to stay anymore in this hotel in future, and i totaly dont recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “100% Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: panther029
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 7 nights at the Peninsula/Excelsior and we couldn't be happier with the experience. We had a fabulous room (21st Floor) with views out over the Harbour and City. The location is perfect, just 3 mins from City Hall MRT, and the service we received from all staff was first rate. Mind you, we did pay a bit extra for a Premier Club Room, which also gave us access to the sensational Sky Lounge. We thoroughly recommend this option. It's only about $50 (AUD) extra per night and worth every penny. What a treat to be able to enjoy a couple of 'complimentary' cocktails and nibbles at day's end. It's a fantastic view from the lounge and Ivy and her team are absolute professionals. And... the Premier Club Rooms include free internet (cable) access. I should note that we stayed in the Peninsula Tower, not the Excelsior. I have a feeling the Peninsula has an edge. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “nice glance at Singapore”
Reviews.Author: WakeGuru
Reviews.Content: We stopped in this hotel just for few days during our Asia round-trip. First of all the location of this hotel is excellent, it is located in walking distance from all major points of interest in the city. The Riverside promenade is just 10 min walk, the Marina bay and Flyer is around 15-20 min walk. This hotel is another one from the sort of value for money hotels if you do not eat the breakfast in the hotel. I do not know why, but the breakfast was incredibly expensive, while downstairs there are several cafeterias with very good choice. If you still miss some bread and tea, just around the corner there is Digital Mall with Subway. Bear in mind that the metro station is just across the street and one can take the train to Orchard road or any other place. Another valuable thing is that all major sightseeing bus lines stop at the hotel or next to it. The rooms are middle size, but very convenient and quite fresh, but do not worry You will return there just for sleep. the only thing a cannot really understand why the wi-fi is for charge in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR ONE OR TWO NIGHTS STAY ON A STOPOVER”
Reviews.Author: Brugge888
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel twice and reading the other reviews maybe those guests who rated lower were just unlucky. I stayed for one night twice in two months and although checkin was slow due to the number of incoming flights (both late afternoon) I experienced good service from the staff members and even got an upgraded room to the 11th floor Executive suite on my second visit. There are two towers and the rooms having talked to other guests were definitely better in the left side others (which I stayed in) compared to the right side and therefore worth remembering if booking here. I think the right tower is due for refurbishment. The rooms are very spacious, clean but can't comment on the food or leisure facilities as I didn't use them. Had breakfast around the corner at a local eattery packed with workers and at $4-6 was a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Was Great”
Reviews.Author: RCMM
Reviews.Content: If you are a family of 4 and it's considered 3 adults and 1 child, most hotels will tell you to get 2 rooms and it will end up so much expensive than it already is because Singapore hotels are expensive. But with Peninsula Excelsior, they have large rooms and they accommodated our family in just 1 room with an extra bed added. Even with the extra bed it was still spacious. We got a corner room and it had excellent views, even the kids were speechless. We arrived late at night and when we got to the room, we were pleasantly surprised to see the St. Andrew's Church, the Flyer and Marina Bay Sands. The kids just sat in front of the window and enjoyed the view. The booking was through email and was very easy and fast. Check in also very fast, as well as check out. The location is great, you can walk to Clarke Quay (which is beautiful at night) and we even walked to the Esplanade, Marina Bay up to the Sg Flyer (we are a family who don't mind walking). There's a mall at the same building of the hotel, also across. At the back is Funan Digital Mall for your digital needs where you can also find fast foods and cafes. We didn't need to avail of the hotel's breakfast because there are a lot of places to eat in the area. The MRT stop at City Hall is quite near but we didn't need to take it because the taxi rate is ok when there's 4 of you. There's a taxi stand in front of the hotel so we just took taxis to Chinatown, Sentosa and Singapore Zoo. One negative thing about this hotel is maybe the bathroom which we found to be too small for a 4-star hotel. There also was no free bottled water, maybe because they said that the water from the faucet is potable (but didn't taste good). Internet was available for a charge of SGD5 per hour which is ridiculous. Cable TV channels was also very limited - no channel for my kids. My son enjoyed swimming at one of the pools. We had nothing major to complain about this hotel so it made our stay pleasant and comfortable so it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Poor”
Reviews.Author: Philip33
Reviews.Content: This is not a good hotel - check in staff were rude and more interested in flirting with each other than helping guests - getting someone to take luggage to room was a big issue - couldnt believe backpackers werent capable of carrying their own bags. First room we were put in had a filthy bathroom - long black hairs all over the floor and the sink - we requested a move which in fairness the hard pressed duty manager facilitated - second room was better but still shoddy. Overall I would not stay here even though it is in a good location and has potential but there are better hotels in Singapore for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money !!!”
Reviews.Author: Bhaskey11
Reviews.Content: I asked for non smoking room and they gave me a smoking room, i had made reservations much ahead . They charge a bomb for the internet service however their website claims it has free Wi-Fi.. The only best part is that it is close to the MRT and bus stops. Rooms and toilets are small ... wouldnt reccomend for anyone staying for more than one night.. i am sure there are better hotels worth the money ..!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: choudhary_sparsh
Reviews.Content: We were on a Far East tour of Singapore, Malaysia and Thailand. Our travel agent got us booked on this hotel. I was a bit worried as i got mixed reviews for this Hotel on internet. But i was amazed with the service and the other facilities of the hotel. We didn't had to wait too long for our rooms. The rooms are nicely built. The space of the room was average. The hotel has 2 swimming pools at two towers. The restaurants are good but the food is ok ok type and a bit expensive. The location is good and we found markets nearby. The staff is cooperative and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business, central location, spacious & comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: toodlepip
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a week for a business trip. Location is excellent, cab rank outside and 3 mins walk from City Hall MRT station. It's very close to Chijmes, Raffles City Mall, Bugis Junction and not too far from the bay developments at Fullerton. Room was on 20th floor with views over Fort Canning park, great for watching the afternoon rain storms come in and break over the hotel. Had a club room, although annoyingly this didn't include access to the Club Lounge on 22nd floor of the Peninsular Tower, which looked great on the hotel brochures and with lots of work to do, would've been a handy hangout. The room itself was lovely, if a little quirky. Giant comfortable bed, floor to ceiling window with great view, lots of light and fantastic nighttime view, too. Bathroom was well appointed and has a large window into the main room. This means you can sit in the bath, on the toilet and look out the window. A little odd, but. I quite liked the touch. Food-wise, only had breakfast at the hotel, which was pretty decent. However, the staff struggled to keep up with the number of guests hitting he breakfast buffet, meaning a hunt for tables, crockery and silverware on most days at peak times. Only downside to the hotel is the pool and gym, which are both at the lobby level, which means traipsing past check-in line and lobby bar if you've been to either. The pool has glass walls, which means sitting in the hotel lobby you can see everyone's legs thrashing about as they swim. Strange design choice, but I guess they're limited for space. Still, minor grumbles and I'd use the hotel again. Staff were friendly and pretty efficient, breakfast notwithstanding. Great location and pretty good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: s_pearceHoChiMinh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights at the Peninsula/Excelsior hotel. The hotel provides a basic value 3 star package. The rooms have been refurbished, so are OK, generally clean, but not so comfortable. Bathroom is OK, not so spacious, but adequate. Air conditioning does work, but the hotel has that "damp - aircon" smell. Like a musty smell as the windows have not been opened for such a long time. I have stayed at the hotel many times, a long time ago before it was refurbished, but there are still remnants of the old hotel showing through. The elevators have been touched-up and there is still old decorated style mirrors in the guest hallways. The breakfast is poor, the breakfast staff, non-existent. Do not go to this hotel if you want service of any kind. So why do I continue to stay here? Location, Location, it is located at a very convenient place close to the Funan Computer Mall, City Hall MRT and a quick walk to Boat Quay and Clarke Quay. There are other excellent hotels close by, like the Swissotel Stamford, but they charge twice the rate. This hotel is a solid 3 star hotel, if you are going site seeing and not spending too much time in the hotel or hotel bedroom, it will probably do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: wongta
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights total with two young children. LOCATION The location was great for this hotel. It was 5 minutes walk to MRT (Raffles City) and to the shopping center. It was opposite of St. Andrews and right above Funan Digitallife Mall with many choices for eating on Level 1. Catching taxi were easy and usually no wait in the taxi queue. ARRIVAL We arrived at the hotel past 4:30pm for check-in. Reception Desk seemed to be a bit busy but checked us in promptly enough (about 10 minutes wait). We were very tired and were assigned a "Deluxe" room 1424 at the Excelsior Tower with two twin beds. ROOM The room was fine, nothing too special or fancy for the same star rating. It had two twin beds. We basically moved them together to make a single bigger bed so the kids won't roll off. Liked the window and window seat. It was quite cozy and one of the highlights of the room. Had in-room tea kettle with tea / instant coffee. Had mini bar/fridge. In-room safe. One funny thing about the room, it was lacking an iron and ironing board! No tub, just a shower with a window looking into the bedroom. Bathroom sink is too shallow for the installed faucet, water would spray everywhere on the counter (be careful if you're using the bathroom outlet as a charger). Another funny thing, NO clock in the room either. We had to call the front desk to ask for the local time instead. FYI - rollaway beds are S$30 per night. POOL(s) The hotel had two pools, both were unheated, but with the Singapore weather, not necessary either. The main pool is right in front of the lobby with a see-through bottom and nice waterfall feature. Our kids enjoyed it a lot and swam in it each evening after coming back from our exploration. It was about 5-6 feet deep max and minimum was about 3 feet deep. There was also a jet spray area with a window looking into the gym. The other pool is at the Excelsior side but its a still water pool. There wasn't anybody using it during our visit. It doesn't have any features just a basic pool comparing to the fancier one in the lobby. It oversaw the traffic down below instead. There is a restaurant or food service connected but again, nobody was using it. ROOM SERVICE We ordered room service for our last night in Singapore as we were too tired to go anywhere else and just wanted to relax with the kids. Ordered three items from the restaurant below (charges a 10% service charge - not too bad comparing to the States). However, the food was just OK. In fact, one dish, it was a seafood noodle, may be deemed inedible because it was so salty, like licking a block of salt. Yuck! The others were average, nothing spectacular about it, one was fish and chips for one and then an order of chicken satay. BREAKFAST BUFFET TIP If your reservation does not include the breakfast buffet and yet you want to try them out. Purchase breakfast vouchers at the Reception Desk for S$23++ per adult. If you go directly to the restaurant, you will be charged S$28++ (at least per the reception desk, we didn't try it out). HOTEL LOUNGE / POOL SERVICE We used the hotel lounge service twice. Once when we met up with a friend late-night and ordered drinks from the Hotel Lounge Bar for us to catch-up. Service was quick and prompt. Open quite late, perhaps 24/7, not sure. The other time, we ordered for off their snack menu (Calamari and Fried Potatoes) while kids and hubby were in the pool. Order was prompt and delivered right the pool and charged to the room. CONS * No Airport Shuttle. Have to arrange your own (either Taxi or Maxi Cab) * No complimentary internet. Either buy wireless for lobby use only (2 hour or 24 hour) OR pay for LAN line. * Housekeeping could be better - multiple times had to call and ask for extra towels and blankets/sheets. * Funky smell in the bathroom - one of the evenings upon returning, bathroom had a horrible sewage smell. We were wondering WHAT was going on. Apparently, upon reading other posts, it happens and a few flushes afterwards cleared up the smell. Gross.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravller-CHC
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula/excelsior Hotel in Singapore was the highlight of our trip. The only downside was arriving late at night there were no real clear signs indicating the reception was on the fifth level! The rooms were modern, Very clean, great air conditioning. Fantastic bathroom, with the best hot shower & great pressure of any hotel I have ever stayed at (and as cabin crew I have stayed in many hotels) It was just a few minutes walk to all major attractions and Clark Quay. The staff were understanding and pleasant. The outside looked a bit tired but was a godsend to come back to our wonderful room. The room had a decent size safe, comfortable beds clean sheets every day and Super Pillows!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ShortieLondon
Reviews.Content: Reception staff greeted me with a warm smile and even though it was only 8:30am they allowed me to check-in. Unfortunately I was given a smoking room which of course was very smelly but I was so tired after a 13hr flight I just needed sleep. I did go out and buy some air freshners which made the room bearable. Also my room was right next to the lift shaft so would of been quite noisey had I not had earplugs! The bathroom was a bit smelly as there seems to be a small drain next to the toilet with a cover that has holes in. The hotel itself is very nice, swimming pools looked lovely but I did not get to use them. Room service food was very good as was housekeeping. The MRT is a 5min walk away which was ideal for travelling. Clarke Quay is great for eating out as is Boat Quay a little further on. Walking distance (1/2hr aprox) to Singapore Flyer.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: okieabroad
Reviews.Content: We had one night in Singapore in transit on a round the world flight. We checked in at 8 am with a sleeping baby after a 12 hr. flight. Even though their check in time was much later, they let us check in so we could get some sleep. A LIFE SAVER! The room was small, but clean with an amazing view. One weird thing was the big window between the bathroom and bedroom. I had no idea why anyone would want to see into/out of the toilet, but Luckily it had a blind. There is a really weird bar downstairs that seemed like a gentleman's club, but the restaurant was nice and family-friendly and the bar in the lobby had great Singapore Slings. We took a late night dip in the pool which was nice. We searched for the hot tub but it's really not there.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing for a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuppack
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival with my wife and 10 year old daughter we were told that we had a room with 2 single beds. We stated that there was the 3 of us and we required beds for all of us. Their only solution was to give us a room with one double bed. There was no other solution offered. The next day we asked to be moved to a larger room or to have an extra bed brought to the room we were in. We were able to move later in the day ony to find that the room did have a double and a single bed but no robes or slippers and no third coffee cup.
