The hairdryer did not work and we found one used slipper under the edge of the single bed. All of this gave an impression of a hotel that should have a much lower rating than 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Bad and horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: godfather_tas
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula side of the hotel is where I stayed with my infant baby and son. The Front office reception has pretty much no customer service sense. The bookings were not organized and when the cleared it up you'd guess they could clear up the confusion but every day of my stay with them for 3 days was a day of disappointment. I had not option as I had payed for my stay in advance and I didnt want to get into a argument as I came for a happy moment to singapore and that was my graduation. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Especially the housekeeping just barges into the room without notice. You need to keep reminding them to clean up the room. I asked of Internet and I didnt get it. So I ended up paying for it. The staff just wont give you any solutions.

Reviews.Title: “DO not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found hairs in bath tub had to tell managers about it cleaner only vacuum the hair disgusting bathroom mould in tiles. Mosquitoes flying about. Uncomfortable pillows. Obtuse front desk.

Reviews.Title: “We really had a best room then, with two big windows face the Marina Bay Sands and skyscrappers across .”
Reviews.Author: maureenadryani16
Reviews.Content: My kids said, "If we comeback here sometime, please ask the same room to stay, Mum. It's great. The pool is cool too. The kingsize bed and the sofa to enjoy the view is a luxurious thing for us" I agree with that.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Razor_ray26
Reviews.Content: A great location, 3 mins walk from City Hall MRT station and central to most of Singapore. 2 small swimming pools idea for a quick dip to cool off after a humid day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: SJ6698
Reviews.Content: Lower your expectations when staying at this hotel, on the plus side the location is great you could not get better, walk to City Hall MRT, walk to Raffles City, lots of food halls for cheap eating, walk to River and more up market restuarants, shuttle to the zoo, night safari and bird park and sentosa - at a cost. However, the hotel is a little tired, we moved a curtain and paint chips fell down, our tv didnt work when we got there (quickly fixed) the shower nozzle leaked, large stain on the carpet outside the bathroom, the toilet blocked a couple of times, the bed mattress was hard, there were permanent stains on our sheets a few times and our air con was very noisy. In saying all of that the staff were pleasant, the pool area was clean, the room was cleaned on a daily basis and our requests to have extra pillows and our shower head fixed were very prompt. They did supply an extra bed for our son which was supplied as soon as we arrived. We ate at the restaurant twice for dinner worked out to be around $30/$35 per head but you can eat cheaper at the local food halls, breakfast was way too expensive so we didnt even try. We would stay here again but mainly for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore Hotels can do better”
Reviews.Author: n219113
Reviews.Content: Hotel only average on overall, compared to price. Quite striking were the dirty drinking glasses at breakfast buffet (lipstick, remainders of orange fiber etc. etc.) staff did not care at all about complaints over two days. When I had a visit from an important client at the hotel staff did not find my room number and had my (quite highranking) guest wait for very long without any support.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Samira2765
Reviews.Content: Our experience was akin to a stay at Faulty Towers, unclean bed sheets, hair in the shower, light globe out, TV remote didn't work well and the TV reception was patchy. Try calling Reception and your call goes unanswered half the time. When I was able to speak to someone and asked again when our check out time was, we were advised the incorrect time, so went to check out only to find out (as I suspected) that we had actually paid for the whole night due to having a midnight flight so was unnecessary for us to have left the room for another 6 hours. Multiple random wake up calls that we didn't book and other randome phone calls with nobody on the line. Based on the above, I would recommend going elsewhere to get better value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and no fuss, great location”
Reviews.Author: sinny7
Reviews.Content: Four of us recently spent 4 nights at Peninsula Excelsior Hotel near City Hall in Singapore. Not plush but the room was. very clean. I think it is a very well priced hotel for the location and the quality. Staff at the reception was very helpful. Be sure to go to Level 22 for a great view of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: M_Antonia
Reviews.Content: We booked thru asiaroom for deluxe. Requested for King size bed, but not available and in return, they upgraded us into premier room and gave us twin beds joined together.. Check in/out staff (same person) was efficient, but cold. if she cud use a smile - it wud be very nice. The twin beds do not come in the same hardness, and the sides are not so rigid, so there will be small gap in between. Only 1 pool (with fountain) was accessible, the still water was not so that my son was a bit disappointed. Aircon was not so cold though we set to the max level, but since some of us got cold, then it was fine. Other than bed and aircon, the room was very good, really value for money. There was a bench with cushion in the room. The location is awesome, as many have said. I will stay here again if i visit Singapore next time. I like them being so responsive, as i communicated with them few times via email before my arrival. Thanks, Thomas Ho..

Reviews.Title: “Suitably located”
Reviews.Author: MSharma2010
Reviews.Content: It took us about SGD 25 from the airport. This included the peak hour charges, airport charge and city are charge. My advise would be to take the shuttle bus service which is SGD 9 per person. Or if your are travellng little, well as well try the MRT. When we checked in, we were upgraded to a premier room, which had a fantastic view of the city, overlooking the marina bay. The room was nice, but had a tiny bathroom. City Hall MRT Station is just 5 mins walking. It is also situated close to Clarke Quay. Taxi stand is right below the hotel. We preferred to travel via the MRT which we found very convenient. City hopping tour buses and Sentosa buses stop right outside the hotel, which is another highlight. Housekeeping service is also prompt. I called for the iron and an adaptor which was quickly delivered. Being a business hotel, we also ot our complimentary newspaper every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Frankareers
Reviews.Content: Great hotel centrally located to prominent sites. Short walk to Raffles and MRT station. Funan IT mall around the corner has Macca's, KFC, Pizza Hut & Pastamania to cater for fussy childrens tastes. Food court on 6th floor has good local fare. Check out the food place down below the Excelsior tower (around the corner) where the locals eat for S$2 to S$5 per dish. Good food. Vegitarian resturant below Peninsular tower. Great swimming pools, good clean hotel we found the beds a bit firm, but we're used to a waterbed at home. Check out the beautiful St Andrews Church opposite on the way to visit Raffles. S$5 taxi ride to Marina Bay Sands building, walking distance to Singapore Flyer, Clarke Quay and many other delights. Arab St is good for fabric shops. We stayed with our twins, 22 yrs, who are Autistic, and got the connecting rooms we asked for. The only downside was S$150 deposit per room charged in case we ordered food. Our rooms were pre-paid months ago from Australia. We stayed in Superior rooms, which is the base level room.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing...”
Reviews.Author: Discerning78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the highest floor (21) on the Excelsior Tower. Got an upgrade to Club Deluxe Room (room only). Initially booked 2 deluxe rooms but the sole occupant for one room could not turn up. Happy and satisfied with the service shown at the front desk and at the concierge (though the direction to a certain place was mistakenly given by the front desk). Cannot say the same about the room. Expected much more for a Club Deluxe Room. First the good things. Two good views being at the corner. Spacious and large. Study desk that has a mirror reflecting the television screen. Now the disappointing portion. No complimentary drinking water. No shaver kit. No list of tv channels. A bit of dated feeling. No free internet. No breakfast (the high price of USD460 for 2 deluxe rooms should have included this). Not exactly value for money. All in all, only stay here if you find it conveniently located to the place you are coming to in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt be happier”
Reviews.Author: magicmat
Reviews.Content: Amazing location, much rather be here than on Orchard Road which was pretty tacky, and far too busy! This was close to Clarke Quay, a great venue for the evening. The underground is seconds away, which is easy to use, and a great experience. The hotel was clean, friendly, a large. My room was fantastic, and offered AWESOME views over the city. Large, funky, and very comfortable, this was actually a hotel chosen for budget, but i was delighted. HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money, Efficient Service”
Reviews.Author: asturi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband and 16 months daughter for 1 night. Hotel was still in good shape as it was only 2 years old. We especially liked the efficient check-in and check-out service, the tastefully decorated modern and practical room (although small relative to other hotels) and felt that it has value-for-money as it was near several malls and MRT stations. We would definitely stay here again if we have a similar budget. Plus we loved the Super King bed!

Reviews.Title: “solid average hotel”
Reviews.Author: nzbased
Reviews.Content: booked through Singapore airlines at $133 a night represents good value for this type of hotel. Its close to nightlife at Boat and Clarke Quay, near to MRT at Chinatown but a good way from the shops. Nothing fantastic nothing terrible. Sleep quality was given a low score because of noise from tour groups which dominate the clientele. Overall for the money a good deal

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel I always come back for the service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Mag15
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Singapore, I have probably been in this hotel seven times, and I always make shure when I am in Singapore this is the place to stay. Great location and service! Close to Raffle Shoping Centre, Clarke Quay maybe walk 8 min.Last time I was hold in Europe beacause of Island Volcano eruption with cause a big problems in communication in Europe. My all return was postponed, and my accomodation in Singapore at Peninsula has to be canceled at this day. I have contact them and they have no problems to accommodate in the dates I will arrive into Singapore. So when I arrive in the hotel I stiil have my room with I have paid back home in Australia. They where great. I stayed few times at Excelsior Towers and this is a better part of hotel. Once travelling with my husband and my son we have luck to get suite on the last floor, since there where some renowation of the hotel. This was great staying in the suite for the price Deluxe double. Two pools both of them are just great one is very popular and the other one quite. Breakfast nothing special I find better food in the shopping Centres located just behind the hotel. This is my favorite place to stay when I am in Singapore. A lots of Australian, South Africans and Europeans visiting this hotel. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: TravellovingAussie
Reviews.Content: When we checked in there were 2 other groups arguing and complaining about various issues with reception staff. Bad omen!! This is actually 2 hotels together. They have over 600 rooms i think. When we booked in months earlier we requested interconnecting rooms as they couldn't cater for a family in one room. When we checked in, no deal. We didn't have this problem at the Furama Riverfront. We realised it was peak season but we had young children, They didn't seem to care, so we had to stay in separate rooms at opposite ends of the floor. Our kids' room smelt like someone had spent their whole life smoking in there despite the fact we were on a non smoking floor. I know this happens a lot in Asia as i travel widely there on business, but this room was the worst i have ever encountered. And it was like that, no matter how much spray they emptied into the room when we complained. They wouldn't change the room either. This was at the end of a 3 week holiday and their attitude was ordinary to say the least. The rooms were a tiny size also, terrible for the price. We will NEVER stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kilgore75
Reviews.Content: I can't complain pretty much about anything in this hotel. May be the breakfast room can be bigger and less busy, but that's just minor thing. I would also prefer better price, but that's the problem with better hotels in Singapore. Room was clean and quiet, breakfast good, staff helpful. I used the swimming pool also and it was nice a relaxing. The location is key for this hotel. Walk distance to Clarke Quay and Boat Quay as well as a lot of shopping opportunities around. If somebody wants 4-5* hotel in Singapore center for reasonable price, there is no many options. Peninsula is one of them. I'll definitely will stay here again while in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not worth for price.”
Reviews.Author: Tanvi_Vatsal
Reviews.Content: try to get your room in excelsior tower, as the rooms r fairly renovated than the peninsula tower. Everything was good, only issue we faced was that our room was located right behind the elevator, which became noisy every time the elevator passed our floor. Close to Clark quay, 5-7 mins walk to city hall MRT station. Taxi stand is right below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: SpeechE
Reviews.Content: Asides from the good location of this hotel, we didn't like much else about this place. The rooms weren't made up each day and we had to call to get clean towels each day (the bathroom was a wet room so everything got saturated each shower!). The hotel staff were incredibly unhelpful and misdirected us around a few times, very frustrating.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location with great service!”
Reviews.Author: jpflies
Reviews.Content: I love staying in this hotel when I am in Singapore. It is a 1 minute walk to the City Hall MRT, a 30 second walk to some exciting food, 5 minute walk from Raffles and Boat Quay and just a stroll from Clark Quay! Who can complain about the service, the front desk team and room service do an excellent job! The only thing I wish they do is remember your name. With an outdoor swimming pool, reasonably sized gym and a newspaper by the door every morning, who can complain. The price is reasonable and great for the business traveller or tourist.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and amenities, good for SIA stopover”
Reviews.Author: anni63
Reviews.Content: we stayed here on our return to Australia from Europe - as a Singapore Airlines Stopover, which was convenient to SIA hop on bus and also a pick up and drop off point for SIA tour buses. location is very central with short walk to most city attractions. 2 pools were really appreciated by the kids to cool off. Breakfasts were very expensive and really not worth it It is easy to breakfast at one of the shopping malls close at hand and alot cheaper. we are a family of 4 and had 2 rooms which was not an inconvenience.service was good , prompt. Our flight came in very early and even though we had not booked an early checkin they took pity on our very tired children and did all they could to find rooms that were ready for immediate check in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: samiva
Reviews.Content: Arrived one day late to the hotel due to the severe snow conditions at Heathrow. Only got to stay for one night, but would recommend the hotel based on the experience. Main shopping street is just walk away and we also walked over to Sim Lim Square. In the evening we took a taxi to experience a food court and walked back to Raffles hotel for Singapore sling. Hotel is not the newest, but we found the rooms very comfortable and cozy. Breakfast was also very good in variety. Two pools outside is a nice touch in this downtown hotel. Would probably not choose this hotel for a special occasion, but for a stop over it's brilliant!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel right in the center, close to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: columbus77
Reviews.Content: We stayed two days in Singapore in the Peninsula Excelsior. The hotel is located very centrally with quick access to subway and boat/clerk quay area. Rooms are very nice and the bathrooms must be pretty new. Ideal for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very underrated hotel in a great location, great pool facility.”
Reviews.Author: soloparenttraveller
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic! shops across the road, mrt station 2 minutes walk as well as raffles place. Pool area is great with 2 separate pools. breakfast is expensive but we ate in raffles place most mornings! can walk to flyer and marina bay, although I recommend walking through the underground passes to avoid the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Not Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Gaurav007
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during my honeymoon trip in Nov 2010. I booked for a Superior Room with King size bed but to my surprise I was given a room with 2 separate beds. I immediately told the reception to change my room but I was told that king size bed room is not available & the room will be changed on the next day. When I told that it will be discomfort for me to pack my luggage again on next day then the hotel staff demanded extra money from me for kind size bed deluxe room however it is not my fault. The rooms are also not upto the mark.

Reviews.Title: “Located at a business district, no night activity but comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: blazt
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nites at Peninsula and 2 nites at Excelsior and overall, our stay was just fine.Hotel is about 2 blocks from the City Hall MRT and the Raffles City Mall. Also right beside the Funan Digital Mall. Rooms at the Peninsula are slightly bigger than in Excelsior. Breakfast is just fine nothing exceptional. The hop-on-hop off bus that goes to Sentosa stops at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: oxymoron2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for a walking tour of the city. It is close to all the major attractions. Also, the MRT is closeby. The environment is friendly. The view from the was facing sea and was amazing. However, the hotel is a bit expensive. Also, the same breakfast everyday spoils the experience if you are staying here for long. If the price is right I would stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a stopover”
Reviews.Author: exclent51
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for one night only as a stopover on our way back to Australia from Europe, it is in a good location being only half hour from the airport and with many shopping centres and tourist sights nearby. We were lucky to have booked early checkin as we were very tired from our flight but they only had a room with twin beds available, but that was fine as they atleast gave us the option of waiting. unfortunatley as we were so exhausted and not used to the heat we didnt really go far from our hotel, we slept for a good portion of the day and ventured to the nearby shopping centres for a while. The hotel restaurant advertised a buffet dinner which sounded great however there was no buffet on when we got there and a very empty restaurant. we odered from the menu anyway and had a decent meal.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary014
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights on the way to New Zealand and 1 night on the way back to Ireland and found the hotel an excellent choice - bedroom and bathroom were spotless - the receptionists were pleasant, welcomming and very gracious on both occassions. Breakfast is a buffet style with food to suit most palates. The reception area is gleaming , and a pleasant space to spend a while or to have a snack meal. If Singapore wasnt so far away we would be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nothing special.”
Reviews.Author: carlisle70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 2 night stopover on the way back to UK from New Zealand. The location is excellent and we found it to be surprisingly quiet at night. The room was small and plain but adequate for our needs. It was almost impossible to get the tap in the bathroom sink to run hot, but the shower was scalding. Towels were very thin - definitely not fluffy. we checked in around 8pm and the lobby was quiet. Check in staff were efficient but distant and not actively welcoming. Breakfast was below average. Coffee was in urns and was cold, pastries (croissants etc.) were dry and tasteless. We enjoyed fresh fruit and yogurt. Overall it was an OK place to stay. We paid a good price for Singapore and the location is a real asset. I wouldn't want to stay more than a couple of days, but for a stopover without paying too much it is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: rajivsrikar
Reviews.Content: We have been alloted room no:1401 on their 14th floor which had an amazing views of the surroundings like high court,singapore flyer, church and market place. the hotel is located in the heart of the city market with cityhall railway station just opposite to the hotel.buses to singapore flyer and universal world are available right in front of the hotel. a recommended place for south indians as there is komalas hotel right opposite the hotel which caters all south indian dishes from 8 am to 10pm. we felt as if we were in india itself. service of the hotel staff is simply superb and cleanliness is very fair. i recommend this hotel to all the visitors and would prefer to stay in this hotel when i visit next.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying”
Reviews.Author: knp12
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights at Peninsula hotel singapore as singapore stop over package with my family of wife,son & daughter. The hotel is well located & all the rooms are renovated, Toilets are clean. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel & recommend it as a value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, woeful service, filthy bathroom....Don't bother.”
Reviews.Author: cnoire84
Reviews.Content: I certainly wan't expecting luxury or to be pampered when booking this hotel. The price (compared to others in the Clarke Quay area) seemed too good to be true and unfortunately it was. Singapore is certainly not a cheap city to stay in (compared to other SE Asian countries at least) but one expects that for around SG$200 a night a room should be at least clean and service to be even slightly welcoming (isn't that why the industry is called 'hospitality'?). NOT at the Peninsula Excelsior.... Check in was atrocious. The hotel is two hotels now combined and so you enter in either of the two original lobbies and catch the lift up to the 'new', combined lobby some four floors up. That is, of course absolutely fine except when we entered there were no fewer than three 'bellboys' / porters standing around at the counter. Not one looked up to greet us or offer assistance with out bags or directions to the lobby. We were 'greeted' at the Front Desk propre with a "Yes?".. Excellent start. The gentleman that checked us in did not smile once, was clearly appalled that two men would want a double bed and not a twin (even to the point of asking me if I was sure!) and brushed us off with not even a hint of a welcome or any offer of assistance or directions to our room. The rooms have recently been refurbished (apparently). We only paid for the lead-in room type ('Deluxe') and as I say, were not expecting luxury by any stretch of the imagination. The room was a decent size, furnished with a double bed only (low to the ground with an awful mattress and the worst pillows I've ever slept on), a desk (chipped and covered in greasy fingerprints) and a strange, narrow window seat, which was really only good for putting things on, not sitting on. The wardrobe was a decent size, huge safe and great air-conditioning (which housekeeping turned OFF every day). Plenty of TV channels and a decent-sized LCD TV. The bathroom was unbelievably filthy. The silicone around the sink was black with mould and behind the sink was covered in fluffy, mossy mould / limescale, which stayed there every day, despite telling Front Desk it needed to be removed (yes, I could have done it myself, but I really shouldn't have to). There were hairs in the bath when we arrived, the toilet seat wasn't attached correctly, the water pressure in the sink was pathetic and the shower screen was too short, so water flooded the floor every time we showered. On two of the four days we were there, towels had long, black hairs stuck to them. Both the bath and bed linen was thin, stained and clearly very old. The bathroom itself was tiny. On one of the days our room wasn't serviced and the paper was only delivered on two out of the four days we were there. Internet in the rooms is chargeable at SG$10 for 15 minutes! No thanks... Not once during our whole stay (four nights) did any of the staff ever greet us, open the door for us, or even just smile. Not once. There was always at least two staff lolling around in the entrance lobbies and they were hardly ever doing anything so it wasn't like they missed us walking past. I wasn't expecting a song or dance every time we entered the place, but it's a hotel; at least a smile or a 'Good Morning' would do! One day I rang the 'concierge' (a term they use loosely) to ask for directions to somewhere. He didn't know what I was talking about (his English was terrible which is fairly unacceptable in a guest services role in a country where English is one of the official languages and the language all education is taught in...) and so just hung up on me after umming and ahhhing. I know it seems like I'm having a rant, but the simple truth is a hotel should have clean rooms and friendly staff, no matter what you are paying to stay there. In this hotel the room was filthy and every single staff member we saw (and there was A LOT of them floating around) was not just unfriendly but completely ignorant unless approached first. If the room were clean and the staff even slightly more friendly it would have been decent value for money. The location is terrific; 5 mins walk to City Hall MRT, Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Raffles City. Going by what other reviewers have reported, my experiences are clearly not isolated, which is a shame because there is no doubt this hotel has potential.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location, Good room & Good service”
Reviews.Author: Vinodn76
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the heart of the city. We had requested for an early check in but due to non-availability of rooms in the non - smoking zone, they upgraded us at no extra cost to the next level. Services were good, room was cosy and cute and the sleep was peaceful. The breakfast menu though similar on most of the days, it was tasty. This hotel is good for Indians who want to have Indian food but do not get a hotel near Little India. At the basement of the mall opposite the hotel there are 3 Indian restaurants which offer average quality food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JuliaSolo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near to City Hall subway station. Large rooms. Two good pools.

Reviews.Title: “gud hotel 4 families..!!”
Reviews.Author: preeti_18s
Reviews.Content: we had booked this hotel before only.but when we arrived it took almost 1 hour for them to give us the room. we had booked 3 rooms. this hotel has two towers.i suggest everyone take a room in the new tower as the rooms of the old tower are very boring and really old fashioned. so we shifted to the new tower. there is a false pool. which is really beautiful. in all the rooms are really clean. also the bathrooms are clean. the service is also good. there is also a travel desk at the ground floor. so in all i would rate the hotel as 4 star.!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: Theaveragetraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while attending expo at the Singapore Convention and Exhibition Centre - that in itself is an amazing venue. The hotel looked a little tired from the ouside and in the foyer. Check in took a little while - staff seemed a bit stunned that they had to check in ten rooms together. It was actually funny to watch them running around behind the desk, literally bumping into one another. Not sure why they were hopping from one computer to the next... Glad I was on my own as accommodation room was quite small. Hotel is close to MRT and the city. Obviously a bit of a way to the convention centre, but easy to travel to and from. I think the hotel is in a good location, plenty of shopping nearby and Raffles is not far up the road. Didn't spend much time in the hotel except to sleep, so it proved quite adequate for that, no noise problems in my room. Staff not overly friendly. We tried buffet breakfast one morning, pretty expensive and not the best food. But plenty of other places near the hotel to eat. I would like recommend the hotel, but there are literally hundreds of places to stay in Singapore that I think would ive better value so check a few of those out on the web and on reviews. Peninsula Excelsior was nothing special. I will stay elsewhere next trip.

Reviews.Title: “A tall ask”
Reviews.Author: Brian1311
Reviews.Content: Not a lot of money goes a long in the beautiful city of Singapore, hotels are amazing 6 star hotels for the price of a 2 star... Unfortunetly this hotel missed the mark. Room was large and air conditioner worked bed was very comfortable and the view of sinapore was plesent! Staff were friendly but not very useful, food hall/bistro was nice enough but the food was terrible! Bar drinks were expensive and swimming pool was filthy. WiFi did not work. We decided to use the stairs one day and were lucky to survive, boxes, tools, rubbish blocked the stairwell and fire exits. We informed staff but nothing was done. There are better options in Singapore for the price of this hotel... Would look else where, but if desperate this hotel will do forva short stay

Reviews.Title: “Value for money business hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: ScubaZorro
Reviews.Content: I hate hotels with hidden costs, e.g. internet which is typically a rip-off. This hotel allows the traveller to book his/her stay with internet included, avoiding nasty surprises. My room was comfortable and clean, but not luxurious, with all the necessary ammenities for a business traveller (or tourist) who's not planning on spending a lot of time the room. Breakfast was a good standard buffet that would suit a reasonable range of pallettes. The hotel was recently renovated and has a modern feel to it. The rim-flow pool with glass sidewall that can be seen from the lobby gives off a lovely cool feel, which is great in Singapore. The hotel is located right next to Funan Digitalife Mall for electronic shopper and half a block from Clarke Quay for nightlife and good food (touristy). It is located in close proximity to MRT stations so it's very easy to travel around Singapore with this hotel as base. Price was quite reaasonable. I'm staying here again in future trips to Singapore...

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION BUT POOR SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: mystay2009
Reviews.Content: Well, where should I start? We arrived by 10am as scheduled and I already requested for early check in through sending them an email that we will be there early and I expect a swift check in. However, when the time we arrived, II waited for 1 hour standing in the front desk since the person handling our check in was a student intern without the supervision of a hotel staff.. We are 3 persons and she put us on a 2 single beds room and she reasoned out that there are no other rooms available yet for check in-- undermining the fact that I sent a previous email to them! She said that there is a sofa there which will compensate the two single beds. Well, I agreed halfheartedly and not to waste a lot of time arguing with her. We were located at the tower (I think the older part of the hotel); the elevator is freaky! It is old (the buttons are like 3 decades old), the carpet is freaking dirty! need vacuuming! When we arrived in our room, my first reaction was where was the sofa she's talking about? Ahh I guess that's one with the window! HELL NO! I will fall if I will sleep there! It is not even a sofa! It is just for seating purposes! Therefore I called the front desk and told me that they will give us an extra bed-- however until we checked out, no extra bed came to our rescue. I ended up sleeping with my mom (sideways, since we are afraid that one of us will fall). Another thing I noticed that the furniture are very tired already, they need replacement! the interior of the hotel is not that bad but need more refurbishment or better design. It is roomy but needs more decoration. I have no problems with outside noise. It is a good sleep though we are like in a can of sardines this time. For breakfast, there's few choices but it is tolerable. The food is fine no other comment for that. Check out? It took almost 45 minutes for me. It is really disappointing knowing that this should be a 4 star hotel (I guess the Capitol Hotel where we stayed in KL, which was only 3 star is so much better than this!) BUT FOR THE MOST PART, AT LEAST WE STILL HAD A NICE STAY IN SINGAPORE SINCE THE HOTEL HAS A VERY GOOD LOCATION. I hope that location will compensate all the bad things for this hotel. I wish that they would improve their service and CLEAN THE CARPETS. Although I recommend this hotel, I suggest that you should check out more options which will give you GOOD service in a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what it was but great location”
Reviews.Author: dc_globetrotters
Reviews.Content: I had a short 3 night stop over in Singapore for a bit of sight seeing. The hotel location was fantastic but it was expensive for what it was. The room i was in was a corner room which overlooked Marina Bay - an absolutely fantastic sight to fall asleep to. Unfortunately the room had an inter-connecting door to the room next door and the soundproofing between rooms was pretty poor. On the other side of me must have been a cleaners store room because i regularly heard clattering dishes however it wasn't loud or constant enough to grate on my nerves. The MRT was a 2 minute walk away, as was a major shopping complex. The Esplande was also only a 15 minute walk from the hotel and the hotel was also part of a shopping complex in itself. The hop on/ hop off bus stations were right outside the hotel - 2 different stops for the two different operators that i saw who used those particular stops. The pool is in a pretty poorly planned spot and has a glass wall - which ordinarily would be fine but not considering it can be looked into from the main lobby of the hotel where the piano bar and checkin/ checkout desk is. The staff weren't particularly friendly and when i asked a question about the buses from the guy downstairs, he sent me next door to the tour desk. The guy at the tour desk was pretty rude and turned me away pretty quickly once i told him i only wanted advice on the bus and was not interested in booking a tour from him. all in all, it was a good enough hotel in a great location. i had heard Singapore was really expensive so i was prepared, but obviously not prepared enough as it cost me the same amount of money to say at this hotel as it did to stay at one of the Crown Casino hotels in Melbourne where the quality and service far exceeded the Peninsular in Singapore. I will recommend this hotel to others but tell them not to expect the same level of quality as you would if paying $200+ AUD for hotel in Oz.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Terrible Sevice”
Reviews.Author: DilliTraveller06
Reviews.Content: A good location does not guarantee a good stay - The Peninsula Excelsior Hotel in Singapore is a real example in point. For starters, on arrival after an international flight, had to spend one and half hours in the lobby because the Travel Agent and the Hotel had messed-up the dates - entered Nov instead of Oct. An obvious error like this needed the travel agent to formally send communication to the hotel's sales dept, who in turn checked and confirmed to the front desk and only then was a check-in undertaken. A triple seater room has only half a wardrobe, that means no space to keep clothes properly. Request to room service for plates and glasses took over 45 min after 3 reminders. Ordered dish from the room service menu, not being available never intimated. These are some examples of the quality of service. The hotel seems to be running just on the sheer strength of its location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Boltstress
Reviews.Content: Check in took nearly an hour, didn´t get the level of room I booked, breakfast was expensive and very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JellyBWA
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel 11 months ago to secure a good rate for the 2010 F1GP. I liked its location close to the race track. As time went by, after reading plenty of reviews, I was unsure of what we were going to find when we got there. Most of the reviews had been negative. Because of this I emailed the hotel about a month prior to our stay to ensure a refurbished room in the Peninsular tower. They replied that they had no booking for us. I had to email them a couple more times before they actually received our booking through from the Aust. agents. Once confirmed I was a little happier, but still unsure of what we would receive. I had booked a deluxe room. We arrived into the hotel about 3.40am after our flight and were very impressed when we got to our room on the 13th floor. Lovely big corner room with windows facing the Marina Bay area and also to the east. Fantastic views to be enjoyed of the race track and Padang stage area for the weekends events. Good storage areas for our clothes so we could unpack for the week. Flat screen tv, but the quality not so good. Tiny bathroom, but it did the job, nicely refurbished, although no clothesline to dry handwashing. Didn't have any problem with paper thin walls. Never heard from neighbouring rooms. Hotel location was perfect for the GP. A 50m walk to the entrance gate and then a leisurely stroll to our seats at Marina Bay. Fantastic. No need to bother with public transport at all. Brilliant. After the event exited the gate, walked the 50m and into our hotel lobby. Wonderful... Wifi in room expensive so opted for free wifi in lobby. Did the job. Tried to access Wireless@SG from room but not able to. Hotel in great location for MRT. Only a short walk to St Andrews Square to escalators to enter MRT. 2 blocks from the Singapore River, a quick and easy walk to Clark Quay. Funan Mall next door with plenty of food outlets to choose from, not to mention IT. Overall we were very happy with our stay there and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Leigh57
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel for 1 night on our way to the UK in August and 2 nights on the return trip. We found the hotel was in a great location. Within walking distance to Clark Quay, Raffles Hotel, Orchard Road and the City Hall MRT train station. On our arrival, the checkin was very quick and easy. As we arrived on an early flight at 8 am, the staff were very helpful and friendly and let us check-in when a room became available at 10am. We stayed in both the towers, each room was very clean and the beds good. On our second stay, our room was very near to the lifts, which was quite noisy with people talking while waiting for the lifts or the bell ringing when it arrived, but by 10pm this wasn't too bad. We didn't find the wait for a lift took very long at all but longer during check out time. The breakfast was pretty good, expecially when we found the chef doing freshly cooked eggs. (Near the ktichen) We checked out early to avoid the rush, and the staff stored our bags till we were ready to go to the airport later that night, and even booked the taxi for us. No problems at all. All in all, a good stay at a reasonable price. We'll stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs improvements.”
Reviews.Author: Juliehock
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula is situated perfectly for shopping, eating, cultural activities as well as being close to buses and the MRT. The hotel itself needs a good update, the bathrooms in particular are a cause of concern for me - mould, even in tropical Singapore, should not feature in a bathroom! I've stayed in this hotel twice now, and the bathroom issue still remains. I dont feel that this hotel deserves the four star rating as it is at present, but service is efficient enough, and environment comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed regarding friendliness & helpfulness.”
Reviews.Author: Walshys69
Reviews.Content: Very dissappointed, upon arrival, no room available for early check in which had been paid for. Lady at reception was very very rude & unhelpful, took for me to ask for her manager to sort. Rooms & bathrooms very small. Good location but we have visited Singapore on 3 other occassions & were looking forward to our 3 days but this put a big downer on holiday, not so sure any more.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay, but let down by poor service”
Reviews.Author: Kika040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a few days in July. We had asked for a smoking room when we booked, but when checking in the girl on the desk when checking in told us that a non smoking room was not available, but she could get us a non smoking room on a smoking floor. The girl who served us was not that proficient in english which made things the more difficult. When we got to our room the room stunk of cigarette and we were not happy at all. When we tried to change rooms they told us a maid would be there to clean the room again. The maid didn't arrive, but the air conditioning helped to circulate the air. The breakfast served in the restaurant was great. The location of the hotel is perfect for a short city stay. The room was clean and tidy despite the smoke odour but the service provided by the staff let us down.

Reviews.Title: “Good Rooms & Location but Poor Service & Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Tripper21
Reviews.Content: I was in the renovated wing, which does have large rooms to a very high standard. Location is excellent on edge of CBD and 3mins walk from City Hall MRT station. No Wifi, just wired internet in room, but very expensive at S$ 18 per day!! Front desk staff somehow seemed to be grumpy and unhelpful, not the normal singapore hotel style. Restaurant was very expensive and somehow seemed unimaginative and tasteless and poor quality. Certainly not worth the S$30-35 for dinner or breakfast. Lots of excellent places nearby. I had much better meals at the stalls in the adjacent Funan Mall for less than S$5 Conclusion - Eat out and avoid the staff and the WiFi and the hotel is actually very good!

Reviews.Title: “Small Room , good location”
Reviews.Author: guan77
Reviews.Content: A very small bathroom, small room, room has not been renovated, air-conditioning is very cold, even when turned off than in the control room, the front office that is less friendly, downtown locations and strategically located, next to Funan IT center and peninsula plaza, with 5 minutes walk to City Hall MRT. Breakfast with a sense of modest.

Reviews.Title: “Oke for one night”
Reviews.Author: mohebbi
Reviews.Content: We were rather let down with the places to stay at the Peninsula Excelsior. Advertising depicted freshly renovated, tastefully adorned rooms but our room absolutely wasn't either of these. The Lobby was absolutely rather spectacular but the rooms did not contemplate this first effect we got on arrival. Our room was rather little, had 2 lone beds - rock hard, so rather painful to doze on. We found out rather rapidly that the partitions of room were very slim - we could discover our friends utilizing the lavatory and wash, baby bawling next doorway, persons partying next doorway - so had adversity sleeping. On the upside- this hotel is well positioned, close to Chinatown and City Hall MRT. The room was clean and neat and staff cooperative and somewhat friendly. This was our 4th stay in Singapore and preceding places to stay was large but we were very let down with this one. I would not stay there afresh but if you are not awfully fussy about little rooms, shabby furnishings, hard beds, slim partitions, loud friends you may desire to address if you only desire to stay for a twosome of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Griffin10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the WORST I have ever stayed in for service. As we checked in the staff could not understand english very well and had a hard time trying to communicate with them. We were in a club room which breakfast was included. As we were eating breakfast we were approached by the service manager to tell us that breakfast wasnt included and scrambled about to try and get our room details. We were left embarrassed after this incident. We followed this up with reception who apologised for the error and ensured us we werent charged. The complimentary pieces of laundry, we were charged for. Upon check out we were charged an additional $332 for the upgrade which was previously paid for. We produced the recipts then they apologised for the error. When I returned home I received an email from the duty manager (Derrick Cheong) who was informing me that the hotel will be charging my credit card for $776.82 for someone elses stay at the hotel!!!! At the alleged time I was in the hotel I was not even in the country! I called the hotel many times to discuss the issue but could not get in touch with the duty manager over the phone. No phone calls or messages were ever returned. Over email I told the duty manager I was not even in ther country and provided him with receipts of my fully paid booking and didnt hear back from him. I frequently visit Singapore and have stayed at many lovely hotels and this is definately NOT one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location, next to Clark quay & close to Raffles hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blasio
Reviews.Content: we stayed in this hotel for four nights, The hotel is very modern and clean even though it is almost 30 yrs. old.Please don't get misled by it's age.The rooms are quite spacious and have good views of The Singapore Flyer, Clarks quay, Supreme Court etc. Had a very pleasant stay as the city is very clean. Most of all it is very safe, and you can definitely trust the cab drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BanoraPointBazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Club Room in the Peninsula Tower with access to the Sky Lounge - staff wonderful especially Samantha who couldn't do enough for us. Room came with free internet. Great location. MRT/Bus easy to use, make sure you get a 1,2 or 3 day pass, gives you unlimited travel. Excellent shopping nearby or explore the city by MRT/Bus. Wasn't impressed with Sentosa or the Marina Bay Sands Casino complex. Cheap local cafe under the Hotel, meals from $2

Reviews.Title: “Telephone charge rip-off”
Reviews.Author: Ernst188113
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel many times before and had always - in the past - found its overseas call charges reasonable. However, on this occasion, telephone charges were unexpectedly far higher - roughly four times what they had been, and very expensive by any standard. When queried persistently, staff reluctantly produced a very complicated price schedule which did not identify call destimations, and was headed "For Hotel Use Only". The dramatic price increase I experienced coincided approximately with the Youth Olympic Games held in Singapore; possibly many other hotels were doing likewise. Until a few years ago the Singapore government limited hotels' call charges, which prevented this kind of price-gouging getting the country's tourism business an undeservedly bad name. Those controls should be re-introduced.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of bedbugs!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NorthCarolinaMo
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel and the location; however, my room was infested with bedbugs. Needless to say that put a damper on things.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value with Central location”
Reviews.Author: TWMC2010
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel that has benefited from recent renovation work to all of the rooms and facilities. The staff are very helpful and efficient, providing useful information about the surrounding area and local attractions. The room was clean and well equipped with a large working desk and high speed fixed internet as well as WIFI. I advise you to pay the extra for a club room so that you get access to the sky lounge and all of the added frills that come with it including evening cocktails and free food throughout the day. Even if you don't book a club room try to get access to the sky lounge after breakfast just to take in the almost panoramic views of the city and bay area, it’s well worth a look. The hotel is just a short walk from several shopping malls and Raffles; it’s also just a couple of minutes to the nearest MRT station which gives you fast access to the rest of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Travelled61
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior twice before and found it quite enjoyable. This time it was a different story. I had booked my accommodation in several months in advance through the Singapore Stopover programme (as on the other 2 occasions). The check in time was very long, with the receptionist continually disappearing out the back. Eventually I was given a key to a room on the 8th floor. When I opened the door to "my" room I found that there was already luggage in the room! I quickly left and went back down but the woman who had given me the key was no longer there. I explained my situation to a young trainee who again kept disappearing. During one of the times I was standing there, an Assistant Manager came over so I told him my story. He asked me take a seat and he would see to the problem. Eventually, I was given a key and told I had been upgraded. My room was in the Excelsior side and was much smaller than any of the standard rooms I had been given in the Peninsula side in previous visits. The bathroom was one of the smallest I had even been into and there was no way that more than one person could be in there at a time. The sound on the TV was stuck on loud and there was mould in several places. If you stay here DO NOT get a room in the Excelsior side!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but a great location”
Reviews.Author: SubhraB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel fairly last minute on Booking.com and we good a pretty good deal. I'd advise this hotel mainly for its location and connectiveity via MRT. Places like China town and Crk Quay and withi walking distance, there's a really nice bakery opposite the Central MRT by the name of "Bread Talk" and just behind the hotel some great places to sample local cuisine which we never got tires of. If you do find the prawn and fishballs getting to you there is an electronics mall just adjacent where you'll get you Pastamania and KFC. Singaporeans never tire of their fast food. We didnt really spend too much time at the hotel and were out most of the day, but the staff were polite and friendly, rooms clean (they should be condisidering the price we were paying!) My only concerns was the time they take to check you in..I had to wait almost 40mins with my luggage!). WI FI is around $17 per hour. Enjoyable..yes I'd go there again but ensure you book in advance! (PS dont forget to check ou the Piano which seemd to play by itself in the lobby...spooky!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Selsa
Reviews.Content: I needed a good hotel close to my work locations. I also wanted a fitness center (to get over jet lag and stress), a good breakfast and a pool (for myself and for my teen, who joined me at the end of my work project). Peninsula Excelsior gave me all of this. I had trouble with my room lock one morning - the entire key pad shut down. Housekeeping AND maintenance jumped to help me as quickly and efficiently as they could. Also, I had a grand view of city, especially the Padang and the new Sands casino. It made the room feel very special. Bathroom could have used some updating.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: Globe_Trotter1809
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very nice hotel in singapore. From outside it looks old hotel but inside its very clean and posh. Rooms are amazing giving sea view to merlion point. Breakfast is very good and good variety. Nice place to walk and see the place, supermarket is next door. overall , very pleasant experience and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sitasrivalli
Reviews.Content: travelled with hubby and children.location was excellent.service is well above expectations.deserve compliments for excellent maintainence and room service. recommend to go for it when u r in singapore

Reviews.Title: “Room like 1 * service good”
Reviews.Author: Flaming040
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 9.15am for our 1 night stay and reception booked us into a room quickly. The booking was for a superior room with non smoking and breakfast. Our room was on the 7th Flr, smelt of smoke and had 2 beds for the 3 of us. The carpet/bed covers and decor needed urgent refurbishment. I rang and a bed was brought to our room within 15 mins though sheets smelt of smoke. Location was excellent as one block to MRT/bus and shops. We ordered fish and chips at 4am (jetlag) which arrived within 20mins and good. The breakfast buffet had pancakes, cereal etc along with asian cuisine and had enough choice and good. The coffee was dreadful. We thought of using the pool though we would be in full view of everyone in reception area. We didn't tip during our stay. The only service problem was the porter did not arrive in the morning and we took our bags to the car. Apparently the staff changeover time is 7am and there is a delay, we took our bags down at 7.25am. In the next room a child continually tried to open the locked connecting door. Would not stay again as not value for money and I can still smell the smoke on the sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Good but left with disappointment”
Reviews.Author: OZT18
Reviews.Content: The attitude & behaviour of the Bell boy at Penninsular on the evening of 21st January 2010 left me angry never to return. When he collected my luggage from my room for departure I tipped him S$10 but when it came time to load it into the bus to go to the airport he again came around "begging" for tip again. I reluctuntly gave him $5 more and he made a crappy face as if he was doing me a favour. Is $15 tip not good enough in Singapore? Disappointing experience at the end of a very pleasant trip.

Reviews.Title: “OK but has its drawbacks ....”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelsAsia
Reviews.Content: Check in is slow - staff are rude, not helpful, they don't listen and don't advise you of any hotel amenities (breakfast etc) Speaking of which DONT bother having breakfast and certainly don't pay for it - it is terrible ! .... better to go to TCC/spinelli/breadtalk !! Hotel is in a good location, for tourists and also for business in the marina/bras basah area. Nice pools if you are on vacation. Both times i have stayed at this hotel i have stayed in a club room good size and recently refurbished, so i cannot comment on other room floors/types. This time on the excelsior side (hotel is actually in 2 separate towers) - internet was so slow and at times unusable which for the business traveller is a huge drawback. Not sure about the air in the room - felt very stuffy in the mornings - even though the air con was set at high and cold. So if you can see past all of these points - the hotel is OK .

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault the service”
Reviews.Author: sola_ani
Reviews.Content: This was my second holiday to Singapore - the first was with family where we stayed in an apartment (as no hotel could house 6 people in one room), and this trip was with a friend for a well-earned girly holiday, so we decided to pay a bit extra to stay in a twin club room, with breakfast and cocktails. I think all up we paid about $100 extra for a club room for 7 days as opposed to a standard room - a small price to pay for the excellent service we received. Breakfast in the Club lounge had enough variety to keep both of us happy, with meats (hot and cold), eggs (scrambled, omelet or made to order), rice or noodles, pancakes or french toast, fresh and preserved fruits, cereals, toast, tea, coffee, etc. Cocktails and snacks in the evenings were things like quail eggs and roe, marinated octopus, minced chicken on cucumber, fish or chicken satay - all quite tasty - and better yet - Free!. We were on the 21st floor, and heard no noise from any renovations. The beds were firm (which I like), there were two types of pillows to choose from, and we had two items laundered free each day - a bonus in the heat and humidty of Singapore. We had no problems with delays in lifts as noted by some reviewers, even though the hotel was full (my ears actually popped in the lift, it went up so quickly). We encountered no rudeness, no problems with lift keys, only the service and politeness that one associates with so many Singaporeans. I did note one man with a lift key problem, but he clearly didn't read the instructions on how to use it. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone, not only for its location, but also its staff, amenities, and views. The only comment I would make would be that a retractible washing line over the bath would be a bonus, but not stricly necessary if one has a bit of ingenuity.

Reviews.Title: “NOT for Business Traveller”
Reviews.Author: alexra66
Reviews.Content: Very Disappointing experience . the room was very small and very smelly . ( NO Smoking room ) . The check in attendance was very poor and I had to wait my luggage 1 hour . Service people are very young and/or very uprofessionally rude . Whereby the location is excellent and the rate affordalble for tourists . Only positive is Internet ( no wifi ) free & excellent in the room like everywhere in SIN . Not my kind of place . Sorry .

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: scliffy
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the uncomplimentary reviews on this site and was anxious about my stay, but wanted to stay in this area and got a good price on advance booking. I had no worries, the staff I encountered during my stay were exceptionally helpful and courteous. There was no problem with the lifts or check in that previous guests had come across. I love the location for ease of travelling around Singapore. The views were outstanding from the higher floors and the club room was ideal for me as I was travelling alone. The hotel was quiet, clean and comfortable, ideal for a stopover. The breakfast was barely adequate, but there are plenty of other places around, including nearby BreadTalk, which I have used on previous visits and found excellent value for a quick breakfast. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't even bother about this hotel if I were you...”
Reviews.Author: Fotzepoliticz
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended by the site of a conference I was attending. It sounded pretty good from the information in the website and the price, even though not being in the "budged" side was fair for what they've claimed. The hotel staff was always confusing, there were hidden fees in the price they had provided (be aware that booking a hotel in Singapore online does not include a 17% fee). At trying to book a shuttle back to the airport the person at the concierge was very unfriendly and basically told me that I should take a taxi to the airport. From my basic understanding as a frequent traveler and costumer there are Motels that will treat you with more respect. The front desk staff could surely use better training, specially when it comes to customer relations. The Internet is unbelievably slow, and if you have to pay for it on a daily basis be prepared for a shock. Breakfast did not have enough fruits, with only watermelons and melons being offered. The rest were baked beans, eggs, bread, and bacon. Overall, it is a hotel in a great location, with good potential but I would not stay there again neither recommend it to a friend -- and I think I overpaid and the only thing that saved my stay was the view.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent view!”
Reviews.Author: kmango80
Reviews.Content: Hotel has an excellent location.I stayed with my parents for 4 nights and 5 days. Staff was very courteous and helpful. Provided us an early checkin. Hotel Lobby is good. Room provided to us had a superb view of the Singapore flyer and Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay. Very convenient location. Although the Rooms are a bit smelly due to the carpet and the bathroom is small. Breakfast was OK with almost the same menu everyday. Loads of good restaurants at a stone's throw distance from the hotel. Overall my trip was good and a value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Charm of staying around Singapore river”
Reviews.Author: changs
Reviews.Content: We had a five days vacation in Singapore and stayed in Peninsula Excelsior. While arriving in Singapore one should be careful about pre booking. All the flights arrive early, but the hotel check in times are typically 12.00, which often creates a problem. However, in Peninsula Excelsior, we were given teh room by 9.00, which was good. There are two towers - Peninsula and Excelsior. All the restaurants, swimming pool etc are located in Peninsula tower, which is the older construction. Our rooms were in Excelsior tower which were very spacious and well furnished. Specially staying in an upper floor in Singapore gives you excellent view of the city. The hotel has a good breakfast, lunch and dinner buffet, quite reasonably priced. This place has got good eating joints around - Myanmar, Japanese and various other cuisins. It has a good travel desk and all teh sight seeing trips can be availed very conveniently. the hotel seemed to be veru popular among tourists from the very large tourist turnover. I specially liked the glass waled swimming pool opposite to the reception. The reception area is very spacoius with lot of sitting areas around. The rooms are quite luxurious and well maintained. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with great location.....”
Reviews.Author: InUsSw
Reviews.Content: Over all i was satisfied with this hotel. The check in was quick, rooms were good but little small and the location was great. The hotel is very well located and has good shopping malls surrounding it. Its very close to the train station and the view from the rooms is great. The best part of the stay was the breakfast which was included in the room price, and was once of the best complimentary breakfast i have eaten. Over all I will recommend this hotel in Singapore for both business and Leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Ambience of the Hotel was amazing & unbelievable.”
Reviews.Author: karthik_kumar_2004
Reviews.Content: We have been booked this Hotel by our Tour agent for our busines trip for a group of 40 people from India to attend Conference program.We all really shocked to see such a five start hotel with all facilities. The reception area itself is very big with mutiple sofas,seating areas and small bar at the corner.Outside the reception there is a water pool which is amazing. The service was excellent and the receptionists are open to answer our queries and serve 24 hours round the clock.The view of the city and tall buildings from the window door of my Suite room is unbelievable.And the best part is Morning free breakfast served with variety of fruit juices ,salads,breads and various dishes...I would recommend this hotel to everyone who visits Singapore. Thank you very much for making our stay for 3 nights so pleasant & memeroble.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: ruthwin
Reviews.Content: My family and i ( children were 6&4 at the time) stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. We found the service pretty good, everyone was friendly and attentive. We had a long wait till check in, but the receptionist gave us lots of updates and did her best to organise our room as quickly as possible ( the wait was because i had requested the peninsula side so not their fault) They had originally booked us into the excelsior side of the hotel, but i had read that the peninsular side had been modernised. It was well worth the wait, modern and comfortable and heaps of room for our family. The only complaint i would of had was that although our children are small, they had assumed that one of them would sleep in the queen size bed with us and told us there was only enough room for one single bed. The room could of easily taken a second rollaway bed, but as our children are little they topped and tailed anyway. Breakfast downstairs was priced not too bad on a budget and there was plenty of things to choose from. The hotel was handy to lots of things we wanted to see on a short break. One thing i would suggest though is not to book any tours through the downstairs tour agents. They were rude and did not disclose some information. We booked a tour and our son took ill the following day, when i tried to cancel they said i could but would forfeit 100% of the fee paid ( ie full price) I can understand a small percentage, even 20% withheld, but i felt 100% was really outrageous. Overall i would recommend this hotel to families. We all enjoyed the pools and the rooms were nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrijhwani
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of the city, about 20 mins from the airport, The hotel although old has been shaped up into a very modern hotel. The executive room package is mind blowing with an exclusive & dedicated executive floor & lounge. Check in, Check out, Breakfast can all be managed on the floor giving complete privacy. There is no WIFI in the rooms or atleast mine didnt have.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is centrally located for my stay in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: Michael255100
Reviews.Content: The service is good. The room is good. The Hotel location is ideal for sightseeing & transportation is convenient. I enjoyed the stay with my adult son in the hotel ( 3 days), however we have to apply Tiger Balm after sleeping in the bed during the duration of the stay. I intend to visit/stay in the hotel during my next trip to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Hatsumura
Reviews.Content: Pluses: perfect location for exploring the city (in a walking distance from the subway, Civic area, Boat quay, Clarke quay and Esplanade), two nice swimming pools and gym facilities. Clean, spacious room and fairly priced. Minuses: at the time we arrived, there was no double-bed room available (though we have booked one in advance). They managed to upgrade us to a deluxe room, which was nice. Noise from the neighboring room can be annoying. In our case, we had very noisy neighbors, shouting and laughing loud late at night. Some people wrote angry reviews about this hotel because of its classification as a 4-star. I think it has all the amenities of a 4-star, even though we skipped the breakfast buffet. If you expect it to be a 3-star, you will be more satisfied. But if you are expecting it to be Hong Kong's Peninsula, maybe you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Please "Dont go there"”
Reviews.Author: Holidays0610
Reviews.Content: Have just returned. Booked through travel agent arrived late afternoon best rooms already gone you get whats left. After moving 3 times, last time to the 18th Floor room 1811, bathroom constantly under water, carpet outside also under water, they had heaters going constantly to try and dry it out. It smells and was getting worse. Breakfast was a joke, 1 chef trying to cooks eggs for people queueing up. Cutlery kept running out. In summary the worst place i have ever stayed. Location and views were great but get that at another hotel Perth W.A

Reviews.Title: “Singapore- the place to be for its beauty”
Reviews.Author: kvsmohan
Reviews.Content: A great Hotel, centrally located and very cozy and traveller friendly. The interiors are great and so is the room service. The rooms are well maintained and the view from the roomsis great.

Reviews.Title: “Knock Please”
Reviews.Author: south_east_eurasian
Reviews.Content: Checking into the hotel, we thought it looked pretty comfortable. At the time, there were renovation works in progress, which we didn't know about beforehand. This meant that it was a little noisy during the day. Not a problem because we were out and about most of the day anyway. Our room was large with two windows (a corner room), a very large King bed, and we had an extra bed fit into the room, as it was very spacious. The bathroom was also large, with a separate shower and bath. The very major downside to having this large room was that it right next to the service lift, so neverending bells and dings could be heard throughout the night! Another downside to the hotel was slow service, and when we requested the extra bed, it wasn't given to us until the next day! This was where the housekeeping staff was kind of knocking on the door the next evening, and we were all just getting dressed out of the shower, standing in towels, whilst getting the kids dressed for bed. If I hadn't been standing there to holler "Yes excuse me!!!" while hearing someone enter the room without hearing any knock or bell beforehand I'm sure they would have entered under not so very nice circumstances! Other than that...location was great. That was just our experience, so hopefully don't get a room near the service lift...and make sure your "do not disturb" light is on whilst showering or otherwise. They did kind of seem to want to blame us for not having the "do not disturb" light on...which is why the barging in ocurred? Hmm...you make the choice. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - DONT BOOK THIS THROUGH TRAVEL AGENT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: diappointed2
Reviews.Content: I had this hotel booked for me by a travel agent here in Melbourne. When we got to this hotel we were given a key to a room on the 8th floor. The carpets were filthy and the corridor smelt of cigarette smoke. The room was like a shoe box with a double bed in it and hardly room for anything else. The bathroom was tiny. I was there with my 14 year old girl and 8 year old boy. We were to share the bed!!. I went straight down to reception and said that I could not stay in this room for 2 nights and could certainly not share with 2 large children. They said that they would bring in a portable bed which was a bit of a laugh as it certainly would not have fitted in. I explained this and said that there was no way I would go back to that room with my children. I was very upset as this was the first time I had broken any of the long haul flights to Ireland and I was really looking forward to staying in Singapore. I guess we were very lucky and got an upgrade. That room was a delux and was really lovely. Now that I have looked into the situation i believe that Quantas Holidays in conjunction with travel agents are in some way connected with certain hotels. My advice is this : If you want to stop its a great idea but BOOK YOUR OWN HOTEL ON-LINE. Find out the size of the room and make it quite clear what you need. I paid more for this room through the agent than I would have if I had booked it on-line. However, the managers of this hotel should take control of the situation and make sure that the room is adequate for the number of people staying - and certainly not expect 3 people whose ages were listed - to share a double bed!!. I would only recommend the hotel if the delux room was booked - certainly not the twin or double rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Peninsula Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: KiwiTraveller72
Reviews.Content: Dreadful service, dirty rooms and an arrogant 'don't care' attitude from staff sumed up our experience. We arrived very late at night (around mid night) and had a 6am flight the next morning, so were using the hotel as a crash pad. We had advised the hotel months in advance that I was allergic to feathers, so needed a duvet and pillows that weren't feather. This request was ignored and it took 1.5 hours to track down someone from housekeeping and to get new bedding - not a great outcome given we only had a few hours to sleep. The staff were very rude and unhelpful. The room was small (though that is the norm in Singpore), the bathroom and bedding dirty. Definately wouldn't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The 3rd and the last”
Reviews.Author: kkdoo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times in the past 8 months. It was in fact my favorite Hotel in Marina Bay. Their newly renovated rooms are really good and clean. My last visit was a nightmare, due to it's poor customer service. We check in late midnight due to flight delay, we had a 2yrs old baby, and have requested for Non Smoking Deluxe Room. The reception staff mentioned hotel was fully booked and gave us a Very Small (+-10m2), Not Renovated, Smoking room with Queen Bed and blocked view. So small, even one baby cot couldn't fit into it. We found the room really unacceptable and totally the worst compared to the rooms we had on our 2 earlier stays. After arguing, he finally gave us one Very Good Deluxe Room, Very spacious renovated room with KingSize bed and a good view. I wonder why did we need to argue only to get a decent room??

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Peninsula Excelsior”
Reviews.Author: Pamies
Reviews.Content: Do not book or stay at the Peninsula Excelsior the service is terrible Firstly they are currently renovating rooms so if you are booked in here you will hear jack hammers from 9.30am to 6.30pm. It appeared to us that the work was happening on the 10th floor but we could easily hear it on the 15th floor we were on. We booked a triple room months in advance and arrived at the hotel at 4.00pm, well after the check in time of 2.00pm, to be told that our room was not available yet and we should go shopping for awhile. I had not advised them what time we would be checking in so the room should have been ready from 2.00pm. I told the girl behind the desk that I was travelling with my elderly mother (78 years) and we had been travelling all day between airports since 8.00am that morning and that she was very tired and needed to rest so please hurry with the room. We were given 1 free non alcoholic drink voucher for the lobby bar which was a small glass of weak fruit juice or could have even been cordial. I was told that they would come and get us from the lobby when the room was ready. We noticed other people waiting in the lobby with the same drink. After an hour I approached the desk again to be told no the room is still not ready. I voiced my complaint yet again but was told to please wait. After another half an hour, it is now 5.30pm and we have waited an hour and a half in the lobby I return to the desk and finally the room is ready but no one came and got us. We go up the lift and although I booked a non-smoking room as soon as the lift doors open we are overwhelmed with cigarette smoke. We push on and open the door of our room to find that it was a room reeking of cigarette smoke and it has a double bed in it even though I booked a twin room with an extra single bed. We did a quick U turn and returned to the reception desk to be told we are booked out but we will bring in another bed and ‘refresh the room to remove the smoke smell’. Any of you who do not smoke know it is impossible to remove the smoke smell from a room that is heavily used as a smoking room. I argued that my mother has Asthma and there is no way she can stay in that room but I continued to get “we are fully booked”. If I had not paid for the room in advance I would have walked out long ago so gave up on this girl and asked for the Manager. He finally arrived and after a long discussion with him he finally found us another room which was smaller in size but on a non-smoking floor. No compensation was offered to us for this like a free lunch/dinner or even a free alcoholic drink or even a room upgrade. So after waiting an hour and a half for this room we get there to find: • Twin beds – great but they have been pushed together so have to call Housekeeping to get them separated and the bedside tables rearranged. • Another bed has to be delivered – that takes another 45 mins • The electronic key tag that you place the card in does not work so no electricity in the room – that takes an hour to fix as the reader is faulty not the cards • The room safe does not work, batteries are dead – that takes an hour for new batteries to be delivered and installed. We finally got out of our room after all the repairs and problems at 7.45pm to go for dinner. When we go to check out I am told that I have to pay for the internet I have used in my room. I argue that nowhere does it say in the room or in the room manual that there is a cost for the internet so I am not paying. They certainly were not going to get any more money out of me. Next to me at the desk are 2 guys arguing that they booked a twin room and have been given a double bed. I hear the usual “We are fully booked” so I lean over and tell them we have just booked out of our room which is a twin so that is available to them. On passing through the lobby on other days we notice many people sitting with their bags and the free drink and this is late in the day. It appears that this hotel is well under staffed in cleaning staff and make guests wait for their rooms. The annoyance is that they will not tell you how long you have to wait and at the price you pay for this hotel the service needs to be much better. We also stayed at the Pan Pacific Singapore which I could not fault on anything so my advice is give the Peninsula Excelsior a big miss and go to the Pan Pacific. It is a shame that this hotel’s service is so bad as the views from our room were fantastic and even the room was OK but I would not put up with this bad service again.
