I don’t go away on a holiday to be sitting in a lobby waiting for a room at the end of the day and having to fight for what I have booked and paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: mdevanshk
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the one good thing about the room - great view across the cricket club toward the marina and the new Sands hotel. Fantastic. Everything else was bad. The room wasn't cleaned properly. Food remnants on the movable table near the window Hair on the floor in the bathroom A used toothpick on the windowsill badly stained valances on the bads peeling wallpaper Got back to the hotel late one night and was told that food at the bar would take an hour to arrive. Where were they going for it? Malaysia??? The only people I would recommend this hotel to are my enemies

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at excelsior singapore wing”
Reviews.Author: karthik2e
Reviews.Content: Currently this hotel under renovation. The service was good but ambience was not appealing

Reviews.Title: “All about location”
Reviews.Author: Hanna_Diana
Reviews.Content: My company in Singapore booked this hotel and they keep a stringent eye on the budget so tend to make practical rather than luxurious choices. From looking at other reviews I saw that the hotel has a wide variety of room standards so I made my preference clear at reception: a good view, cleanliness, 24/7 free internet access and away from the ongoing refurbishment noise. The room looked to have been refurbished about four years ago and so the bathroom was showing signs of needing regrouting/descaling but was clean enough so I did not have to return to reception to change rooms. Plus point: there was a large safe in the wardrobe which would hold small laptops and other cumbersome valuables. The hotel is busy and you meet people from all walks of life in the lifts and lobbies. Don't expect staff to anticipate your every need and jump to carry your luggage or open your taxi door (the taxi rank is directly outside), but if you ask, they are generally very helpful. The breakfast is disappointing in quality by Singapore standards, but there is plenty of it, including fresh pineapple and water melon and someone on hand to cook your eggs how you want them, though you may have to hunt for a fork. Tip: there is a quieter breakfast room opposite the lifts if you are not one for madding crowds. The rooms are serviced with fresh linen and towels daily though you will have to phone for an iron and ironing board. Tip: befriend the housekeeper on your floor. Plus point: the air-con is easy to control. Room service food is disappointing, but plenty of places to eat just a minute's walk away, including Chimes and Raffles, Indian set-meal cafes, and a Starbucks-clone cafe below. If you are a photographer you will be pleased to know that Cathay - the only safe, intelligent place to buy higher-end photo equipment (unless you are cleverer than the wily merchants) - is just opposite in Peninsula mall, and there are some friendly second-hand dealers in the basement of the Adelphi, also opposite. But as always in Singapore, caveat emptor, do your research first or repent an on-the-spot purchase at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “So so service”
Reviews.Author: bonurge
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. although i got a room w a nice view the service is not as good. prior to checking in my emails sent to them were not answered. i booked the room through their hotel website but realized that you can get a better deal when booking with asia rooms.com or booking.com since the rates are the same but with breakfast included. they have coffee and tea making facilities but no complimentary water provided..The only good thing about this hotel is that is has a good location w mrt station just 3mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Singapore, typical business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smeg01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here basically as a stopover - we needed a Black Pepper Crab fix. Unless you work or have friends/ relatives in Singapore there really is not much point in visiting. Except as mentioned above if you crave Black Pepper Crab. So .. that said if you need somewhere in Singapore to stay the Peninsula is a respectable mid range hotel providing a good city location, reasonable price for Singapore and it's a clean comfortable hotel. The pool looks pretty good, and as long as you are an exhibitionist you will enjoy it. The pool looks directly into reception. So as guests check in & out they look into the pool. Try to avoid the business traveller rush for breakfast if you would like Bacon & Eggs. When it's full the service is shocking .. but otherwise they have a good selection of pretty good quality items. If you like to eat outside they have a little area behind the Coffee pots, but you will need to fight off the flying rats (pigeons), they don't scare easilly and will eat off your plate with you.

Reviews.Title: “3 star or 4 star?”
Reviews.Author: John476
Reviews.Content: This is one of two locations that I stayed in Singapore. On some sites, it is categorised as a 4 star hotel, on tripadvisor, as 3.5. So I had some reservations about its quality. We booked at least 2 months in advance, but when we arrived, we were informed that there were no non-smoking rooms available and they placed us in a smoking room. After checking it out and finding that the smell was totally unacceptable, we complained and was put in an upgraded non smoking room (albiet with twin beds). In many respects, this customer service is unacceptable. Why didn't the hotel upgrade us straight away when they made a mistake allocating rooms? I am also surprised that smoking rooms are still available. Even so, the premier room was hardly inviting, and we could still detect smoking on a supposedly non-smoking floor. Lift wait times was also long, but after reading many reviews, it was to be expected. There was only two things that were positive about this hotel. Firstly, its the location. Right in the city, and very close to the 'city hall' mrt. Also, there is a taxi 'Q' right outside. Secondly, we had a very discount rate, which made it more acceptable. However, all in all, I would not choose this hotel in the future as we believe it does not provide the luxury we were expecting. If you are looking for 4 stars, find another

Reviews.Title: “Nice room ..a bit small for a Premier room thou”
Reviews.Author: Natw82
Reviews.Content: Good location near City hall MRT-good shops all around the hotel area.We pre booked and paid for the room-a bit disaponnted as suposed to get double bed instead they gave us twin beds as nothing else avail .There are two towers we stayed in the Peninsula Tower.Check in was slow hoever once they realised we are Premier guests they told us to go to Level 22 to check in instead as its sep from normal guests.Breakfast was ok. staff very polite. I would stay at this hotel again -we stayed on level 20 which had amazing views

Reviews.Title: “Great location and club rooms”
Reviews.Author: bellajess
Reviews.Content: I will stay there again we got a good deal on the Club Rooms and the view was excellent, we enjoyed our nightly drinks for 2 hours as being aussies we drink a lot. It was nice having breakfast up on the 22nd floor as there wasnt many people. Very close to buses and mrt . I would definately stay again but would have to be the club room. We also had free internet and there was a computer on lounge floor for free if you didnt have your laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in my life so far!!!”
Reviews.Author: sputnikdude
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend to anyone. Beware, there is a door in almost every room that leads to a room adjacent to it (which is a room of another person). You can hear every little noise coming from neighboring room. In my particular case someone brought a prostitute there and they screwed all night. Consider it like a hardcore porn for the blind: you can hear everything. I had changed the rooms twice and each time there was a door that led to another room. Granted they are locked but they are not soundproof at all, as I said earlier. The breakfast is included, it is average and you get tired of it after a few days since it is all the same. You are better of crossing the street and eating in numerous small restaurants that are located below the ground, the food is good and cheap there Room service is good, but reception is average. Internet is not free and is a total rip off. Overall so far the worst hotel experience I've ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go there”
Reviews.Author: Tree69
Reviews.Content: Well, in over 20 years of business traveling, this is the worse hotel. Service not good, room (1013) which is a family room and totally outdated. Not clean, bathroom you would not want to shower in, humidity spots all over the place... and just look the picture with all the dust. A no no, sure you will find something better and cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great position with fantastic views”
Reviews.Author: Ann083
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to get a good deal on a club room, Can't comment on the rest of the hotel, except to say it always looked extremely busy. We stayed on the 21st floor with panoramic views of the river and chinatown. Room was comfortable and quiet and with access to the sky lounge and the very friendly staff, our stay was wonderful. Would not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Penniless after the Peninsula”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner1983
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed for two nights in the Peninsula hotel in Singapore. I had booked it online several months ago and when I went to check out, I had been charged for additional costs without first being consulted. The receptionist claimed his English wasn't good enough to explain the charges. I had been charged twice for a room clean, the first time I have ever had this charge and I was charged $11 for having my bags brought up even though I had been told it was part of the service. Staff were rude and unfriendly and it was a poor time as a result in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: woodsjc
Reviews.Content: I booked their Romance Package as it sounded good value with early check in and late check out plus breakfast lunch and dinner and the trip was for our anniversary. Room was a club room with club check in. Only problem is that you have to line up at the normal reception to get a key to access the 22nd floor. Reception area always seemed understaffed with queues and two times we waited over 20 minutes. It is also strange that the reception are is on the 6th floor. Our room was a corner room on the 19th floor and did have fantastic views. The room had a king size bed but the decor was tired looking. We had requested a no smoking room and were quite put out when we discovered we were on a smoking floor. The smell hit you as soon as you exited the lift. (I can't believe anywhere nowadays allows smoking inside). When we went back and queried this were were told it was because we checked in early (why did I book this package?) We were told that to change rooms they could only offer a smaller room with a smaller bathroom. Smaller bathroom? The bathroom was the worst bathroom in a hotel I have ever stayed in. The only floor area was where the door opened. The worst thing was that there was no proper shower, just a hand held shower head, placed at about thigh level. We opted to not move if the room was going to be worse. Lunch in the Coleman room was OK, but the nibbles in the Sky Lounge were aweful. Cold mini spring rolls and fried mini fish and chicken pieces. Our dinner was also in the Sky Lounge and we had been told there was no kitchen there and the food needed to be brought up. I think it came via the stairs. The soup although nice was barely lukewarm, the roll was rock hard and we couldn't even get a knife into it. The main meal also was not hot. We opted to have breakfast in the Sky Lounge next morning (a mistake) and everything was cold although in bain maries. We can only assume that the food had already cooled before being placed there. We overheard some interesting conversations while waiting in line. One woman had booked for the night before as her plane was due in at 5.00 am. It was late by 3-4 hours and when she got there she was told the room was not ready. They had no answer when she asked how this could be when she had already paid for it. Another person was complaining that their toilet had not worked since their arrival the day before despite continous phone calls. We had a late flight out and the girl in the club lounge told us we were welcome to stay there and rest until leaving for the airport. We thought well maybe this will make up for everything. However at 6.00 we were told we were only entitled to tea or coffee. Would it really have hurt them to give my husband a beer, after all we had paid $350 for the night. Positives of the stay - the view from our room and the Sky Lounge were spectacular. The girls in the Lounge were excellent and couldn't be more helpful. I notice from other traveller photos that there seems to be quite a variance in quality of rooms, maybe we were unlucky. But I would suggest that you could do much better elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TigerBeerUk
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel for a 6 day holiday in Singapore after reading all the various reviews. Some reviews were bad, some good with most of the bad ones being older.. The hotel was very busy when we arrived at 16:00 in the afternoon and we were upgraded because there was no other room of the type booked available. The room was nice, big and with effective air-con, bathroom good, shower excellent. the room was kept clean and well stocked with soap etc., There was some restoration going on so it was a bit noisy during the day but the hotel is improving and getting better. Location couldn't be better with Clarke Quay/Boat Quay just a block away, 2 MRT stations a block away, Raffles City/Hotel a block further and Bugis Junction another block.. It was great value and we will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: OursDispo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like thousands of other hotels in big cities. Nothing more nothing less. In general I would say it was good value for our money. We were looking for an hotel not too expansive but with a swimming pool (we had 2). Staff is very friendly, has most hotel workers in the area. It took a lot of time to get our room (which has been reserved a month earlier). They had our reservation but no room was ready whan we chacked in at 15:30. They finally found something 3 hours latter after I refused a smoking room. Not sure if it was an upgrade. The willingness of the staff to solve the problem made the process less painfull (although incomprehensible).

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ratje
Reviews.Content: For our 2-night stopover we used a special ‘Chinese New Year’ promotion and booked the Clubroom for lower than the Standard room rate. (Clubrooms are on the top floors in the Peninsula Tower, with guaranteed view and with the access to SkyLounge on 22nd floor and private check-in.) Our arrival at the hotel was a bit chaotic as different staff members were giving us contradicting information, but we managed to check-in eventually. The room on 21st floor was on the small side but clean and with modern decor and equipment. I have never seen a safety deposit box of this size - you could easily store a big cabin luggage in there! There was no balcony, just a bench with moving coffee-table to enojy the view. There was also a window between the bathroom and the sleeping area. The location is pretty good, close to a metro station, walking distance to Raffles and Clarke’s Quay, one evening we even walked from the far end of Orchard Road back to the hotel. First morning we took our breakfast in the SkyLounge, but the choice was very limited there and we felt we did not really fit in the busy world of business travellers. So on our second day we went for breakfast to the general area which was extremely crowded and noisy but was well worth the trouble as the choice was much wider and the food was excellent. The luggage storage ‘room’ is just a dedicated place in the general entrance area and we felt it was not very well secured. Everyone coming or entering the hotel had passed just a few centimetres next to our backpacks for nearly 10 hours. All in all, our reservation in Peninsula Excelsior turned out to be a less good choice. Next time will try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good location, good services, good room”
Reviews.Author: beautyofsummer
Reviews.Content: The 1st night we got allocated the old room which hasnt been refurbished because the hotel was packed but got told they would change a new room for us the next morning and they did. The new room was amazing, everything new, plus a fantastic view of Singapore Flyer and Esplanade from 1 window; from this window I also could look down to see the hotel swimming pool and its outdoor area. From other window, I could see the Pennisula Plaza, the church on Coleman St. The service was fantastic as well. I called them 3 or 4 times, they all got attended and stuffs were delivered to my room straightaway.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like to hear what your neighbours are up to!”
Reviews.Author: darwin1905
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during an en-route stopover between UK and Auckland. The hotel was in an excellent position to access the city sights. I understand the hotel was undergoing refurbishment of the rooms and it certainly needs it. Our room was dull drab and very grey. The bathroom was a bit tight and you had to sidestep to get out of the door. The shower was located within the bath and when you put the shower on, the screen directed the water along the sides of the bath which in turn flooded the floor - I don't mean just a little bit - about 50% of the water went onto the floor. As the floor was tiled, it was exceptionally slippery and dangerous. The plumbing had a lot to be desired - if anyone used the toilet in the room upstairs, you knew exactly what they were doing - this did not lead to a good night's sleep. I'm not sure whether they are doing anything about this during the refurb - they certainly need to. The staff were indifferent - we arrived at 7.30am, yet we were unable to access our room until 2.00pm. Bearing in mind this was a deal connected with Singapore Airlines, I would have expected to have been treated better than this. The lady who checked us in did not speak the best English and proceeded to carry out the check in process, only to tell us at the end we should come back at 2.00. We were very worn out from our flight, so we came back in an hour and asked a different receptionist and she was completely the opposite - very helpful and arranged a room for us immiediately. The public areas were quite pleasant and the swimming pool, gym and sauna were all good. The hotel was very busy with lots of people tooing and frowing at all hours of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “OK place”
Reviews.Author: mizoko
Reviews.Content: One night stay In Peninsula Singapore for visa run. Check in early morning no problem. Late check out without charge (actually i agreed to pay 50% but they did not charge me). Room, small but well appointed. AC could be better. TV really bad with no movie channel. Room service is efficient this time. Fast and good food. Breakfast is really poor. Get your brekkie outside. Enjoy my stay there. Not for a honey moon, but perfect for short business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: Jasper6678
Reviews.Content: Stayed in club room, room is clean with good views. Speedy check in, breakfast has limited selection but I only need a good coffee in the morning. Location walking distance to train station and shops. But we took taxi everywhere, it is affordable and taxi drivers were incredibly honest and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor.”
Reviews.Author: VonStiffy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after 13 hour flight from London to be told the room was not ready & would have to wait a couple of hours. We were given a token for a free beverage for our troubles (soft drinks only). Went back to reception to say this was not good enough & were given a room within five minutes,strange there was no room available earlier - stick with me on this, it gets better. The room we were given was thick with dust so back we went again. We were then given another room (no rooms available?) and so went to check it out. At last a cleaner room but kept holf of the key to the previous room until we were completey satisfied. Went out for dinner to Boat Quay as the restaraunt was almost empty - apparantly the hotel was full??! We returned the key to the previous room almost six hours later.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Nat006
Reviews.Content: We have been several times to Singapore and stayed mostly in a hotel at Orchard Road (which is closed now), so we were looking for a "replacement" at a good value for money. Location-wise the Peninsular Excelsior was a great choice. The MRT station City Hall as well as the Raffles City and the Suntec City were all in short walking distance, so were nightlife spots (CHIJMES) and sightseeing places (Museums, Raffles Place, Merlion, Chinatown etc.). There are plenty of coffee shops around, so need to take the breakfast at the hotel (breakfast was not included in our room rate - we found it relatively expensive on the spot). The staff at the concierge desk and reception was very friendly and helpful. The room was newly renovated, spacious and nice, with a big bathroom with separate shower and bathtub. The only negative thing I have to say is that we asked for a non smoking room and got a room used by smokers before. As in most hotels all over the world it seems to be impossible to get a free Wifi access, even in the year 2010 that service should be standard in hotels, but it seems that hotels simply do not get it that they lose business by charging expensive rates for the Internet, since guests simply go to coffee shops or fast food restaurants which provide this service for free. Anyway, we will definitely consider this hotel again for our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: MarkSk
Reviews.Content: There's two entrances to this hotel. One is very prestigious. The other, where we were dropped off looks very low budget and gives a very negative impression. The room was fine and comfortable but like everywhere in the hotel didn't feel as clean as it probably should have. The bathroom is very small and it's very easy to trip up as you enter them. Breakfast is OKish but things run out quickly. For approx. £16 a head I was pretty disappointed. The hotel is made up of two towers so can be hard to navigate. We always use Singapore as our far east stopover but doubt we'd revisit this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: barryjenny
Reviews.Content: Awful experience here - took over an hour to check in - sent to wrong tower block for room, when we finally found our room - the keys did not work -- got into our room only to find it hadn't been cleaned - then took another 30 minutes to find us a very average room Very unhappy with our experience here - would never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “If you are not Mr/Ms Super Picky, you'll most likely love this hotel :-)”
Reviews.Author: dogpaddy69
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd time my partner and I stayed at the Excelsior wing of the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel in Singapore. We simply love its location - Singapore river, Clark Quay, the Merlion, Raffles hotel, City Link (underground shopping), Suntec City (restaurants & shopping), Chinatown and Bugis are all within walking distance from here. Funan Centre (a shopping centre specialising in digital cameras and laptops) is JUST NEXT DOOR!!! Orchard Road is approximately 6 bus stops (or 3 MRT stations) away. The Peninsula Excelsior is not Shangri-La, nor is it Ritz Carlton, therefore please don't expect Let-Me-Wipe-Your-Buttock-Service. There are 2 swimming pools in this hotel. Initially, my partner and I booked our accommodation with Hotel Ibis, but decided to cancel the booking because Ibis does not have a pool. I will let my photos do the rest of the talking. And by the way, the Excelsior wing was undergoing renovation when we were there from 17th-23rd Dec 2009. Noise was minimal. But considering how efficient Singapore can be, I won't be surprise if the renovation has already been completed by now :-)

Reviews.Title: “location is good but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: RaymondMZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in this hotel for Stopover Holiday provided by Singapore Airline in September, 2008. We had to wait for almost 3 hours to get our room. I understand that a hotel has its rule for check in/out time, but as we booked a Stopover Holiday, would it be nice that the hotel can offer a room according to our arrival /departure time? The room and bath were very old and the carpet was smelly. The electric kettle is very old and dirty, I would throw it away if I had something like this at home. It stopped working after several use and we got a replacement - as old and dirty as the previous one. I would not choose this hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Derricktbl
Reviews.Content: Checked in 19-Jan 2010. Waited 2.5 hours for my superior room. Given a old dirty standard room worst then hostel size. Bed size prettyt sure is double singlebed then Queenbed. Tried to call reception but no answer after 3 trys. Gave up as rushing to work. 20-Jan 2010 back very late and called for room change next day and agreed. 21-Jan 2010 changed to a new renovated room pretty small but nice. Bath tub was 1/3 glass sheltered and during showering water flow out all over floor. Lousy design and messy wet bath room. checked out 23-Jan 2010. Noticed my jean still in the wardrobe, called 3 times and promised to return call but nothing. 4th time was frustrated and shouted at them then receive call said nothing found. Also realise my wife's lingerie was lost dont know which day stolen. My wife came only 23-Jan so was pre packed in my luggage. Is a thief hotel so make sure you lock all your belonging when not in the room. Will never go back to this hotel anymore. Similar rate can get plenty new hotel like Ibis at bugis.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stopover but wouldn't stay too long”
Reviews.Author: TravellerAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We wanted somewhere to sleep en route from Autralia to Europe so didn't want to pay a fortune so chose the Peninsula Excelsior. Overall, a good choice. Checked in late at night & was not impressed as the check in area was old & in poor condition but once we got to the rooms, we felt much better. They had obviously been recently upgraded & although still quite small, the beds were comfortable & the bathrooms were excellent. For the price we paid it was definitely a positive experience & when all the renovation work is complete, it will be better still. Not in the same league as our usual choice in Singapore - The Mandarin Oriental - but for a quick stopover, it is great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: IndiaPriti
Reviews.Content: Date: 20th January 2010 Reviewer:Priti Daruka India We have just returned after a very pleasant stay in Peninsula Excelsior ,Singapore.The hotel is magnificient in all aspects.The location is excellent and the view of the city from the room is fabulous. Especially during the night, when the city is lightened up one gets an incredible view of the city. The hospitality of the staffs is appreciable. The breakfast was very good with lot of variation from cakes, fruits, juices, varieties of breads and lot more. I loved the pool. though it wasn't a big one. The Live Indian music was too good. Overall I would say the hotel is good for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Izza14
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our friends stayed at the Peninsular Excelsior Hotel on the 26th Dec 09 before our departure on a cruise that evening. The only hotel in Singapore (after trying at least 20)that would let us check in early and pay for 1 night only with breakfast, the other ones I tried wanted to charge for 2 nights. We had a fantastic room, newly refurbished and spotless, huge bathroom. Restaurant had a great view from seating and on the outside deck. The location was ideal for shopping and close to everything. Would not hesitate to stay there again. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: Douglas_Limba
Reviews.Content: it's a great place on new year end holiday, it's place not far from marina bay, where you can see a wonderful merlion statue, in the new year eve, a fantastic fireworks show there,, the hotel itself, it's cool! great building, great facilities, great serve, great people!

Reviews.Title: “very nice location, but...”
Reviews.Author: RegiCal
Reviews.Content: well, i think everyone who had stay in this hotel agree that this hotel location is very good nice building too (i love the glass swimming pool) but i think they really need to work on the service, cleanliness, and the small small room :( if u dont mind about this (like ure gonna travel the whole day, and only need a bed at night) its okay

Reviews.Title: “serves the purpose of a nice stopover”
Reviews.Author: Simiona
Reviews.Content: The Peninsula Excelsior is exactly what you would expect of a Stopover Hotel. It is quite big, with a huge lobby (if you are lucky you can see well-built rugby-players swimming in the pool nearby!), two pools and a gym. The rooms are spacious and functionally furnished. The bathroom is excellent. The building itself is a bit too old for Singapore standards, but they are doing some work on it at the moment. The service is ok, but a bit slow for the amount of people coming to check in or check out.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: skljajic
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 5 days as a part of a tour - the hotel is on a fantastic location, near many attractions, restaurants and bars. The shopping centers are around as well as other hotels. Pretty much anything you'd want to visit and see in Singapore is within walking distance from Peninsula or a short taxi ride (taxi stand just outside hotel). This hotel is usually very busy with lots of guests in and around. I stayed in Peninsula first time about ten years a go and it seems that hotel has lost some of it qualities but all in all it was still a great value. The rooms are a little smaller than in other hotels and ours was fairly clean.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: RafayEva
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 days, and best of it was the excellent location (100 m. from City Hall station, very close to Marina Bay, a couple of minutes walking from Clark Quay...). Views can also be gorgeous, at least they were in our case. Cons were that internet connection was expensive, and that our room was small. Bath was a little bit claustrophobic. So, recommendable hotel for going sightseeing, not for staying.

Reviews.Title: “beyond the expectations”
Reviews.Author: MargaretRiverRTodd
Reviews.Content: We booked the top part of hotel around A$150 a night which you can access to club lounge so you can check in and out privately and also included breakfast, cocktails at happy hours 6-8pm and unlimited internet with 2 items per day laundry service. Staffs are so efficient and friendly. My husband were working and me and 3 years old are having holiday the sky lounge staff are so helpful. We were not sure about this hotel before we checked in but if you say upper level of the hotel ( renovated nicely) you won't regret! I went to walk around other levels and looked bit tacky without view and run down at down stairs. amazing view and fantastic location. We stayed 5 nights we are very choosy about accomodation but we were very happy with this hotel.we had 2 type of Pillows each one is firm and another is i think feather,,, I thought it was great option!

Reviews.Title: “Panoramic View of the city”
Reviews.Author: CozyBeavers
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel in Singapore recently. We have managed to booked a room at the Skylounge, which is located at the top floors of the hotel with special keycard access in the lift. Staffs were friendly and efficient, and the view at the dedicated Skylounge breakfast room was nothing but spectacular. The room is spacious with a great view towards the CBD and Singapore River, and we particularly liked the bay window seat where you can relax and enjoy a nice cup of tea while admiring a panoramic view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is infested with bed bugs, room 1626. Peninsula Tower. Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tashione
Reviews.Content: I checked in to the hotel with my spouse during SCSM. and to our dismay, we were bitten by bed bugs early morning at 2 am. This had affected our sleep as we needed a good rest for the marathon run at 5:30 am. When we complained during check-out, they just passed us a 'customer satisfaction' form to fill up. huh. what a service. Then we were charged for 'consuming' 2 small bottles of drinking water at the mini-bar. Here is the conversatiion; hotel staff : Do u take anything from the mini-bar me : No hotel staff after rang up room service : You had consuming 2 bottle of mineral water (actualy it is just drinking water) me : there are not complientary ? hotel staff : no, any thing from the mini bar are charged me : Sorry, I dont about that, can i pay you back with 2 new bottles of 'mineral water' ? hotel staff : no me: why ? hotel staff : because you consumed already and there are big different in price of outside and hotel charge me : so you are trying to overcharge me ? (fyi, the 2 bottles of 500ml drinking water were charged SGD9.60. it was a rip-off.). You dont provide guest with drinking water ? hotel staff (her name is peggy) : hmm, every hotel practise differently, we dun provide mineral water (it is just drinking water actually) for guests. so you have to pay for taking from the minibar me : then you should inform us about the charge peggy: shall we ? me : yes peggy : then, next time we will tell our guest. me: ...... And there were false alarm of morning calls at 12:30 am twice. The phone just rang and no staff answer.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job for a short term stay”
Reviews.Author: AussieAussie77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a stop over in Singapore and is was booked though Singapore airlines. The hotel is clean and centrally located and was adequate for a stop over when youre out and about. It was pretty good value.

Reviews.Title: “Average facilities, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: SwapnilKamulkar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Peninsula in Singapore during our vacation in Oct 2009. We travelled as a family of 3. We found the experience of staying very agerage. The room which was committed was not given, and when we asked they demanded more money. The breakfast spread was very average. The worst part though was the size of the room. It was very tiny, with a child and our luggage there was hardly any space in the room. Apart from the location of the hotel, I would call the over all experience very average.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SPOT FOR A STOPOVER”
Reviews.Author: LUV2TRAVELSINCE1956
Reviews.Content: Had a day & night here on the way home from Europe. The hotel allowed an early check in with no fuss. Room and amenities were very good. Position is great, close to Clarke quay which is a great spot for dinner. Would recommend for short stays.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: MelandAsh
Reviews.Content: We had read the reviews for this hotel after booking our hotel and were a little concerned as there did not seem to be many good comments. We arrived at 8 am and figured we would have to wait til after lunch for our room so we settled in in the lobby for our wait. We were given a room around 10:30am and were very pleased with what we got. The view was great and the room was extremely clean. The bed was very comfortable and the air con worked wonderfully. We slept well each night. We were also given late check out without asking and at no extra cost. The staff were extremely helpful. We found the hotel was close to everything that we wanted to see and do. Will definitely stay here again....

Reviews.Title: “The Most Disgusting Hotel in the Entire World”
Reviews.Author: ExepriencedManager
Reviews.Content: Having nearly 30 years of hotel experience, and fairly well travelled - simply the worst hotel experience in the entire world. The rooms are not even fit for animals or prostitutes that charge by the hour. I was allocated Room 914 for a 4 night Singapore Airline Stopover - and have escalated the issue with Singapore Airlines and the Hotel Board, nothing short of a disgrace to ANY hospitality industry. Wooden walls that were crumbling, the smell, the fixtures that had fallen off the walls and left on the floor, the mould around the taps in the bathroom, the black aircon vent, the torn carpets showing electrical wiring underneath, stickers attached to the doorframe, the utter filth....etc avoid at all costs - I should have

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel for service in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyUK7
Reviews.Content: IF YOU PREPAY FOR A ROOM or FOR EARLY CHECK-IN, DO NOT EXPECT THIS HOTEL TO HAVE A ROOM AVAILABLE. We arrived at 6AM & despite PREPAYING for EARLY CHECK-IN, we were told by reception staff, who just could not care, that there were no rooms available until '"'official" checkin time of 2PM and '"you just have to wait". Each time we approached reception we were given a different excuse or lie and finally after getting the hotel manager to reception, we managed to get a room OVER TWO HOURS AFTER ARRIVING. The foyer was full of people in the same situation and the staff just could not care! Luggage piled inside front door & complete chaos-suggestion, take your own case(s) otherwise you may not see your case for hours. SO MANY BETTER HOTELS IN SAME CENTRAL AREA. We have travelled extensively to over 40 countries and never received such a horrible check-in experienced

Reviews.Title: “Great location + comfy and modern room = ideal stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: owlAnon
Reviews.Content: I was initially going to book this hotel anyway because of the reasonable price (under £70 per night) and the location. I then discovered the hotel was one of those included in the Singapore Airlines Stopover package, and as we were flying with them I managed to get the night for just £1 per person! As a consequence I thought we would perhaps be given an old and unrefurbished room. On the contrary - although we were in the Excelsior Tower (which I figured was the older of the two hotel towers) we were given a room with a great view on the 15th floor, totally refurbished with a window seat and 'glass panel' bathroom as shown on previous review photos. The bathroom had a bath with an overhead shower plus a separate 'wet floor' shower space. Air con worked well without too much noise and the bed was firm and comfortable. There were two swimming pools- 'The Falls' and 'Stillwater' and both were excellent. The changing / gym areas were modern and spotless. Breakfast was good and reasonably priced. We were within easy walking distance of Raffles, Chijmes and the river. All in all a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice club rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jilliwil
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 22nd Floor in interconnecting Club Rooms with our 2 young children for 4 nites. The Club rooms are nicely appointed though not large. Club facilities great. Breakfast choice limited but certainly more than enough - though you can always partake with the crowd in the hotel if that is more your speed. Great views from the Club Lounge especially when enjoying complimentary drinks and nibbles in the evening. Great location very central to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room + location :-)”
Reviews.Author: Airline_officer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here wit 2 more friends just for Halloween party in Singapore. Had to wait for an hour for our extra bed even I e-mailed them we need it when we booked the room. They upgraded us to Premier room wit an extra bed finally. It was very nice and clean. Bed was comfy. Bahtroom was beautiful and super clean. Everythin was great but elevators were a bit old but nothin wrong wit it. Receptionists were not very very friendly but not rude. Din't try swimming pool but it looked nice. I'll stay here again whenever I come back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great value”
Reviews.Author: cjfromwa
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located within easy walking distance of shopping, Raffles Hotel. Very close to attractions like the Singapore Flyer. Easy access to train to get to Sentosa. Even with renovations occuring, the noise was minimal and the remainder of hotel presented beautifully.

Reviews.Title: “Much, much better than I ever imagined it would be!”
Reviews.Author: pragasam
Reviews.Content: I stayed from 16th Oct to 20 Oct in Premier Club Executive Room 2203 (top floor) in the Peninsula Tower with direct access to the Sky Lounge on the same floor. I was given a VIP treatment on arrival. The staff was courteous, pleasant and helpful. In particular, Samantha at the Sky Lounge Check-In counter was exceptionally wonderful. The room was adequately spacious and had a firm, very comfortable king-size bed. There were quite a number of lights for soft, atmospheric illumination and the air- conditioning was effective throughout the day and night. Surprisingly, there was no clock in the room, but I organised wake-up calls with the operator. The furnishings were tasteful and uncluttered. The bathroom was nicely appointed and of a good size and well-maintained. There was a clear glass panel window between the bedroom and the bathroom, and this enhanced the spacious feeling of the room. Although the tall Peninsula Plaza Building was smack across the road from my window, I had good views of Raffles City and St. Andrew's Cathedral grounds to the right and the skyline of Stamford Road, Bras Basah Road, Dhoby Ghaut and beyond, to the left. I took advantage of the free laundry service each day, as well as the free broadband internet access. A laptop was also accessible in the Sky Lounge. A sumptuous buffet-style breakfast was served each morning in the Sky Lounge, where one could also enjoy panoramic views of Chinatown, Singapore River, City Hall, Empress Place, the Esplanade and Marina Bay. The hostesses at breakfast were personable and polite. The location of the hotel was great. Very handy to shops, restaurants, food courts, museums, etc. Taxis were readily available outside the main entrance. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Exteriors, Interiors worn out”
Reviews.Author: RAMESES-RETURNS
Reviews.Content: On entering the Hotel premisis, we noted that the Lobby was very huge & spacious, and well maintained. The Front Office Staff was helpful and quick. Concierge service was very efficient. The Hotel Corridor was grand. So we expected that the Rooms would be matching the decor outside. But it came as a total disappointment to see that the wall paper on the walls was peeling away. The carpet was old and worn out, same was the condition of the furniture upholstery. Bath Room fittings were old & worn out. Hotel is conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, great location, great staff, as good as a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: eautmb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the way to Europe and back to Australia. On the way to Europe we got an old room and an updated room on the way back. We were a bit concerned about some of the reviews, particularly the ones about the old rooms but when we got there we realised the old rooms weren't that bad. Yes, they look a bit tired but they're quite spacious and they were clean. You can see that probably 20 years ago the rooms were quite classy. We particularly liked the sofa next to the window. The updated rooms are very nice of course with a nice flat screen TV, nice new bed linen and an air con that can be controlled more easily. We've stayed in Singapore many times before, usually at 4 and 5 star hotels, and this hotel is as good as a 4 star hotel. The staff are also very good and quick to respond to any requests or enquiries. The glass swimming pool is great.

Reviews.Title: “shame on singapore hotels”
Reviews.Author: DeshDuniya
Reviews.Content: During my recent visit to singapore i stayed in peninsula excelsior hotel from 30 sep to 2 oct 2009. to my horror rooms were stinking very badly and the furniture was looking like you see them in old materials dealer shop. sofa set was torn from several places and the bed cover was not cleaned properly. another horror awaited me in bathroom where fittings were leaking. one of the shower was leaking so perfously that its sound did not let me sleep the whole night . when complained to hotel staff about the same they expressed their inability to help. one of the house keeping staff came with a bottle of room spray and assured me that room will not stink any more. after 3 hrs when the room spray dried up room started stinking again. when complained again and insisted on changing the room i was told non availability of other rooms. i even offered to upgrade room by paying extra charges but was refused by stating non availability of rooms. it is my strict advise to people travelling to singapore not to stay in this hotel if they get a complimentry night also. i have been to singapore previously also and had stayed in new park and ymca but never had this kind of experience. rather i would say this hotel which claims itself to be a 3-4 star hotel is a shame on singapore hotels. even hotels priced half of its rate are better then this.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the 3* and stay here”
Reviews.Author: sagethyme
Reviews.Content: Nicely refurbished, excellent location, excellent views if you are lucky enough to get a room with a view. Clean, quiet, perfect to come back to after a day of sightseeing in the blazing sun!

Reviews.Title: “Oddly inefficient elevators”
Reviews.Author: Stewable
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a tour, so didn't have much say in the choice. Having received our itinerary, I was a little concerned about some of the negative reviews,but needn't have worried. The room was clean, comfortable, and perfectly adequate for our purposes i.e. a short stopover; and the location suited us. Breakfast was the usual good quality buffet you would expect. When deciding my rating, I gave extra for the excellent in-room safe (always a comfort when travelling with a reasonable amount of currency, documents, toys), and deducted a point for the terrible elevators - so slow I think they were hand cranked by off duty chambermaids. We would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location OK but service and value terrible”
Reviews.Author: Bomoh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a problem from the time we stepped into it. We had a deal that offered us $50 vouchers to spend on food and drink in the hotel and we had to ask for them 4 times over 3 days and in the end email the GM and threaten to deduct the value from the final bill. Breakfast is an unbvelivable S$30 plus and lousy quality and choice. One can get better food at 1/10 the price outside at 99 coffee shop or central market. Service to get drinks is crap.............. no other word for it. Prices of drinks are extortionate and they forget to give you any happy hour or promotion discounts. Location is good and staff are friendly enough...............just damn inefficient. If you can get a good price here on a room only basisi then it is an OK hotel but never ever eat and drink there. Also expect to spend half your stay managing the staff and sorting out problems.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Odi80
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 3 nights thru booking.com Location of the hotel is very convenient, it means 5-10 minutes by walk to the Cityhall MRT Station. The room (no 2139) we got was great with a nice view from top floor. There is a window between room and bathroom. It was noisy because of construction works at the hotel during our stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Club room - Awesome view & exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: HolidayDreamer101
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Peninsula Excelsior very much indeed. We can only comment on the experience of the Club room which is well worth the extra cost. The view from the 21st floor is amazing. The staff in the executive lounge are fantastic - very friendly and helpful. The complimentary drinks and snacks you can have in the evenings make you feel like you are really on holiday enjoying the good life, especially when the staff even remember your name and are very attentive to your needs. Then there is always the view!! The buffet breakfast which is also included in the club room rate was a great way to start the day in your exclusive lounge. Our room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities needed. Even the cleaning staff were friendly and polite. And once again the view was terrific - My husband enjoyed just sitting and looking out beyond the city to the ships in the harbour. This hotel is very very well located - within walking distance to lots of places and very close to the City Hall and Clarke Quay MRT Train stations. We will definitely stay here again - As we will be coming to this fantastic city again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Renovating but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AussieChook
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Peninsula for one night at the end of July then again on 11th August for one night. The first night I was put in a room in the Peninsula tower. This tower has not had any rooms renovated and they need it. The sheets were clean, absolutely no complaints about the bed or pillows and the room generally was clean but the carpet was disgusting - very dirty and my feet were black from walking on it. The bathroom was tiny but OK, a tile falling off the bath but the basin was fine, no mould or cracks. The toiletries were OK (not fancy but fine for one night). Breakfast wasn't included in my room rate so I ate around the corner. The second night's stay I was put into the Excelsior wing, which has had rooms renovated above the 17th floor (I'm pretty certain that's the floor level) because I complained to the receptionist about the first room and said I didn't want the same dirty room. I was given a renovated room, non-smoking (smoking rooms smelt badly) and in very good condition however the renovations were carpet, soft furnishings, walls etc but there was still excessive poly filler around the bathroom which hadn't been renovated. All in all this room was a vast improvement on the first room. As a travel agent I assess rooms all the time to see if they can be recommended to my clients and my reason for choosing this hotel was its excellent location and price. The location is brilliant because it is almost adjacent to City Hall, Raffles Plaza, City Link Mall (and therefore Suntec City) and a short bus ride up to Orchard Road. It is an easy walking distance to Clark Quay and Boat Quay (for dinner). Would I recommend this hotel? Well, if the price is right for you, take it but be sure to ask for a renovated room if possible and if not possible, don't hesitate to ask for a clean room if you're given a doozy like I was. If you can afford it, stay in the Grand Plaza City Hall (on Coleman St) which is opposite the Peninsular and is a lovely hotel

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad BAd”
Reviews.Author: Juliemary
Reviews.Content: After three weeks in Asia this was the last hotel we stayed in. It was the most expensive, it had the worst room and the very very worst reception. The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. When we complained about our first room as punishment we were put into the room right beside where they we doing upgrade work. We had the smell of solvents and the noise of hammering coming through out air conditioning unit. The room was small, it was clean. Our mini bar was empty despite reception insisting they swipe our credit card. They whole place both staff and rooms were shabby and dated.

Reviews.Title: “Exculsive!”
Reviews.Author: lojensen
Reviews.Content: The new rooms were nice and exculsive. From the rooms there is a very nice view!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: cwmmh
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviewers: the hotel location is very convenient. There's a mini-mart and internet place at the mall next door, plus a little food court so you're not stuck eating hotel food. The room I got was nice and has a cool bathroom with a window that looks into the room. I was able to take a bath while watching TV! In fact, my favorite thing about this hotel was the bathroom. Aside from the cool window, they had a rain showerhead. Very nice. The gym is small (one treadmill, one old elliptical and some weight machines). The pool seems nice and clean. Cons of the hotel: I wish they had told me that there was construction going on (until Dec 2009). The construction noise was loud and no amount of TV volume could drown it. I decided to stay at the hotel because it was for one night but I could not have tolerated another night of that noise! The elevator is super-slow and sometimes would skip my floor. Very frustrating to stand there for 5 minutes waiting for an elevator. I would stay in this hotel again but only after the construction is over. Tip: the hotel business center charges for internet but it's much cheaper if you go next door to the basement of the Fu Nan center and use the internet there.

Reviews.Title: “great location, terrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: etak86
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a 13 hour flight for our 3 day stopover before heading to sydney. We were pleased when they allowed us to check in to our room early however when we got to our room it was old, dated and in need of being decorated, the lady on reception at the time agreed that their website is misleading, i got the feeling this wasn't the first time someone had mentioned that! We also had an issue with ants and the the thermostat in the room made a horrible noise, it didnt matter whether i turned the temperature up, down or even off, it still buzzed constantly! by 11pm (12hours after i first reported it and 5 visits to reception) someone eventually came to look at it and after making a lots of excuses they left. about half an hour later i had a phone call from reception saying that the deputy manager has suggested that we moved rooms. we only ended up moving to the room opposite but it was so much better, although the exact same room, there were no ants and the no buzzing theremostat!! The breakfast was ok, not great though, I would recommend booking room only (maybe upgrade to the newer rooms also) and using the many starbucks and coffee shops which are all near by for breakfast. The pool was nice and there was a travel/tour desk in the lobby which offered some good trips, we did the city bus tour. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance from clarke quay, orchard road and raffles hotel, definitely worth a visit! there are a couple of nearby shopping malls, city mall was very good but the transport around the city is very cheap clean and efficient, the the hotel is a 2 minute walk to the nearest mrt station. It was such a shame about the problems we experienced on the first day as singapore is a great city and the hotel is perfectly located. Im sure it is just down to our individual experience and not the hotel as a whole but it was just a dissapointing start to our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Very very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: LighthouseHongKong
Reviews.Content: By Singapore standards this hotel was pretty shocking as they were drilling and renovating all day(we were not informed at time of booking in HK),plus a cockroach came out of the cupboard.The bathroom was old & grubby,too.

Reviews.Title: “Accessible to major tourist destinations.”
Reviews.Author: Sweetlady91263
Reviews.Content: Been in this hotel for three times and so far it has given me satisfaction in each stay. The newly renovated rooms were a surprise to me as everything was new inside the room. Impressive. I'm still wondering tho why the management doesn't fill up the mini bar with stuff and i find myself starved and thirsty at night with nothing to munch and drink. Also, when I left an elegant evening black overcoat fully beaded with aqua gemstones inside the closet, I was not able to retrieve it even as i returned to stay in the same hotel two days after I returned from Kuala Lumpur. I asked for the Housekeeping department but I was not well entertained over the phone as I wanted to recover my expensive black night overcoat. I hope that the Housekeeping staff will keep it for me until I get back to stay in the hotel in the next few months to come. By the way, I left the overcoat at room 1600 in the old tower.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: hotelcriticindia
Reviews.Content: big rooms , great swimming pool, good service , decent breakfast,overall a very good hotel to stay .

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: jtsingh
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in the heart of the city. The room alloted to me was comfortable, but breakfast liitle bit chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “value of money”
Reviews.Author: v_purohit
Reviews.Content: I stay there with my family for 3 days. We got the room at 11th floor with swimming pool view. It was great. Hotel have swimming pool at 6th floor. Hotel staffs are very pleasant. I have booked the room through singapore airlines site under there "Singapore Stopover Holiday" scheme. I have booked the room for the period from 6th June to 9th June i.e for 3 nights. check-in time was 2.00 P.M mostly hotel allow chek-in after 12 (noon) but we reached at 7.00 A.M in the morning on 6th June and I asked for the room with king size bed, non smoking . Front desk staff told that non smoking room with king size bed is not avsilable so she can allot me triple bed room so I agreed and within 10 minutes I checked-in the room. As per the term and condition of the scheme Hotel could charge one night extra charges for early check-in but I am very thankful to Hotel and there staff because they didnt charge any extra amount for early check-in and for triple bed also. Just opposite of hotel there is one good south indian veg restaurant "Komlas" also.

Reviews.Title: “Warm friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sienasoares
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at this hotel with my husband as part of the Singapore-Malaysia-Hongkong holiday we did. Since we were doing some shopping as well as sight seeing, we thought and when we stayed here were confirm that this was the most ideally located hotel for people who wanted to shop or sight see. Staff were warm and friendly, many of them actually gave us tips on where to shop, and what would be the best times to go sightseeing the different places of interest. We only ordered room service for the time we were at the hotel, and the food was good, and arrived without too much delay. The rooms are well appointed with modern amenities and facilities, except for drinking water which surprised us and we were later told that Singapore tap water was drinkable (although we didnt really want to take that chance). All in all, a nice place to stay

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible hotel I have ever been.”
Reviews.Author: minicooper2008
Reviews.Content: I was working in Singapore for a month and my friend recommended me this hotel to stay. I have faced electricity and aircon failure twice (one due to the floor control and one due to my room's key card problem). I was transfered to another room with water leakage and a not-working-safe. I have to moved my luggage in the middle of the night and no assistant by the hotel staff. I dialed more than 10 times to the reception but no one replied. The staff didn't apologize for the problem. This is the ever worst hotel I have been and it ruins the Image of Singapore as well. I won't come to Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Functional stopover venue”
Reviews.Author: twoguystravelling
Reviews.Content: Busy hotel that has been updated in parts - we don't ever seem to luck a room that has been though! Rooms are comfortable (in a 1960's sort of way). Breakfast was good. Hotel is well located for local shopping malls and the MRT system to anywhere in Singapore. Helpful staff - if you are calm and polite, but they become non responsive to agro approaches. Suggest transfer here from the airport in a maxi van and book the same guy for your return to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location wise and services wise”
Reviews.Author: kshahina
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel from 26th may to 29th may 2009. We had a toddler and we got a nonsmoking floor. We booked it through latestays.com and got a good offer with breakfast. I have to say the Hotel is located right in the middle of the city and is in close proximity to many sightseeing spots. We were upgraded to the newly renovated rooms for free because we asked for the Bay view room. We could see the Singapore flyer and Espalande Theatre from our room window. The hotel has two swmming pools although we really didn't use them but one is right there in the lobby. The breakfast was not good. Not much varieties. Same thing everyday The room was quite spacious although the bathroom is a bit conjusted. Overall facilities were fine too. Although they don't provide you with a lotion and no Shaving set for my husband. It has its own mall and you can get everything from food to toileteries and pharmaceuticals down there. If you are a walking fan you can really walk to everything. Big malls like Suntec and Raffles Mall are also at a walking distance. The bus stop is also just outside the hotel and there is easy taxi access in the area too.

Reviews.Title: “3 Stars Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Joeycao
Reviews.Content: Here for holiday and business trip for five nights. Average room standard but clean. Frontline staffs was helpful and courteous. Value for money. Having difficulties using internet in both rooms. No staffs come and help after many calls. Very helpful chinese lady manager, forgot her name, came to our rooms to help. Very polite and say sorry for being late because another manager having another problem. Internet till not working. But must say thank you to her. Give us to use business room internet without charging for five minutes. First time staying in Peninsula Hotel. Hotel designed very basic but with good location. Very busy outside hotel lobby, not feeling very safe with overseas labor. Good location. I will come back to this hotel because i happy with the services.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mndbhs
Reviews.Content: We, a family of 3, had been to a trip of Singapore. Our travel agent had given us a choice of 3 hotels in Singapore. 1 in Little India, Peninsula Excelsior and the other between these two. I read the reviews on Trip Advisor and chose Peninsula Excelsior and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel has 2 towers, Peninsula Tower and Excelsior Tower with a common breakfast area, 'The Colemans Cafe'. The rooms are well furnished with mini bar and mini safe. The furniture is shows signs of age. Housekeeping is very good. Lobby and reception area are done well. The front office staff are courteous and strive really hard to help you. We only had breakfast in the hotel. The breakfast spread was excellent. The main advantage of the hotel is its location. It is located very close to the City Hall MRT station. There are lots of eateries around the hotel. Behind the hotel in the Funac Mall you have MacDonalds, Subway, KFC and Pastamania. In one corner is a food court which is open till 11:00 pm and you also get Indian Food over there. Opposite the hotel in the basement of the Peninsula Plaza, is a food court where also you get Indian food. Overall, I was satisfied with the food and would certainly prefer it if I visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: BABA2410
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good place to stay as far as facilities are concerned. But the front office staff was not very efficient and lacked warmth. It has wonderful options of swimming pools and the kids really enjoyed it. Overall, I would say, I have a mixed feeling of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - Great location”
Reviews.Author: navneet80
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel; u find lot of indians around; larger number of rooms hence avialability is generally not an issue; i stayed there on an official trip; its well conneceted to business area; food is good; rooms are relatively smaller; staff service was not very satisfactory; had to wait for more than an hour for checkin; stay was overall ok

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, jammed with tour groups”
Reviews.Author: tellerto
Reviews.Content: This place is teeming with tourists by the busload and check in is a long slow process - expect them to take about ten minutes per registration - very frustrating if there is a busload of other tired travellers in front of you at the desk. Deluxe room was OK but staff arent particularly friendly. All the minibar and room service items are expensive, as are the breakfast options. Suggest you buy food & drinks elsewhere. Location is OK - short walk to buses and the underground. Chinatown about 25 min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “I must have been lucky with this one.”
Reviews.Author: PPAinsworth
Reviews.Content: I have seen a lot of negativity within Tripadvisor regarding this Hotel, so it was with some trepidation that we embarked on a double stay at the Peninsula in April. Either I was very fortunate with the four rooms our party occupied in that period or some of the contributors have been very unlucky. I couln't find much wrong with this place. Very pleasant reception area with two swimming pools accessed from the very long lounge linking the two tower blocks. Perfectly decent breakfast room with standard "full English" available and a nice unflustered ambience. The Hotel location would be hard to beat , with many major sightseeing venues and a host of cafes and restaurants on the doorstep.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there”
Reviews.Author: simgapore1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times over the years but will not go back again. The service was terrible and the rooms were really bad. We were told the hotel had had done up its rooms well they forgot to do the showers they have no curtains only a glass partion that lets the water go into the room all over the floor. When we arrived we were told there was no rooms avaible even though we had paid in full so they offered us a smokers room which was terrrible. The next day they changed us to a non smoking floor which was better but did not offer say sorry or anything. The hotel is well placed closed to the MRT etc but we would not recomened it to anyone again the hotel accross the road would be a mucher better choice and better rates. This is the first time we have ever made a comment on where we have stayed like I say it was not very nice at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: KavilC
Reviews.Content: Centrally Located. Recption/Check in counter staff not co-operative, inspite of having booking in new tower and higher catgory room they gave us room in old tower, rooms were very depressing. after 2 to 3 hours they gave us the room, you dont want this kidnda hassels on your hooneymoon. Kamal Veg restaurant is there in the opposite building. New rooms in new tower were good. Do not stay in old tower, its depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Facilities but Let Down by Bad Lifts and Congested Breakfast Area”
Reviews.Author: LPWilliams
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights in this hotel in March 2009 as part of a package tour to New Zealand and Australia, so cannot comment on the room cost but can make observations on the facilities etc and compare it to all the other 'same-standard' 3* or so hotels I stayed in. The hotel is located on a busy central road in the city centre, but the noise intrusion was minimal. The location is excellent for shopping etc and is less than 5 minutes from bus stops on adjacent Hill St/North Bridge Rd and the City Hall underground train stop. Overall, the hotel was good, but was let down by the claustrophobic and hectic breakfast area and the serviceability of the lifts. It has all the expected room facilities and cleanliness. The bathroom had a bath (some hotel bathrooms don't !), there was aircon and a HUGE safe-deposit box (so big I accidentally left several things behind in it as I missed them....). A bad point for me was that the in-room drinks provisions did not include milk but only powdered 'creamer', which is horrible with tea.... The 1st-floor reception area is massive and centrally located between the 2 hotel room 'towers' (the Peninsula and Excelsior); whilst there are 3 lifts serving each tower there was always at least one broken, usually 2, whilst we were there making transport to/from the rooms VERY lengthy and frustrating. As soon as a lift was repaired (usually within 8 hours or so) it, or another, would break - totally unsatisfactory for such a busy/large hotel. I found the knowledge of the Front Desk staff limited, but bizarrely the Business Centre staff were an excellent alternative ! The breakfast buffet was OK, with quite a wide choice of basic foodstuffs; there was an eggs 'cook-to-order' section, something I like a lot. However, the dining area and walking areas around the food section were quite small/narrow, making for an unpleasant dining experience when combined with the large number of residents scrambling for breakfast. There was an extremely small outside dining area, but I think the humid/hot weather would limit how attractive this might be to residents..... As with shopping, due to the central location lunch/dinner are easily obtainable at the huge array of local food outlets. Although the breakfast 'experience' leaves something to be desired, this a perfectly acceptable hotel for a stay in Singapore and is ideally located - just hope the lifts are all working OK !

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and view from the club room”
Reviews.Author: shahkintu
Reviews.Content: Fantastic view from the room, well connected with the rest of the city (public transport as well), nice room service, clean fresh rooms, nice mini bar, fabulous breakfast options.. A must stay in Singapore at a good economy pricing..

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but decor is old and services very average.”
Reviews.Author: Sarah88HongKong
Reviews.Content: The major tourist spots, e.g. Merlion, Fort Canning Park, Chimes, Pernakan Museum, Boat Quay, Fullerton, Victoria Concert Hall, Armenian Church and St. Andrew's Church are all in vicinity and within 10 min walking distance. Close to City Hall MRT station too. However, the room decor is too old with dirty carpet as if it has been so since the 70's and not very clean. My room in the Excelsior Tower is huge though. The swimming pool is OK but the largest and most used pool is very poorly lit in the evening so it is scarry rather than relaxing. I also had an unpleasant experience with the check-in as the keys given did not work. While unbelieving that this could happen, the hotel staff spent a lot time exploring why the lock of the room was not working and only allocated a new room to me upon request. This incident wasted me for about 40 minutes and caused great inconvenience.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: Rinni
Reviews.Content: Good location very near the MRT - excellent place for IT people as it is next to Funan Mall 5 floors of IT. Walking distance to Clarks Quay and good restaurants. Rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough....but would not return”
Reviews.Author: SaraJanec
Reviews.Content: My family and I (hubby, two children aged 8 and 11) stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. The room was big enough for us, but had too much extra furniture in it, for example a large table with four chairs. The was an additional two sitting chairs. The bathroom, really needed to be re-modelled, the caulking around the bath was old and mouldy and the shower pull knob pulled off in my hands, upon arrival the toilet did not work. To get towels for the pool was a pain, you had to go to the gym and check them out and then return them to check in, poolside drinks were very very expensice s$14 for a beer, too steep for us. The bedding on the beds was minimal a sheet and a thin blanket., I froze and was generally uncomfortable. The location was great! close to great restaurants, although it is a shame that the hotel food was so expensive, we never once ate there, there were not incentives for us to eat there, breakfast for one person $28. So having said all that it was nice enough, but I would not stay there again. We paid $540usd for the four nights that included pick up and drop off on a bus.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: uda_8
Reviews.Content: We dropped into this hotel through the singapore airlines stopover holiday and expected to see a luxury, neat, clean, and modern lobby which is as same as its rooms. We managed to get premier club rooms. The rooms were perfect and simply irresistable. the room and the toilet was very clean and mordern. we loged there for 8 nights and found the service quite fine. the only drawback was that the breakfast was not worthwile I mean it was quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in total while at stay with Hotel Peninsula Excelsior, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Hitender
Reviews.Content: I booked my 4 days and 3 nights tour as "Singapore Surprise" at Travel Mela in Hotel Hayat Regency, New Delhi through Cox and Kings from 3rd to 6th April, 2009. The land arrangments at Peninsula Excelsior, 5 Colman Street, Singapore property is worth visiting again and again. Me and my family have enjoyed the hospitality of the hotel i.e. swimming pools, sauna etc. Its has wide variety in breakfast i.e. bread, eggs (omlate/fry), fish, chicken, watermelon, fruits, juices, butter, cheese and what not. The reception desk is very cooperative and supportive. I convey my thanks to Catherine at the reception desk of the hotel. My wife and children have also expressed their pleasure of their stay at Peninsula Excelsior, 5 Colman St, Singapore. There was not a single uncomort. It was fun and enjoyment in total. The first overseas experience by my wife and children is a memorable and remarkable trip. We had the opportunity to travel through buses and MRT ie. rail in Singapore. The Hotel is at an approaching distance of MRT station ie. Clarke Quey. As we have got 2 years multi-entry visa, me and my family would like to visit again Singapore before 2 years and stay at the same Hotel. Thanks to Cox and King TEAM also. Hitender Narang

Reviews.Title: “Fairly priced and definitely three star”
Reviews.Author: TravelJezza
Reviews.Content: Dispatched to Singapore on business by a financial firm. Although we didn't take TARP we did decide to go economy on the airlines and the hotels. This hotel advertises itself as three star, which is just what it is. The room I was in appears to have been recently upgraded although the TV is still old. Limited cable channels, reasonable bathroom, appauling (just awful) breakfast. In the evening a constant queue of people are returning their door key as it has stopped working. Mine only failed daily and towards the end of the week I always went via the lobby as the key would just not work. Price though, was very reasonable. I was actually surprised how cheap. Staff work hard and offer good value. Simply a cheap, run down hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to explore Singapore from”
Reviews.Author: shamat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of an excellent value Singapore Airlines stop over deal, so we weren't expecting too much. We requested a newly refurbished room as suggested by other reviewers and we were really pleasantly surprised! The room was clean, spacious and modern and tastefully decorated. The room had all the desirable facilities - minibar, tea and coffee making equipment, TV, air con, and an in room safe, plus a bathroom with plenty of towels and toiletries. The only downside is that the entrance to the hotel is a bit confusing as the lobby is actually on the 5th floor, which makes the initial entrance area by the lifts a bit busy and crowded. The location could not be beaten - within walking distance of the park, Clarke Quay and Raffles, and with an MRT station (City Hall) just a 5 minute walk away. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We could not fault our stay this time”
Reviews.Author: BazzaB38
Reviews.Content: This was our third consecutive stay at this hotel. On the second occasion the hotel was in the middle of refurbishment and the allotted room left a lot to be desired. We complained by email on our return home and when we arrived this time the reception was overwhelming . We were greeted by two managers one of which did our check in paperwork while the other supplied us with a welcome drink and discussed at great length our previous stay. We were given an executive room on the 19th floor with a magnificent view and which had been refurbished making it one of the most comfortable stays we have ever had. King size bed, great linen, glassed in shower separate from the bath and included a rain shower, flat screen LCD TV, tons of room and a bowl of fruit from the duty manager. The staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable and we will not hesitate to stay there again. I guess we can all learn a lesson here. If you have a problem with your accomodation, instead of table thumping or loudly complaining in a belligerent manner, formally complain in a civilized manner and more often than not you will be surprised at the positive result. Well done Peninsula Excelsior. You will have a couple of very satisfied people staying there on our future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: imrajforu
Reviews.Content: Last year we went on a family holiday to Singapore & Malaysia. The hotel is good. It was one of the modern hotels. We were lucky as we got upgraded rooms. Room size was excellent as in singapore u will only get small rooms at an average price. We stayed on the club level. Buffet breakfat was good. We were a group of 4 families total 15 persons (7 Children) The pool attendants were wonderful There were few other attraction also in the same building. Restaurants was great. We paid $85 per night for a room on the club level which we thought excellent value. There were 2 double beds so the four of us shared. Overall I would say this is one the best hotel we have stayed during the trip. !

Reviews.Title: “booking online sucks!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonJetset101
Reviews.Content: I'm a road warrior and do almost everything online. I tried to book online during my travels and it appeared that they have no more rooms. Not believing this, I called.
