Yup! they had vacancy aplenty. I was a bit pissed off by then and booked elsewhere, thinking that if the frontline interface is messed up, perhaps the rest of it is as well. Judging from other reviews I read here, most of you confirmed my suspicions. Guys, buck up please. I like your location. Apparently, thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “cant wait to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaGarry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week.The room was fantastic .When I arrived I asked for a room with a bath and they upgraded my room.When I needed somthing the staff were very attentive and helped me out.The hotel was close to everything,ie mrt,shops,.I couldnt fault the place and would recommend it to everyone.I will be going back to Singapore in 2010 and will stay at the hotel without any reservations.GARRY _ AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “Could be a lot better, staff need customer relations update.”
Reviews.Author: S D Evs
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel as part of a large tour party which included a lot of teenagers. The hotel was great with nice facilities, clean and the rooms were very well appointed. The staff were very polite and courteous but not very well trained. Their English was in general poor and many of them would not make a decision, this became very frustrating as any request then took an age to resolve. Also the restaurant served a nice set menu for $30 with a drink, but if you buy a bottle of wine, ouch!! $95 a real rip off.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed....better stay in 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Panda06
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to stay in this hotel. The first time, which was many years ago, I found it quite good. The rooms were clean and spacious. Service was excellent. So I recommended this to my friend when we visited again. The lobby looks so nice, but when we entered the room, we were both very disappointed. The room was small, the carpet looks like not been cleaned for months. I couldn't possibly walk bare-footed on it, but they don't even have slippers or flip flops! The bath tub looked yucky. To make it worst, the temperature of the airconditioner couldn't be controlled, we were freezing to death with those very thin blankets!!! They also do not provide breakfast. Though I know this hotel is not related to the Peninsula group of hotels, but carry this name really makes people expect more. Moreover, it's a 3-star hotels! How come it looks like "no-star"? I'm really very disappointed. If you'd stay in this hotel, I'd recommend that you stay in some cheaper 1 star hotels. At least, they worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: Binita80
Reviews.Content: very good area with rates of 3* and services like 5* hote; i am glad i chose this hotel. Regards Binita

Reviews.Title: “we had a good experience here”
Reviews.Author: hen302
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as part of a Singapore Stopover on the way tot Vietnam. We stayed in the new wing and it was fine. Exactly what we expected from a 3* Singapore hotel. Checkin was smooth, we had 2 rooms, one for parents and one for the kids (teenagers). Rooms were comfortable and clean. Obviously they were the refurbished ones cos there were no smells or problems that others have described. Location is excellent. Right near Singapore Airlines bustop and close to the centre of things. We got our money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Started good, until the room came to view”
Reviews.Author: SydneyAsiaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews from TripAdvisor AFTER booking and paying for the hotel room. That was where things all started. Having set my expectation down to the pitts about the check in, I was pleasantly surprised that I did not have to wait long at all. I was served just less than 5 minutes. Surprisingly, the girl at the counter had a big warm smile and sorted out my check-in quite quickly. Before I knew it, I had the key in my hand. I asked for the modern wing (as advised from here). But because I also asked for non-smoking, I had the old building. With such a pleasant experience in tow, I proceeded to my room. I was first put back by the smell and old greasy carpets in the corridor leading to my room. The doors were dirty and had many marks. When I got to my room, I was appalled at how old my room was. It was exactly as described in some of these reviews ... "like back in the 1970's". The bed was too soft, lounge was old and the whole room had a nursing home smell. Anyways, all these made my overall stay a little unpleasant. Good luck with your rooms!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but tired”
Reviews.Author: DaisyClover
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night on our home-bound journey as a Singapore Airlines (SIA) stop-over package for A$128 (the budget rate). Our room on the 12th floor was clean, comfortable, sufficiently spacious and had all the facilities that one expects in a 3 * hotel in Singapore. It is a composite hotel of the Peninsula tower and the Excelsior tower. We were in the Excelsior tower and our room was quite old and tired. The bathroom was perfectly functional but very small with a shower over the bathtub. There is a good swimming pool. The hotel is in a very good central location for both shopping and sight seeing. It is an easy walk to the City Hall MRT underground rail interchange station, the river, Peninsula Plaza Shopping Centre (with Robinsons department store), the Funan IT Shopping Mall and much, much more. There is an excellent food court next door at the Funan Centre in Hill Street where you can get a good meal for a few dollars and the beer is cold. If you are taking this hotel as an SIA stop-over package, I would recommend the Royal @ Queens over the Peninsula Excelsior as that hotel has just undergone a refurbishment and is in an equally good location, not far away.

Reviews.Title: “never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: pnm75
Reviews.Content: We stayed there - it was disgusting. It looked very nice on the internet when we checked it out. Imagine our surprise when we entered the room. I don't think the floor had been vacuumed for a year or the surfaces wiped over. Everything was dusty. The bathroom was disgusting! The toilet didn't flush properly and the bath/shower filled up with water everytime we used it. We had checked in early in the morning - the only good thing and went to sleep but were constantly disturbed by staff pressing the doorbell, coming to fix something - first the leaking toilet and then a broken piece of timber on a cupboard. All they did was have a look and say they would be back. They never came back. We would never stay there again. It was disgusting for the price we paid. The photos we took of the bathroom actually don't show the dirt and grime.It was only after we went out of the hotel and came back that we realized there were 2 parts to the hotel - and we were stuffed into the old part!

Reviews.Title: “Worst stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Table48
Reviews.Content: I have always loved staying in Singapore on Business and this time I took my family for New Years break. The check-in took almost an hour. Why do they only have so few check-in terminals and how could they be so slow.... After the ordeal, we were so tired and was unpleasantly surprised to find the bathroom with a ceiling that was falling apart and a hole in the corner where ants crawled out. and smell of urine Since we were leaving the next day. We decided to just tough it out for the night and tell the reception that we wanted another room upon our return. We waited another hour to check-in on our return. There was no message left for the reception that we would not want the same room. We were relieved when we entered the room that it was a refurbished room like the ones on their website. Our left baggage never came and when we went down to the bell captain, they told us that there was a communication problem with reception and they never recieved the claim tag that we gave them. We waited for 30 minutes for the extra bed to come which the reception had promised would be sent up shortly. We called housekeeping only to be told that they would check with reception. After another hour, we spoke with the duty manager and told them that we were going out to dinner and wanted to have the extra bed before we came back. When we returned from dinner the bed had not arrived so we called housekeeping again and reception again and the duty manager who would not pick up the phone. After 4 hours close to midnight the extra bed finally came. The most aggravating thing was the attitude of the staff who kept telling me that they had not recieved instructions or that it would be solved soon. I felt sorry for the staff who seemed to be over-stretch. I am sure they want to do their jobs properly but I guessed that there were just not enough staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Singapore. Perfect location. Good price for the product”
Reviews.Author: greekadventurer
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on European Destinations.com and we were very pleased with the hotel and the location. We would stay here again. But I would recommend that you ask and pay for an upgrade. We had a great room on the 21st floor, recently renovated. The room and the bathroom was terrific. Walk in shower, Rain shower, jacuzzi bathtub. Nice view. We were very happy with the hotel. The breakfast was just OK and don't order any drinks in the bar, but the hotel room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever in such a vibrant city....”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyboy2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights within Dec 08. The hotel is terrible, took nearly 2 hours to check-in as the room was not ready. Once we did get into the room we found it very cramped, damp smell and to top that off we had raw sewage leaking from the bottom of the toilet ! We had the do not disturb on the door, which did not make any difference at all, they still came knocking at 8 in the morning ! Avoid if you want to make the most of a wonderful city, there are much better places to stay - we would have cancelled if we had not got a 100% cancellation fee in the contract 72 hours before arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!”
Reviews.Author: cruiserwales
Reviews.Content: The name may conjure up "great expectations" but the reality is GRIM! How it can masquerade as a 4* hotel is beyond belief. Our room, on the 11th. Floor, was "jaded" to say the least - old carpetting; soiled wall covering; an electrical socket which was loose on the wall; a wash basin which drained so slowly that to say it did so at a snail's pace would be offensive to snails; a toilet bowl, which,when flushed, filled almost to the rim and then drained equally slowly, obviously due to blockages somewhere in the system;an antiquated airconditioning system , complete with control which came away in your hand, and which could not be adjusted. The rooms are obviously in dire need of both refurbishment and redecoration. The overpriced buffet breakfast, the equivalent of £16 per head, was not even worth a glance. On the positive side - very good position and two swimming pools. However, you would be hard pressed to find a poorer stopover in Singapore!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “100% satisfied”
Reviews.Author: working_dadPI
Reviews.Content: Unlike the Hongkong Ramada (the worst hotel I had been to) Peninsula's staff had accomodated most, if not all, of my needs. My family and I stayed for 4 days, the front desk personnel gave us a connecting room on the 10th floor with the nice view. Breakfast was a bit greasy but they were served hot. The location is close to just about most sites tourists wants to see.

Reviews.Title: “Peninsula Excelsior sucks”
Reviews.Author: stevesavio1980
Reviews.Content: We went to singapore for our honeymoon..... This hotel has the worst possible room service and the slowest possible elevators ....... The staff is lazy and lethargic... Moreover they forcibly charged me extra money for some drinks missing from the mini bar in my room....My wife and I do not drink but we still had to pay 70$ for the missing drinks......our baggage was held by the hotel until we paid the amount...... breakfast is horrible and cold .... room service serves cold food..... Please do not stay at this hotel ever..... The worst place in singapore is Peninsula and I strongly recommend not to stay here................. I have stayed at the worst places around USA and got better service than peninsula excelsior.......

Reviews.Title: “Better hotel in Singapore than this one”
Reviews.Author: NZ2
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel courtesy of Singapore Airlines after they canceled a flight back to New Zealand. Appears hotel in to different blocks the Peninsular in one building and renovated. The Excelsior in another block, but use the same reception,pool etc. The sign in the lift says ,,,welcome to our newly renovated hotel..... they must have missed doing room 1135 and the hallways on that floor. Yes large room but very dated and worn ( but clean ). Easy access to hotel.... take the metro from the airport to City Hall $1.60 and 3 minute walk. Suggest the Swissotel Stamford a much better hotel also by City Hall metro but get off at Raffles. Hotel attached to very nice shopping centre.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - good location”
Reviews.Author: DBorg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on are way back to Beijing from Rawa Island. The hotel, service and room were ok. The location was great for shopping and restaurants. I would probably stay here again. I my opinion a nice 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: aral
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is a good one for stopovers.İts in the heart of the city and you can find everything arround(shops,restaurants).it has two towers and i ve seen both of them.Try to stay at the peninsula tower becasue its renuved.There are two lobbyies one at the ground floor the other is an up level.the front desk is kind and very fast at their job.Since i had only a day for singapore i need to be checked in and out easly and i needed to be go arround fast and easy i am satisfied with this hotel.The sushi restaurant just next to the hotel was nice. and also if you like digital life and tecnology there is big mall just at the back side of the hotel which is called digitallife mall.The night safari and singapore zoo were fantastic.Take sunday morning breakfast in zoo with monkeys and go to the night safari at night.it is the best schedcule.Taxi fares are ok and they are safe.but to find a cab is hard.in singapore people call the taxis to come and take them.so get a taxi phone asap. in agust it was rainy and humidty is high. oh by the way singapore airport is a big and a lovely one.good shops and good restaurants. so overall i liked the hotel for stopevers and city lovers.and singapore is a very nice place too see.i ll be back there:) have fun

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl-in-London
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights on a Singapore Stopover package. Best thing about this hotel is its convenient location to just about everything the "stopover" traveller needs. I got to hotel & checked in quite early (after a 15hr flight) and understandable my room wasn't ready. I said I would go out (for approx 6hrs )and was told that upon my return my room would be ready with bags awaiting. Not so. By this stage I was desperate for a shower & a change of clothes but it took 2 phone calls & another hour before my bags arrived at my room! Hindsite says I should have gone & retrieved them myself! I took a bath and when I drained it, the bathroom totally flooded with water coming up through the floor drain. The TV also wasn't working so I reported both items to the reception as I left for my next outing of about 4 hours. Upon my return (now 9pm local time & no sleep for the past 24hrs) I soon discovered that both faults were still not rectified. Two phone calls & one hour later I was able to finally get some much needed sleep. The breakfast buffet left alot to be desired as far as price versus quality goes. Also the temperatures of the dishes left alot of questioning in regards to food hygiene & safety. During the course of that day, for some reason, housekeeping removed all the contents from my mini-bar - strange!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible stay at Hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: VinChin08
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Singapore after 4 night stay in this hotel. I had very bad experience with hotel. This was the worst hotels I have ever stayed in my entire life. We were 3 family people, I reserved the hotel with preference of sea view,non-smoking and paid around $240/day when added tax S$283/per day . For such expensive rate you expect some quality services. Forget the quality, the Hotel wasn't clean, house keeping services were terrible, lots lots of noise always. You should not take any help from Tour desk. It is not just expensive but information is incomplete. There wasn't even visibility of sea from the hotel More importantly, the check-in did not take place ontime as the computer systems were broke out, we had to wait outside after a travel of around 10hours. The only good thing about the hotel is, it is located in a prime place. You can walk around Marine Park and Boat Quay. if you are using MRT, the accessibility is very good. Taxi's are always available unlike the other areas. You can access suntech city through the underground passage through cityhall railway station.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very convenient .”
Reviews.Author: lazyadventurer
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our 2 nights stay. Room was clean. We didn't use too much of their service because we were out most of the time. But they were all polite. Location is very convenient to public transportation. Not sure the reason of the hotel selective treatment to the previous reviewer because we are asian too. Maybe we booked through Singapore Airlines. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful!”
Reviews.Author: PipkinsLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night (thank goodness!!) on the Singapore Stopover Package. The room was very dated and run down. The lock fell off the door withinn five minutes of being in the room,then we had a problem with the shower - it wouldn't turn off - they came to fix it eventually, but then it would only run hot water and they would not come back to look at it until we had run the tap for 30 mins!! Staff were quite unhelpful. We booked an alarm call for 5:30am and it ver came...good job we set our own alarm just in case! It is in a good location..just five min walk from Clarke Quay and Raffles City. Worth paying a bit extra for a better standard hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faris010
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room veiw, nice staff, clean room. good price.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some reviews have said”
Reviews.Author: avva
Reviews.Content: This was my third time at the Peninsular hotel and each time the hotel has improved. My last stay four years ago was plesant but the room a bit faded, this time I was upgraded on arrival into a premier room on the 17th floor. Room spotless, newly decorated, huge bathroom and plasma tv. View of the pool and Excelsior hotel. Reception staff very helpful in every way, did not eat in the Hotel as I spent time with friends who live in Singapore. Hotel is central near to a large underground station, and free buses to the Singapore eye stop just across the road. Busy hotel mainly stop over guests and one of the cheaper ones if like me your a Singapore airlines passenger on one of thier stop overs. I will use the hotel again for my next visit, it has a good sized pool, gym , and for a woman travleing alone is good secure place to stay. Do go on the Singapore eye its bigger than the london one the views are awesome. East Dariun fruit it does not smell that bad and tastes like custard. Take the walk from the Jardine steps along Henderson waves, to the canopy walk, amazin gardens and butterflies to be seen.

Reviews.Title: “Poor rooms but good location”
Reviews.Author: griff500
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a stopover back to Perth for 2 nights on the 24th to 26th july.The reception and pool area look quite plush.I arrived 6:30 in the morning and found the staff friendly but slow to check in.My room (1229)was on the 12th floor(nonsmoking) in the excelsior tower overlooking the pool.The views were pretty good especially at night.The new Supreme Court building looks like a UFO.The room had 2 single beds and a small bathroom which really needs renovating.There was a bar fridge,tv and room safe.The carpets had stains on them and there was a door that connects to the room nextdoor.The breakfast bar had a pretty good selection.The location is very good.You cannot fault it.You have the city hall station nearby and your choice of shops also (Raffles City).There was a really good foodhall across the road and downstairs that did some tasty and cheap dinners.I walked to the Singapore flyer in 40 min and the Merlion statue on the river in 25 min.I would suggest that when you go to Sentosa Island then you catch the cable car over from Mt Faber.The views are well worth it.So overall it is the rooms that let this hotel down bigtime.I was lucky that I didn't spend that much time in them anyway but it is ashame.I would recommend this hotel to people but forwarn them about the rooms.I think the Peninsula tower is the more upmarket of the 2 but if you are in the Excelsior tower then ask for a pool view room.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wal-did-europe
Reviews.Content: We can't understand the previous comments made about this hotel !!! When we stayed in June, 2008, on our way home from Europe we found the hotel (including the room, room service, staff and booking procedures) to be of an excellent standard. After reading some of the reviews before we left, we were a little hesitant, but our travel agent had assured us that she had stayed there with no problems and when we got there we were pleasantly surprised. The room was not only very clean, we had magnificent views from the 17th floor and a massive king size bed. The breakfast was definitely above average. Overall, we were very happy and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort zone”
Reviews.Author: Elderlytraveller
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended this, & it was easy to see why: it is full of other Australians, so if you are a timid traveller (as she is) you can feel as though you haven't really left home if you stay at the Peninsual Excelsior. We found the check-in procedure quite horrible; we weren't part of a tour group or a visiting football team so we were obviously quite unimportant to the Reception staff. After all that, however, we enjoyed the great location & the efficient breakfast service. Room was OK, everything worked & quiet enough to sleep - no rowdy nightclub noises penetrated.

Reviews.Title: “Location is a Plus”
Reviews.Author: ACChua
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel twice. And I can say that the best thing about the place is the location. Conveniently situated beside Funan Centre and just across City Hall MRT station, the hotel is just a short taxi ride to anywhere worth going in Singapore. There are good places to eat just steps away. Raffles City Shopping Center is just five minutes away. The only real downside to staying in this hotel would be the aesthetics and the quality of the furnishings inside. I would surmise that the hotel is decades old, and it shows with the worn-down and retro look around the hotel and inside the rooms. During our stay there, water was actually dripping inside the cabinet. We had to have some repairmen come in before it was resolved. On the bright side, the lobby is spacious and looks interesting. They also have a small gym for guests and a swimming pool across the lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Francescogala
Reviews.Content: This Hotel should be cataloged under 1 star Hotels category. PAID VERY HIGH TARIFF ALMOST S$200,UNBELIAVBLE. We staied 1 night and it was a terrible experience,hotel very old and dirty with a strong moldy smell that made Us couldnt sleep. In the morning a very strong noise come from outside,they were doing some renovation and it wsnt told Us from anybody. Francesco

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: Misstq
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the Singapore stop over program and were disappointed with the room - but as we were only there for one night and the location is good we just put up with it. We were put in a corner triple room - which is a double with another bed plonked in the room - thus making it very cramped - although the views from the window was fantastic. The bathroom was the worst feature, very old and grubby with mould on the ceiling tiles and so, so small it was impossible to shut the door without first sitting on the toilet - I have literally had a bigger shower area than the total size of this bathroom - we should have complained but as we were only there one night, had alreay waited an hour for a room, and just wanted to get out and about , we accepted it. The room furnishings are old and worn and everything looks drab and it is like staying at an old 60's/70's hotel - not at all what you expect after seeing the lovely reception area. I am not sure how they can even refurbish this room as without knocking into next door you would never be able to get a decent size bathroom. Location is good and there are two pools - albeit one is like being in a tank at sea world !!! Sunbathing isn't possible until after 10 a.m. due to the situation of the building. Reception staff were helpful as we we allowed to check in early after an ovenight flight from Perth. The entrance is on the ground floor and reception is on floor 5 and it is very dificult to get lifts, which is very frustrating. Would I stay there again - proably not - even though the location is good - it definitely the worst hotel we have had in 4 stays Singapore and for the money it should be better - Singapore airlines should do better for their clients.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RingringBrisbane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Peninsula excelsior last month for a 3 night stay. The staff were very helpful and checking in was a breeze. The size of the room was okay for us but we find the toilet room very small. The reviews here in Trip advisor about peeling wallpapers and rusty bath tub were true. The shower curtain was very dirty. Overall, it needs to be updated and replace. The good thing in staying there is its central location. Very near to Clarke Quay and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Central and Good”
Reviews.Author: Kelian2007
Reviews.Content: We had a package through Singapore Airlines. The rooms are currently being renovated. Will be an excellent hotel when finished. We had king sized bed. Fridge was not working when arrived and was replaced. Very central location to most of the thins to do in Singapore. Only a short taxi ride for most about $5 to $6. Tour desk downstairs which proved helpful. Breakfast was included which was very nice except for the other patrons having their breakfast. Other patrons very wasteful. Overall would stay here again. We were on the 18th Floor

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for me”
Reviews.Author: MalayLady
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews from others before me, i did not expect much from the hotel. But it turns out, pretty good. The lobby was nice and elegant, but it was kind of awkward because it is a floor up...Anyhow, my room was a deluxe & non-smoking room at the excelsior tower. It is a very big room, but like others say, the furnishing is old-ish, the carpet is a bit sticky, the bath is stained, parts of the wallpaper are peeling, etc etc... but I don't mind those, as it was a very big room, the bed is comfy and the basic amenities are adequate. The housekeeping staff are nice and ready to help. The receptionist staff are a busy lot, but still provide smooth checking in and out. The concierge was missing, LOL! I went for a business trip, so I did not get to get to enjoy much of Singapore, but the location is quite good, right next to Funan Digitalife Mall which has a food court with a Halal stall, and cross the road is Peninsula Plaza...

Reviews.Title: “Very Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: shira4
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff service is really bad. Rooms are too small. Their service is really bad. If we ask or order something they takes 1-2 hrs to send it. Before we went to Singapore, we arranged our tour package with a Travel Agent Colombo, and we got a holiday package for Three people. We Ordered a TRIPLE room & paid also for THREE. After we went to the "Peninsula hotel" (4th November 2007) they had given, every thing only for two.(We got two single beds, Two cups for tea/Coffee, two toothbrushes & two water glasses).Then I went down to the reception & told to send an Extra bed. They said O.K. At around 9.00p.m. I ordered a Club Sandwich from room service too. After 5-6 reminders we got a bed to my mother around 10.30 p.m. After that I took another call and ask whether we can get the sandwich to my mother because she was very tired. Then that girl apologies for their delay, & ask another 15 minutes to send that. On the 7th we checked out from the hotel at 4.30 a.m. unfortunately I kept my SONY Video Camera with Cassettes & Batteries (worth LKR55,000/= ; all those in one bag) in the room, behind the TV & forgot to take that. It was a blue colour small bag. After I came to Sri Lanka I called to the hotel & told, “Morning around 3 o’clock ; I locked my bags and put all the keys inside the “Video Camera Bag” and kept it on the table, but I forgot to bring it down…, Please check whether it’s there?” They said “NO , Nothing”. But I know I kept that in the room may be some one stolen it. WHAT A POOR SERVICE THAT HOTEL GAVE US???? I never go to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in one week while I went into Malaysia in the time between. The location is terrific for exploring the central area. It is a short walk to the City Hall subway station which can connect you to all other parts of the island/nation. The Parliament building is only a block away. The riverfront with a wide variety food and drinks is only a few blocks away on Bridge street. The first room seemed dark and not lit very well, not a good room to work out of. The second room was 1814, which I was told was the honeymoon suite. It had plenty of terrific views of the city and was much more comfortable. It was better suited for work and/or play. In general, Singapore is very expensive and this hotel seemed reasonable for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: jyjj
Reviews.Content: I stayed in deluxe room at 12th floor in Excelsior tower for 2 days. The room was cosy and clean due to this room was renovated room. Location was great. Most convenient location. Shopping centre is located acoss the street and thre are so many restaurants around the hotel. Also very close to City Hall MRT station (around 2 mins walk) and close to Bugis Street as well. Concierge was courteous and friendly. If you are staying in this hotel, ask for renovated room. You'll not regret your stay when you stay in renovated room. I'll recommend this hotel to someone who is staying for short time due to room size is small .

Reviews.Title: “The most awful place on earth”
Reviews.Author: kristianpjones
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 12 nights in what is without a shadow of a doubt the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. From Central America through Europe into Central Asia I have never stayed in such an awful place. The rooms are terrible with the most awful lighting. However this pales into insignificance when compared to the service. It took 5 days alone for them to fix the television and it was a lottery as to whether I had clean towels placed in the room. Also the air conditioning worked shifts and never came on when you were in the room. Last but not least I must mention the food. If there is 1 piece of advice I can give you it is this. If you find yourself in the unfortunate position of having to stay in this hotel then do not under any circumstances eat the food. I can assure you it will spoil your stay on the Island. I leave you with this one piece of advice. DO NOT STAY IN THIS HOTEL!

Reviews.Title: “Below Average.”
Reviews.Author: trip_lang
Reviews.Content: Everything been said about this hotel is true. I wish i stayed in other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kingkong73
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotel I have ever stayed. For 3 people we paid around 200 USD. And they said the room that we complained about the cleanliness and smell is the executive room. If the room that we stayed was executive room I cant even imagine how the standard room is. On the other hand, the location of the hotel was good close to subway. I wouldn't recommend anybody to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as you think”
Reviews.Author: WallyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by Travel Agent, however on arrival and even though we had requested a non-smoking room, this was not the case. Room had a pungent odour which for a non smoker was very hard to put up with and I spose an excuse to get out and about in Singapore. We were promised a non-smoking room after night one but this did not happen. Overall I was dissapointed with the room and the service from the staff and the strange look I got when I refused to pay $7.00 for a can of Diet Coke. Go figure. I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Really disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LEGENDCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the Singapore Airlines stopover deal to spend time in Singapore on our way home Cape Town from Sydney. Our family has travelled extensively and I can say that without a doubt these have to be the worst hotel rooms we have ever had the misfortune to stay in. The rooms were old and shabby with damp, peeling patches on the walls and very inadequate lighting. The rooms were stuffy and poorly ventilated and the bathrooms are sadly in need of renovation. The towels were old and threadbare and the bed linen, although thankfully clean, has seen better days. On a more constructive note, the service from the staff at the front desk was fine and the lobby and swimming pools are misleadingly impressive. I would encourage anyone who is using the Singapore Airlines stopover deal to check out the individual hotels in each price category to see for themselves what they are actually letting themselves in for. We used the service before in April this year and for the same price we spent a night at the Novotel Hotel in Clarke Quay which was streets ahead of the Peninsula Excelsior. Let the traveller beware!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: petmeow
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Peninsula Tower of the Peninsula Excelsior Hotel. Check-in was slow. We arrived at around 1:30pm and had to line up for nearly 15 minutes, which wasn't surprising because we had to fill in a form for each room that included details like home address, occupation, etc, and each of the guests had to write their name and sign the form. The rooms still weren't ready by 2pm, so we decided to walk around instead of waiting endlessly. At least we were able to leave our luggage with the concierge. Room-wise, they were smaller than expected for a deluxe room (we received a free upgrade), but the rooms themselves and the bathrooms were very new and clean, which was a great thing. Interestingly, there were no mirrors at all in the room itself, not even in front of the desk / dressing table nor the closet. The only mirrors were in the bathroom - the big one in front of the sink and a small make-up mirror next to it. The tub strangely had no curtain so it's inevitable to have water everywhere after a shower. Location-wise, it was GREAT. Very close to City Hall MRT station (around 2 mins walk) ... and within walking distance to CHIJMES, Raffles Hotel and even Bugis Street. 2 streets down from the hotel is a computer mall, with a nice food court on the top floor, which was great for a simple breakfast. Overall, no complaints besides check-in. Probably not the best hotel in Singapore, but definitely could be considered for its location and price.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: dreemin2
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews here I knew what not to expect! It was the last available choice from the Airlines program. The hotel was central, decent and clean. Checked in late evening from a Singapore stopover holiday program and got the last smoking room(did not want it!) in the hotel. It was straight from the 70's and in desprate need of a renovation. Staff was good, just insist on a new room and confirm in writing in advance your requests(as I did not).

Reviews.Title: “Great View !!!”
Reviews.Author: luv2ravel
Reviews.Content: Fly by Singapore Airlines, take the stopover offer and choose this hotel only at £ 17 person/pernight (£34 single use), no breakfast but got lots of free vouchers (River Boat Tour, Zoo, Hop on Bus, Sentosa Island, BirdPark, Orchide Garden and many more), VERY good in value, welldone to Singapore Tourism Board! Central Location, yes the hotel bit old and the staff bit rude but they put us in the room with a great view and we're only 1 night, spent time spending the free attractions, at hotel just for sleep, so no complains. Go to Lau Pa Sak Food Market, open 24 hours, good food. My advice, fly by Singapore Airlines via Singapore then you're entitled to take this Stopover Promotions which gives you loads of free and discounted things (included choices of hotels) at a very good price. If you stay in Peninsula Excelsior, ask for the Boat Quay view, my room that time was in #2032.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely return here again!”
Reviews.Author: Honerskipers
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone! It was a promise kept and a birthday gift also to my girlfriend-- Ners--why we went to the Lion City in the first place. We really had the most difficult time trying to book for a hotel as most of the hotels in Singapore were fully booked (they said there was an international meeting of sorts going on that time). Anyway, when all hope was lost, our travel agent called me up to say she was able to booked us at the Peninsula Excelsior. So there we stayed for five days (October 20-24, 2007) and simply just had the most wonderful time--both in the hotel and in Singapore too! Checking in, we were upgraded, free of charge, by this petite Indian lady receptionist (Sharon, I think was her name) to a room at the 16th floor Excelsior tower. The room we stayed at offers an excellent view of the city, and was pleasantly made-up by the lady in charge of the 16th floor during our whole stay. To add, for a country with not much water resource--the water in the T & B was strong (though the bath tub could really use a fix--draining the water takes so much time). Well, yes, by the way, I hope they reconsider the prices of the stuff they offer at the mini-bar. It's really quite expensive as mentioned by another traveller. Anyway, I can't help it but just mention it here--what really almost put down our spirits in our trip to Singapore? The airline we used! I hate that airline so much! It's Jetstar Asia! Goodness, the interior was dirty, the stewardess impolite! Grrr... Their stewardess ruin the name of the profession! Instead of smiling, their faces seem to hate their work! Grr. Anyway, don't want to end this review with a sad note, so to Peninsula Excelsior, which is just so near to everything you want to visit in Singapore, thanks for the accomodation and hope to be back in your hotel! (Ooops, we love you breakfast too, I almost forgot to mention!)

Reviews.Title: “Peninsula average.. Singapore great!”
Reviews.Author: brock01
Reviews.Content: Singapore Peninsula Excelsior Hotel - Average Date: 26/09/07 Reviewer: 45 year old mum and dad from Adelaide Australia We have just returned from a trip to Singapore where we stayed at the Peninsula Excelsior. Upon check in we were kept waiting for around 15-20 minutes before we were even greeted by the reception staff. Our room was small and had a very floral bedspread. After 30 minutes in the room, I dialed the porter to to ask if we could possibly have our bags delivered. The pool is directly opposite the reception desk (behind glass windows so we were reluctant to swim because the world was watching you!) They are doing the hotel up at the moment and from the constant banging I think they were up to the 12th floor and on the way down. On a brighter note, the hotel was close to facilityies including shopping centres, river, train station and I can say that our tour booking agent in the hotel lobby (Dan) was wonderful. The tours were great too.. really enjoyed the laser show at Sentosa Island and the half day tour of the city (this takes in the likes of China town, little india and the botanic gardens.. a short trip and this gives you an idea of where you would like to go back to). I was very impressed with Singapore.. 4 day visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Orchid Room was Better”
Reviews.Author: riain
Reviews.Content: I was initially apprehensive to stay in this hotel after seeing the really bad reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. I got upgraded to the Orchid room on the 16th Floor for free. Apparently this was one of the renovated rooms.I had sweeping views of the bay, I can see the merlion, the fullerton, suntec, it was breathtaking. The service was okay. The breakfast tho needs a bit of more imagination, and sometimes there are no people in the gym. The location was superb - I just walked from Ministry of Sound to my hotel. The carpet in the hallways needed a change and the lobby was okay. Over all I had a nice time in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you have no other choice”
Reviews.Author: MikeCMelbourne
Reviews.Content: 2 Star Hotel at 4 star price. Stayed here because I couldn't find other hotels available. I am not fussy with hotels but I feel it is overpriced for the quality you get. But then, Singapore hotels are always full. Even the worst hotels are doing well with high occupancy rates. You can get the same quality at half the price in neighbouring Thailand and Malaysia Anyway, the location is great. Relatively clean. But old and worn. It will be a great hotel if it is 30% cheaper. There are a few other hotels that are better and cheaper, if you can book early! Just beware, internet booking are still subject to 7% GST and 5% service tax. And internet bookings are not entitled to a breakfast which made me quite upset. Would I stay here again? Not if I am paying myself. Even if my company paying, I'll try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: aisiatraveller
Reviews.Content: This Singapore Hotel was abysmal, the rooms were worn out not particularly clean, the bar very expensive S$12.50 for a Guiness. A poster in the lift announced that the hotel had gone through extensive renovations (must have used second hand gear ). THe delays at reception were unacceptable on check in and check out, thank goodness they were not busy. On my second visit a week later the room was no better and the breakfast, well, the fried eggs were off as the chef did not arrive until 7.30 am, all the food in the hot trays was luke warm and must have been prepared the night before and the lights put on underneath at 6.30 am I was in at 6.45 am. So no breakfast beforfe leaving for the airport. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother with this 1 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobcanada1214
Reviews.Content: Save your money, stay elsewhere.It's a 1 star hotel. Stay across the street at the Grand Plaza instead Stayed for 2 nights, the first room smell like public toilet. The floor was filhty The 2nd room was so so. Pillows were a foam rubber pillow. Did not make our room until 5:00 PM Only 2 towels for the 4 of us The list is on and on and on. Staff was unfriendly, hardly understand English

Reviews.Title: “Go Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: KiwichickAuckland
Reviews.Content: We were booked in here for 2 nights on a stop over from Europe. Reception is on the first floor. They certainly have delusions of grandeur calling themselves a resort hotel!! What!!! They must be joking. Staff were miserable no smiles of welcome ,room very average old and could do with an overhaul. No view at all just another hotel wall. Breakfast room depressing and breakfast the same we didn't bother. Location is good but you can do much for the money in Singapore. Avoid at all costs!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: DebbieB24
Reviews.Content: We were quite disappointed with the accommodation at the Peninsula Excelsior. Advertising depicted newly renovated, tastefully decorated rooms but our room certainly wasn't either of these. The Lobby was certainly quite outstanding but the rooms did not reflect this first impression we got on arrival. Our room was quite small, had 2 single beds - rock hard, so quite uncomfortable to sleep on. We discovered quite quickly that the walls of room were very thin - we could hear our neighbours using the toilet and shower, baby crying next door, people partying next door - so had difficulty sleeping. On the upside - this hotel is well positioned, close to Chinatown and City Hall MRT. Room was clean and tidy and staff helpful and relatively friendly. This was our 4th stay in Singapore and previous accommodation was great but we were very disappointed with this one. I would not stay there again but if you are not terribly fussy about small rooms, shabby furniture, hard beds, thin walls, noisy neighbours you may want to consider if you only want to stay for a couple of nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shabby rooms”
Reviews.Author: SB30
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location but the rooms were extremely dated and could use some modern decoration. The communal areas were nice though and both the pools were good. The drinks in the piano bar were too expensive but if you got the same drink in the lobby it was cheaper for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the pits”
Reviews.Author: SusieCanberra
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June 2007 for 2 nights with a late check out on the third (actually paying for the room for an extra night). Returning on the last afternoon for a shower before a late flight - the room had not been serviced (although I'd paid ) - no dry towels and no toilet paper. I asked for them but they didn't turn up. The reception staff are rude and incompetent. The room stank. The hair dryer didn't work and when told the staff did nothing about it. The furnishings are thread bare. The fridge was iced up and not able to be used. The restaurant staff are incompetent and paying $(S)12 for a third of a glass of wine was excessive. Breakfast should be avoided like the plague. It resembled a pig pen with people pushing and shoving to get food - tables and food recepticals are not cleaned regularly. Internet charge of $1 a minute is ridiculous but a place across the road charges $1 for 15 minutes. Avoid thi place at all costs if you wish to enjoy your stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Depends on your needs”
Reviews.Author: mhayli
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in May, before moving onto Bali. After we booked our holiday (travel agent recommended this hotel), I read the TripAdvisor reviews and became a bit apprehensive. I need not have worried. It suited our needs at a reasonable price. Sure, it isn't the flashest hotel around (it kind of reminded me of a family run motor inn in some Australian country town), I found it clean and comfortable. Our room in the Excelsior tower was directly behind the lifts, so the noise could have been troublesome. However, I have travelled enough to know not to go anywhere without a pair of earplugs. Breakfast in the Orchid Room filled the hole. Nothing to write home about, but better than going hungry. Our time in Singapore was all about getting out and seeing the sites, so the hotel really was just a place to sleep (and the odd swim in the pool). If this is what you are after, then this hotel may fit the bill. If you are after a bit of luxury and get perturbed by ants on the table at breakfast or chipped baths, try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deeheath
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a shock as as it had been recommended by our agent as being central and good value for money. The hotel was grubby, seedy and very run down. We had torn bed linen. The bath was chipped and the toilet did not flush properly On the second day of our stay it rained and Orchid breakfast room ceiling leaked onto our breakfast. The staff were not fazed by this and pulled the table from the wall to revel the carpet had shrunk by about 2inched from the skirting. This didn't happen overnight! On two occasions days the food was very bad. Our first stay was for 4 days. As we were returning to Singapore 10 days later fearing that the room would be the same, we paid $AU50.00 for an upgrade to a "de luxe suite". We made a grave error in judgment we should have changed hotels. It cost us hard earned money. The room was worse. It was smaller and more grubby and run down. We did have a mini bar and bath robes, but the wall paper was hanging off the walls, and again the complementary holes in the bedding. When we complained the staff were very unhelpful. We were told there were no alternative room to be had, and to take our complaint's up with our agent. In reception on the 18th May there were at least 18 -20 other people who were there to complain. Not an ideal situation I asked to speak to the duty manager, but she was not availabe, and remain so for the remainder of our stay! The hotel was in an ideal location within walking or MRT distance of all amenities. What a shame to let this hotel get to this state .It was so run down. To sum up the hotel, in my opinion,was not good value for money. It was grubby, seedy and run down establishment with harassed staff that were uncaring.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: opgp
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a couple of times and both times the experience was disappointing. The first time it was recommended by a travel agent and as it was just a quick overnight stop we weren't all that bothered. Our room was in the Peninsula tower, it was very tired, musty and we were disturbed several times while trying to sleep. The second time we chose to stay there, despite our better judgement because we were meeting up with an elderly relative who already had a booking there. The checkout procedure was incredibly slow, staff were not very helpful or friendly. We arrived on an early flight and were kept waiting around for nearly three hours in the lobby before being allocated a room. The room itself was quite nice, on a high floor in the Excelsior wing and looked like it had been renovated recently (this was in 2004). When I booked in I asked about late checkout and was informed I could probably have the room until 3pm but to confirm this on the day (our flight didn't leave until midnight), however when it was time to leave I was told we couldn't keep the room past 12pm which was quite inconvenient and meant we really couldn't do anything before going to the airport. My other main complaint was the poor quality of the breakfast - I have travelled a lot and this would definitely rate as the WORST hotel breakfast buffet I have ever experienced. The selection of food was very poor, and didn't really change from day to day. Overall I had the impression that this hotel was a factory for package tourists - they didn't worry about service or impressions because there would always be plenty more arriving. It is a shame because the location of the hotel was great and prices were OK.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Hotel close to all”
Reviews.Author: Youngy388
Reviews.Content: If you want to get out of the Orchard Road tourist belt and stay somewhere close to Clarke Quay, Suntec, Raffles etc, this is the place. The hotel is tired and could do with a refurbishment, however, if you are only there to sleep this is excellent. The service at Reception is average and the room we were in had water hammer noise all afternoon but the views were excellent. We had our daughter (11) with us which made the room "cosy", however it suited our purpose. The hotel is within walking distance of Clarke and Boat Quay, is across the road from City Hall MRT, and we walked to Raffles, Suntec, the Merlion and had shopping centres with "best price" straight away. Average but comfortable hotel with very good security, good views and two Great pools. Good for the Budget Conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “When was it renovated 1981?”
Reviews.Author: fidsboy
Reviews.Content: The biggest piece of false advertising I ever came accross. The hallways were filthy and falling apart, the room was very old with faulty plumbing. As per usual there were no non-smoking rooms available even though one was requested. The staff were borderline usless and any request got a blank look. Don't bother eating breakfast there, there is a cafe accross the road that is 1/2 the price and better.

Reviews.Title: “stop whinging,”
Reviews.Author: TravellerRockhampton
Reviews.Content: have stayed at this hotel about seven times over the past few years. have always enjoyed my stay, no complaints whatsoever, staff always polite and curteous. Always found the food to be good with a very good selection at breakfast. would suit couples and families on a budget as excellent location. Only drawback, no entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, but very dated and musty.”
Reviews.Author: Welly_China_Girl
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Peninsular Excelsior hotel a few times over the last 10 years, but this was one of the worst hotel experiences I've had. Booked it through Singapore Stopovers (my travel agent recommended against it but it was my choice because of the location and it was perfectly fine last time I stayed - Jan-06). In summary - Great location, clean (if very musty smell), polite but ok service if you are persistant - WARNING - don't stay in the Peninsular side (rooms appear to be much older and smellier) PLUS there seems to be renovations happening in the Peninsular tower between March - June 2007 9am to 6:30 pm - lots of banging and drilling - check with the reception when you check-in. Stay here for the location only. ******* Our early morning flight got us to the hotel at 8am - there wasn't a room available, so we were advised (after standing in a queue for 20 mins) to return at 12. When we came back just there was room as specified (non-smoking and double-bed), and the bags were sent up promptly. However - the room was on the 15th floor of the Peninsular wing - horrible casino-green carpet and very dated fittings, and smelt very musty. Room was properly cleaned though and all the right amenities and since we didn't sleep on the plane, we went straight to bed. Only to be woken up 30 mins later by housekeeping / maintenance, and then 5 mins after that, by horrendous banging and drilling. Got dressed, back down to reception and asked for a new room. None available, but one would be at 6pm. Came back at 6:30pm - message had not been passed on, and only room available was a smoking room. Got a bit more persistant, and were finally upgraded to a suite on the Excelsior side. Room was huge, slightly old but reasonable furniture & fittings - but room smelt very musty still. Maybe the sprinklers went off sometime in the last year and things were never dried out properly ... staff appear to be very helpful but very frustrating having to wait almost 12 hours for a basic room! The only good thing about this hotel is its location and views. Did not try the pool

Reviews.Title: “Great location and forget the rest.”
Reviews.Author: vandenhaak
Reviews.Content: This was the third time we checked in here. In other years the Peninsula and Excelsior had both a seperate reception, but this time their was one reception desk for both towers. The reception was renovated and looked OK for us. Then we went to our room. The room was totally worn out. In room safe was out of order and everything looked shabby. However when you book this hotel with the SIA stopover program, the price is for Singaporian standards very low. The location is superb. Many historical sites within walkin distance like Singapore river, boat quay, Raffles hotel, many shopping malls and when is something too far to walk the metro is just around the corner. So forget the room it is just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Agreed with previous writers”
Reviews.Author: West_Aussie-7
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Singapore and agree with previous writers about the Excelsior Hotel. I thought with the time lapse between 2004 and now something might have been done. Reception area looks great and so are the pools but you dont spend a lot of time there.We were on the twelve floor next to the lift well and I thought the lifts were coming through the wall. The bathroom was certainly small and the bed was just ok(time to be replaced.) Security were asked to come and unlock the safe in our daughters room but never arrived after 5 day Great location but its time for major R&R

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JazzieCat
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reports about this hotel I asked my travel agent to try to change hotels for our stopover to Bali. She was only able to change our 2 night return trip due to hotels being full due to Chinese New Year. So we had to stay there for one night on our way to Bali. We arrived at the hotel at 1 am and were prepared for the worst. We were pleased to see that they put us in a non-smoking room and upgraded us to a suite on the Excelsior side. Although the room was a bit musty (we did a quick spray with a body spray I had brought), we thought the room was quite nice. It was done in an art deco style and was extremely clean. The bathroom was starting to show a bit of age but I've seen much worse. Unfortunately, our pickup was for 5:30 the next morning, so we didn't get to enjoy the room or the other hotel amenities. The staff was very friendly and efficient. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: limehog
Reviews.Content: Read a lot of negative comments abt this hotel but got no choice as SIA's stopover package gave us only two choices, Peninsula Excelsior or Furama City Centre which was full when we tried to booked. We stayed two nights in The Peninsula tower. Room is small (slightly bigger than the rooms in the business hotels in Japan). Carpet lookd horrible. The double bed is very small. The bath room is not that clean. No hand towels or face towels. Found a list of items with prices with statment saying that any items missing or damaged would be charged to customer's account. So we checked everything in the room and dound many items missing. Went to the receptionist and were told standard rooms dont carry all the items. What about the hand towels and face towels? "Oh, they should be there" was the reply. Finally had the hand towels and face towels delivered to our room. However, they disappeared the next day even though two of them were never used Location is reasonable but quite a walk to the subway station with so many complaints about the Peninsular Excelsior, dont understand why SIA still offer them to customers. It is definitely doing harm to the reputation of SIA

Reviews.Title: “Worst Singapore Experience”
Reviews.Author: dhivehi
Reviews.Content: I stayed 7 nights at Excelsior Tower Superior room and 3 nights at the Peninsular tower deluxe room. Apart from the location there is nothing good about this hotel and its staff. The carpets and quilt smelled like rotten fish. The in-room safe didn’t work. The toilet looked like a garden of fungi and mould. Grout kept falling from the wall tiles. Water from the wash basin came like that of a shower head and the shower water came exactly like a basin faucet. Mixing a humanly tolerable amount of hot water to the shower was impossible. They said the maximum amount for in-room wired internet usage per 24 hours was $20. However on check out I was billed $37 for the first day. The casher had no idea why! She kept saying that some other company is responsible for internet billing. So please avoid this place at any cost. If you prefer this location just book the Grand Plaza Park Royal which is opposite Peninsular Excelsior.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful and very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: phillipislandfamily
Reviews.Content: This hotel has only a great location with nice views and unfortunately that is where it ends The rooms where well below average and the breakfast in a very unorganized dining room ,was far from pleasant. Food was not very good at all and could not wait to leave the premises . The hotel itself was not clean and room were small and very worn out and grubby .Would not stay there again It has a pool which is with in full view of the lobby area and the pool it self has transparent sides which was interesting to say the least. Not good value for money better alternatives are advisable

Reviews.Title: “ruined end of holiday”
Reviews.Author: gullivertravel
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on January 2nd 2007 after a 12 hour flight from Auckland.The foyer and Reception looked well but It was doomed from there on. Very unpleasant receptionist, no welcome, no questions, zero regard for preferences. We were booked on the 14th floor and on entering the room I cried (and i do not cry often) The most old fashioned, dirty, poorly maintained and tired room i have ever had the displeasure of staying in. A twin when we requested a double, a rusty bath, no reception on the tv., brown blinds on the windows, mildewed shower curtain, taped electrics and broken sockets. Absolutely no help on accomodating us in another room even though requested twice. I have sent my grievences to the Singapore Stopover Agency, but I dont know if it will help. Based on my experience this hotel should be blacklisted from the Stopover hotel list.

Reviews.Title: “hatred of a stinking dirty room”
Reviews.Author: ronmarg
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I have stayed at the Excelsior Hotel on many occasions over the past 10 years. and again on 15 th August 2006 When it has been most satisfactory. I Stayed again on 1st September. I arrived late after a long flight, I waited 35 Minutes for the reception, to allocate me a room. I was allotted room 1169. After a late meal, I returned to find that the bathroom had not been cleaned, the toiley dirty, shower goods still in the bath. The bed had been made, the bed linen and blankets were putred and so stinking they had to be placed on the floor. The room smell was rotten. Being too exhausted i did not request another room. but I did make a written report to the management on my departure. Now after 9 weeks I have not received the courtisy of a reply or apology or the offer of a refund. We will be seeking a clean hotel room on March 11 th. I would suggest that the management offer me the occupancy of a clean room on that date in lieu of the filthly room we paid for. [--]

Reviews.Title: “Peninsula or Excelsior?”
Reviews.Author: Teddy-E
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pen-Ex for one night on the way to Malaysia and it was fine. Check-in very quick. Pool was was very nice and room was more than adequate (complete with sofa backing on to the window). I have stayed at the Peninsula a few times in the past and have enjoyed the central location. This time we were in the Excelsior. Are the beds bigger in the Peninsula? Is it my imagination?

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: MR&KAC
Reviews.Content: It was with some considerable trepidation that we approached our room on the 7th floor of the Excelsior Tower for a 5 night stay having read previous reviews. Imagine our surprise to find a clean room with everything working. Sure it is not the newest hotel in town but we could find nothing to complain about. The location is exellent - a short walk to the City Hall MRT and numerous restaurants. It is certainly not 5 star but the rates are reasonable (by Singapore standards) and it was definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: ichiban
Reviews.Content: Our stay was in July 2001, so my memory has faded. I remember a problem at check-in, but was my fault as the room was booked through a 3rd party and I did not have all necessary details. They did accommodate us in the end. Our room was situated quite a distance from the elevator and we had to run holding our noses and our breath due to the smell ( a blend of body odor and mildew) in the hallways, which are not air-conditioned. My son enjoyed the pool. We made use of the excursions that could be arranged with pick-up at the hotel. We did not eat in the hotel as there are MANY wonderful places to eat in Singapore. There is a shopping center (I don't remember the name) that has something for all appetites in their food court.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Singapore for a 5 night stay. On arrival the lobby appeared refurbished and well presented, unfortunately that is where the experience ended. Our room was on the 16th floor of the Excelsior tower. This is quite possibly the worst hotel room i have ever seen. I don't even know where to begin. The linen was stained and cigarette burns on it, the toilet would not flush, there was copious amounts of mould in the bathroom. The front door and the door to the bathroom where falling off there hinges. To my partner and I we could not believe the state of the room, the only good thing was the view of Boat Quay. Needless to say we got no response when we rang reception to complain about the state of the room. So first thing to do was visit internet cafe and find alternate accommodation. Unfortunately we had to spend the first night in this hellhole as we did not find any other accommodation till the following night. If we had to stay in this hotel for the whole 5 nights our visit to Singapore would have been the worst ever. The breakfast provided on the first morning was about as good as we thought, that is terrible. All I can say is DONT DO IT if you are thinking of staying here. There is no way that this hotel is 3 1/2 stars. It would be lucky to be 1 star.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: tiah
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four days after a month long trip to Thailand. I would have to say that this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. To start with my husband and I were given two tiny single beds that we were told to 'push together' if we wanted to. The bathroom was dirty and covered with mould and the grout in the tiles was peeling off everywhere. The toilet was extremely difficult to flush, sometimes taking 10 or 11 goes. The water pressure in the shower was so strong that a child or elderly person would have had trouble standing up and the heat temperature fluctuated between luke warm to absoultely burning hot - very dangerous. The walls are so thin that we lay there at night listening to other people 'doing things' in other rooms, people flushing the toilet, having conversations that we could clearly hear across the hallway etc. The rooms are very run down and require renovating. The money has been spent on the foyer and one of the pools - not that we got to use this as there was maintenance going on. We used the second pool and this was very dirty, pool chairs dirty etc. The fitness centre was great with the latest equipment, state of the art everything. Service at the restaurant was terrible and extremely slow, food was ok except for the blow fly that was in the bottom of my husbands milkshake. I think that this hotel spoilt our trip to Singapore as we had a negative feeling right from the start. I had read other reviews on this site but thought 'oh it can't be that bad' but let me tell you - STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE. I consider myself a pretty easy going person and am tolerant to most things but have never had such an awful experience. Hope this helps others plan their trip not to include this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location and rates, OK service”
Reviews.Author: nmurug
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days in a deluxe room at the Peninsula. Great location, great views from my room on 17th floor at the older Peninsula block. Service was average, the breakfast room was crowded and the food was of average quality. The best things were the rates and the location. So if you want a convenient hotel that is clean without being special, this will suit you. I will try a different place the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: chuckenpen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our way to Austrailia, our travel agent booked it for us. Needless to say we didn't use that travel agent anymore. The hotel is located near lots of shops and restaurants, about a 15min walk to the Esplande and the Opera house, which is beautiful. We had a great view from our room i think that is what saved the hotel really from being written off. The rooms were clean but dated early 70's, the foyer was lovely and the pool excellent. There is not much room for sunbathing around it though. We didn't eat in the hotel at all as it didn't look appealing. There was not much of a bar there either. The staff were lovely and very helpful i couldn't fault them.

Reviews.Title: “Find A Different Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was 3 nights from March 17-20 2006. I read the hotel web site indicating that the property had been updated 4 years ago. The only thing done was the lobby--the rooms have not been touched. My first room was in the Excelsior tower. I asked for a non-smoking room and was given one on a non-smoking floor. Clearly this floor had recently been made non-smoking. There were cigarette burns in the carpet and the smell of stale smoke permeated the room. The overall cleanliness of the room left much to be desired. There was mold and mildew in the shower and all the taps dripped. I was moved to another room in the Peninsula tower. This room had a similar level of cleanliness but this room instead had a peculiar odor that seemed like a cross between tiger balm and mothballs. The looby and pools are beautiful and the location is excellent but I wouldn't stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Peninsula Excelsior Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: No.5 Coleman Street, Singapore 179 805, Singapore
